-tV96_0ja5Da_b-0_aMOBQ.text: Sandwiches are so big you have to split them. Food is good but nothing special. If you are looking for a quick meal in Vegas this is it. But don't expect a sandwich to be cheap. The open faced is 22$

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Open faced Reuben with thousand island dressing
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Reuben

gMmhWqel_I9a6GznSK0BXQ.text: Rye and Woody Allen (corned beef and pastrami) - 20 bucks for an 8 inch high Everest of slim sliced beef between two pieces of store quality rye bread. Having had Katz's in Manhattan, I'd say that their pastrami on rye is still the winner. But, when in Vegas, Carnegie is a pretty decent substitute.   Complimentary pickles (3 large, mostly dill and butter) were a nice touch. So was the iced coffee with free refills: almost a good deal when on the Strip; "only" $3.50 for an approximately 20 oz glass. Table also has squeeze bottle horseradish sauce.  Open 24 hours; slow service. Probably the best perk of them all. If you want to save room for dessert (which is suggested if you like huge cheesecakes and black and white cookies!!), split your sandwich for $3 extra. To go bags were good enough for the plane.   Other noteworthy interesting menu items: lettuce and tomato sandwich; breakfast items; bagels and fruit cups for lighter appetites; grilled cheese for vegetarians (but no veggie sandwich); pretty much, the usual large assortment of items on a typical New York deli menu.

p-kb1M_eZZU3uFeal_lCWg.text: Huge delicious sandwiches served 24/7.   We were on the go between seeing the tigers and checking out Hershey's world and we picked this spot on the fly.   My sweetheart and I shared a giant melt in your mouth hot pastrami sandwich. It was just soft rye bread, the best pastrami ever and that's it. There was nothing else on the sandwich and there didn't need to be. We declared it the best hot pastrami sandwich ever.   Note- the sandwiches are not for just one person. They are food network extreme eating challenge sized. We were way more hungry than usual and barely conquered the ginormous delicacy. Also this place is pretty expensive. We spent around $50 on a sandwich some fries, coleslaw and two drinks.

ajFbpAmbrd11fpAlf-W6KQ.text: Had to do a late run for chicken soup as my wife was sick (flu) and needed to find something she could keep down. Mentioned this to guy at register and he personally shepherded my order through. I got a Reuben which was huge and the pricing for what you get is actually not outrageous if you consider you'll be noshing on that sandwich for two days.  Thanks Carnegie deli. She's feeling better. Not great but better.

LF5L59aUqnlR1slQ0y06fw.text: Fantastic! Had a reuben with pastrami and sauerkraut. Huge! Shared it with my husband and we still brought home half. Started with the chicken noodle soup. Very comforting and nice, not fancy. Enjoyed it. Finished with the classic cheesecake. Brought half home too. Creamy, moist, I'm drooling. Our was fabulous. Can't wait to New York and eat at the Carnegie there.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pastrami Reuben

3wDLQlWPyQs8ip-teVJrRA.text: If your idea of a great sandwich is two pieces of rye bread and a pound each of corned beef and pastrami, you'll love Carnegie deli.  The meats are lean and tasty.  But that's all that I can say that's good about Carnegie.  The problems include: sandwich was dry, ambiance and service is "New York casual", which is not meant as a compliment, and it takes a while to get your food.    But you get a lot of meat for your money, and no one can say Carnegie Deli pretends to be much more than what it delivers.

uRZUwkaFOj3o2QbrsIXG4g.text: Our food came out cold .. Which I have no idea how that was possible since it was sitting under the heating lamp for 20mins !!! That you can see from your table. Meat wasn't seasoned ! Asked the waitress to take it back and she was happy to but that's only because they warmed it up in the oven instead of making a fresh one .. The pictures look great .. But there was is way better food in Vegas believe me !

2IPAdPZoxiWL6CTzPILuAA.text: My husband and I always make a stop here while in Vegas, for a corned beef sammy, cheesecake, or both! If it's crowded, it is definitely worth the wait. Anything you order can be shared as the portions are huge!

yZBf50eUA49e5013ZWLQsA.text: Came for a quick lunch before hitting the road back to reality. Hubby always wants a Hot Pastrami and daughter loves Corned Beef. Both were happy with their sandwiches, which were made a tad smaller than normal due to the Restaurant Week special.  Mom's blintzes were plain awful. They were more like a deep-fried concoction you would find at a county fair, rather than the delicious blintzes I enjoyed at Carnegie in New York. My latkes were bland, but nice and crispy.   Refills were free, unlike the NYC location, and the service was friendly and efficient.  I would go back next time we're at the Mirage, but I wouldn't order the blintzes ever again.

q7o8-0Z-cm8fmZysTDiFJw.text: When I first saw this place it looked good. I ordered the brisket sandwich and I was expecting a sandwich that I could actually eat! There was so much meat and it just made it gross. I couldn't even pick up the sandwich. I know this is how they do it in many delis but it was just brisket there was no sauce. Also you could tell the waiter was angry and that made the place not have a warm feeling.

UTITEHSQqSSt702IjnS2vw.text: I gave them 4 stars for quality of service! Courteous, kind and attentive staff, and the food hits the spot.

4Y2rlcCIaUNkxN629BAwDw.text: Food is pretty good, but the cashier was pretty rude. I had to explain my simple order to him several times and he was very irritated. He also refused to make substitutions to my order even though the menu clearly states they do for an extra charge. Save your money and try some other place on the strip.

a5qHxjHKlvW40bqTMkQHyA.text: My boyfriend was raving about this place for ever, so he took me here for an afternoon surprise. When we got there the wait was about 10-15 minutes, and it was really crowded and busy. I was excited, because I heard nothing but great things.   When we finally sat down to order, the menu just did not seem appetizing, their was nothing on their that interested me- and it all seemed kind of unusual.   I also didn't like that you could not change around their sandwiches- like remove the Swiss cheese and add provolone- I hate Swiss cheese- So I was forced to create my own sandwich. OH BOY! The thing was huge.   Like I could not even eat it, and had to use a fork and knife- I totally hate that- I was just expecting something different.   My boyfriend had a great time- which was the most important part- and I acted like I enjoyed every bit of it lol... I didn't want to upset him.   When the check came, I thought the bill was ridiculous, because they charged him extra for all my sides- Who does not put cheese, lettuce, tomato or onion on their sandwich...? Well I think I had to pay like $10 alone just for my side items.   Also they were so busy that it took forever to get drinks, or our food.   Overall the sandwich was okay, and it was fun to enjoy something new and a restaurant that is supposedly famous..?

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

c6pnqFRzSjtkjBXd4OTfEg.text: I'm a simple kind of man... every time I go to the Carnegie Deli in The Mirage, I am there for one thing and one thing only - the hot pastrami on rye. Add some swiss cheese and your in heaven.   A word of advice however - share a sandwich or eat half and take home the other half for later. They are freakin huge!  A staple every time we visit Las Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is just the half of it.

dfc5_hN_ph7OKSBC-Xyhcw.text: MEH is the word to describe Carnegie. Only came here because we were tired, hungry, and it was inside the hotel. Came here with my cousin for some dinner. No line. Our waitress was super friendly. The two stars are mainly for her.  $23.99 for a crappy open faced reubin...ehhh. I got a turkey one and about the only edible part was the turkey. It was slathered with melted swiss and the dressing was served on the side. Sorry. Not a good sandwich.  Greek Salad...so-so. Nothing special especially for around $18. It was large though. Enough for two people.  Fries were about the only decent part. Nice and crispy. Highly recommended by our waitress.  For $50 what a crap-shoot of a meal. We barely ate much aside from some salad and fries. I would not come back here. I know restaurants in Vegas are expensive no matter what/where you eat but seriously. The food was not worth it. Also, the sandwiches or other meals do not come with a side. So that's right...nearly $24 for a stupid tasteless sandwich by itself folks. It's sadly not what you would expect.

OtdD2yrLqfa8RYrnCKW8CA.text: We stopped there on our last night at the Mirage around 8:00.. Pushed thru...I decided to get it to go and you would have thought I said I wanted it for free.  The looks and all over attitudes. Got the sandwiches up to the room. I got BLT..yeah right... I got a bacon sandwich. Had to be 15 pieces of bacon, one thin slice of tomato and I small slice of lettuce, looks absolutely nothing like the picture. Husband got pastrami. It was so fatty he couldn't it, paid 42.00 for nasty sandwich's and nasty customer service.

Zlb8oXMHLok_AuegMGhgeA.text: Best Pastrami sammich that I have ever had!  Not only was the food great but 5 stars for service as well.  Every employee went out of their way to take care of me.  I wish I would have caught his name but a young hispanic server went above and beyond for me around 2 p.m. on August the 16th.  That is the kind of customer service experience that people come to Las Vegas for.

AejMtVmvZQxqY-GfYf2XFg.text: Have been coming here for years, and the service and food gets worse every time I come here. Even my waitress said the place is not what it once was and she is trying to transfer to another dinning facility at the Mirage. The service is awful and the fact that you order at the counter before your seated is so stupid. This is my last visit to the Carnegie...I'm so disappointed...

MyjSE3rdq5iQOrMrARXOYg.text: I'm pretty sure i was half asleep, or fully asleep while being here at 2-3AM....BUT...they played good music.  i remember this because i woke up to my party singing Boys II Men 'End of the Road' as a chorus line, and having the entire restaurant joining in. A scene out of a movie. If their employees can handle that, i'm sure this is a great place. I partially remember eating half of a burger...didn't complain so it must've been decent. I absolutely love 24 hour diners in Vegas, it's perfect for after the club. It's no taco shop in San Diego, but its a perfect Vegas alternative!

uUT0_FAvmW2NP6KJMsd8TQ.text: Nobody does Corned Beef and Pastrami like the Carnegie does Corned Beef and Pastrami.  This is a pretty darned close close to the Original on 7th Avenue.  There's Kosher Salamis hanging over the deli counter, drying to savory goodness.  The dessert case is drool-inducing.  It's even got the same black and white checkered tile floor as the original.  The old standby, the Woody Allen, ($17.95) stands higher than 6 inches, absolutely STUFFED with Corned Beef and Pastrami.  It's easily a sharer.  (There is a sharing charge, but if that bothers you, get it to go and eat it back in your hotel room.)  The Corned Beef is delectably packed with flavor and just fatty enough, and the spice of the Pastrami cuts through the richness.  The service here is not as rushed as in NYC, nor are the tables quite as closely packed (But they are tight.)  The cheesecake is as imposingly large as it is delicious.  I stick with the Fresh Strawberry.  I gotta say:  The pickles are better in NYC.  But being that this is 2000 miles away, and in the middle of a desert, I'd say the Carnegie @ Mirage does a fine job of living up to its' reputation.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. NY Style Cheesecake with Strawberries @ the Carnegie

zr3OScjFlCOLOLHdEocpDQ.text: Food was good, service slow, overpriced..There were 8 of us there, and we ordered four meals to split....  Pastrami Sandwiches and Fries...   No Alcohol, and our bill was 157.40..  Like the food, but will not go back for that..

j2JdbZE9Hrxa84gDiGq3pQ.text: My mom and I have been coming to Carnegie once a year for at least 5 years on our annual trip and we were so sad to find that Carnegie has down sized their menu and turned this into a walk up- semi fast food place! We always get the corn beef Reuben and split it  and this year we were really disappointed! Smaller portion, very little cheese, tasteless sauerkraut  and stale bread :( and our pickles that they used to serve table side and were always two different flavors were just one flavor and so inedible! What happened Carnegie?????    Please change back!!!!

uTDPV9WWK4Q6iX6ZtWORkg.text: Worth the try, but not worth the cut.  Since last being in Vegas many moons ago, I reminisced about the Stage Deli in The Forums. Where their deli sandwiches were the best we've ever had and the cheesecake flown in fresh from NYC were the ultimate.  Recently we came across Carnegie Deli, located in the Mirage and it looked impressive with their own cured meats. Sandwiches were thicker than I could stretch my mouth and it made my eyes physically look bigger than my stomach.   Tonight we tried the corned beef sandwich which like many reviews it was very good, with perfect flavorings and very tender. We also tried the hot pastrami, it lacked flavor and was very disappointing considering the proportion of the sandwich.  I had to add a LOT of pepper to make it taste decent. Lastly, we had to try the "famous" burger, which they advertise that they grind the burger meat themselves. Thumbs up for making a juicy burger, but again that lacked flavor.  It's almost like going to a steakhouse and ordering a succulent, juicy porterhouse and they don't season it.

-dSDlxMxXC5R90oDQY7UMA.text: So a certain holiday just passed around the corner and what better way to celebrate than to roadtrip with a couple of the homies to Vegas! We originally intended to hit up the Grand Canyon, but logic came to our senses and we decided otherwise.   For once, I don't have a sweet description of the place. It's quite typical really as it's located inside The Mirage. I mean, I guess they feel the need to offer several types of cuisines for those that have different moods and appetites. And that's understandable. But when using such a name like Carnegie, one should at least match the quality and ingredients that go into a meal. Not saying that I didn't enjoy of course.   When ordering, they were missing several key ingredients like Rye Bread and such. How can you run an establishment without a staple in some sandwiches?! I'm normally not very critical and quite understanding, but no Rye? Makes me wanna go Homer status. All good though as I ordered myself an open-bread Turkey and Gravy along with Mashed Potatoes or the Nosh, Nosh Nanette (apparently, named after a musical). The portions are HUUUUUUUUUUUGE!!!!! How do I put a mental image on you fellow yelpers and yelpettes?! If the Hulk, the Juggernaut, and the Blob all went through what Goku and Vegeta do when they fusion and form one being......  ....alright, I exaggerated just a tiny bit. But you guys get what I'm trying to put across.   So other than them missing ingredients and such, I was actually pretty satisfied withe the whole experience. Adding of course that we drove the  Valley and enjoying our meal at 4AM and missing class the same morning, it was still quite delicious. I didn't get to have their cheesecake this time as I was ready to explode, put back into pieces, and blow up again! Of course, this doesn't compare to their Manhattan location (except for the service, cause them east coast peeps can be vicious for this poor little valley boy...NOT) but it did the job. So whenever you're around The Mirage, stop by and give it a try.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. FEAAAAAAAST!!!!!
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. sloppy as eff

OmoiWsZVC2gqEDBrXrViVA.text: I'm not sure what's the big deal about this place. I believe many people come here for the pastrami sandwich, but the looks of it grosses me out. There is WAY too much pastrami, to the point where someone could have a heart attack right there and then. (Good thing I am CPR certified!)  Anyways, the fries here were average. I have had much better. They were not seasoned well. I tried the chicken noodle soup, but to my surprise when I opened the carton all I saw were noodles. Excuse me, I ordered CHICKEN noodle soup, not noodle soup. I was disappointed!  There was no vegetables or anything else in there. The flavor was also very bland. Next  I tried the egg and ham sandwich, and once again it lacked flavor. This place is pricey, and definitely not worth your taste buds to try.

r9xRpYipiRmlc29QZSWipw.text: Those ads they have in the Mirage for this place are killer when you're hungry.  Look at all that freaking meat!  Too bad having a pound of pastrami between two tiny slices of bread is only great in theory.  I ordered the hot pastrami sandwich here.  The sandwich is indeed huge, and the pastrami itself was pretty good, but after eating the sandwich, I began to realize how much I LIKE having some greens, mayo, and cheese in my sandwiches.  The sandwich exploded after a few bites anyway so it almost became just eating a plate full of pastrami with some bread.  I found myself licking grease off the roof of my mouth after the meal, which kinda just made me feel very unhealthy.  I tried a bit of their regular cheesecake.  It's different from a lot of other cheesecakes you'll find, because it's a lot creamier and taller, but it was lacking in flavor.  If you do order a cheesecake, don't order it plain.  In conclusion: You get what they advertise, but after the first few bites, you may realize that it's not a good thing.

CtVjE7Ms00AB-taqMB7mRw.text: I have always enjoyed Carnegie Deli, but not sure what happened this trip!  The prices seemed over the top and maybe it was just me being frugal, but charging $14,00 for 2 little cups of lemonade for a 2 yr. old and a 5 yr. old, seemed a little extravagant!  No refills, and hardly touched - I could have cooked a whole meal for that price!   Also on the menu was a pastrami sandwifch, a hamburger, some french fries, and french toast.  Total cost of lunch $85+  Sorry, but I won't be back.  I can find food just as good without being taken advantage of!

x-4naifHMnHIkkU0u6aYMA.text: Their pastrami sandwich is awesome not salty at all. The price is quite expensive for a sandwich. The service is almost non existent. The night we were there we were served by a filipino lady. She is border line rude. We probably will order to go next time and eat our sandwiches in our room instead.

nSxuYeyyRMhPteXWovYsqQ.text: I loved my huge roast beef/turkey sandwich. We split 3 ways and had leftovers. Would definitely visit again.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2FoYWkcgHG3uaY7aqZOISA.text: So under normal circumstances I would never pay $15 for a pastrami sandwich, but I was in one of my preggers-like food craving moods where I felt like at this moment in time I ABSOLUTELY POSITIVELY NEEDED PASTRAMI  And pastrami I shall have!  When I finally received my pastrami sandwich, I was pleasantly surprised to find a sandwich bigger than my face!  This was nothing like the pastrami sandwiches we had back in San Diego!  However, I was not so pleasantly surprised to find that this Goliath of a pastrami sandwich did not contain any tomatoes, lettuce or even swiss cheese, a pastrami sandwich staple!    I quickly got over that fact when I finally bit into the thing.  The meat was juicy, tender and seasoned to perfection, and the rye bread was soft and delicious.  The sandwich also comes with a side of deli mustard (yessss!) and a pickle, and was so big I split it with a friend and still had enough left over for breakfast.  Carnegie would have received 4 stars only I remember the customer service being a bit on the sub-par side and tomatoes and lettuce were an additional $3.75.  Really?  Really?

bz24gIEnc-ttEiLW71Q9VQ.text: I've been here a dozen times over the years and it never disappoints.  This time I had the Bologna Omelette and it was awesome as always.  The home fried potatoes were great as well.   I will definitely be back next time I am in Vegas.  Bring your appetite as servings are huge and that makes up for the price, I think.

P5Mi1Kmx2LFoUOnRgnP69g.text: Good stuff - trust me, go with the Woody Allen.  It's huge and filled with tasty pastrami and corned beef.  Relatively lean pastrami, and the horseradish mustard on the table is a great match.  (I made a kickass corned beef & pastrami hash with the leftovers today.)  Yesterday I tried the cheese blintzes and a potato pancake.  Blintzes... fried?  Deep-fryer action?  Very odd, but the filling was fantastic.  The potato pancake was good, not too greasy, some noticeable onion action in there.  But here is where they lose a star from me - $13 for three small blintzes.  $5 for a decent-sized potato pancake.  I think I was offended by the receipt which listed the potato pancake as "latkes" - as in multiple items.  Uh, no, you really did charge me $5 for one latke.   Service was also really slow.  But this was the best deli dining I've experienced east of the Mississippi (not including Canter's in LA).

901MhBJvMm-I4nEcrVooaA.text: Carnegie Deli beats The Hat  They fly in all the meat from NYC.

HbbOtNdY7EYuGWRm1bYmAg.text: Ok, this place has the biggest portions in the world, but they should have at least warned us when we ordered. We got 4 things for 4 people, coming to more than $60, and we basically threw half our food away.  You are better off ordering 1 thing and splitting it with someone, however, they will charge you $3 split charge if you do this - still more worth it than making 2 orders though, trust me.  The hot pastrami is pretty good but kind of odd that it doesn't come with a side of anything. The tuna melt is HUGE!!! It looked like a combo platter at a mexican joint covered in that mountain of cheese...   Expect to pay $10-20/person at this casual lil restaurant.

kIKO8vVnOym6I2qKDhM1Ew.text: Come here for the amazing HUGE sandwiches of meat.  Don't come here for a salad, or soup.  The Reuben and Pastrami sandwiches are HUGE!!  The Reuben seems like the best.  My partner couldn't finish his ...and he always finishes his meal.  There may be a wait, so come early or at odd times.  It's a medium sized place in the hotel.  Good service.  Not many veggies around.

qhwiZnXXUwwV-XzMeXTFcg.text: Ive been to NYC and had similar styled pastrami sandwiches at Katz (but did not visit Carnegie when there).  This Vegas spot is a poor representation.  My hot pastrami with swiss was the driest pastrami I ever had.  I also ordered a carrot cake slice that came to damn near $10... I've had carrot cake at my grocery store baker that tasted better!

TLINd9Z5kgBRfg49E9ikCg.text: SCAM Read more) Wow let's start by saying this place is SCAM! Very terrible service I ever had in my life Carl's jr. Has way better service than they do. Why I say scam the food sucks nowhere near Carnegie Deli in New York. We went here yesterday on the 25th of January 2015 party of five ordered the matzo ball soup tastes like they poured sink water all on top. And trust me I know good food. Ordered a knish had one taste terrible and the top it off they messed up on all our orders it was like a joke! Not once twice! Unbelievable worse experience in my life this was in the Mirage Carnegie Deli and the top it off the manager was a lady don't know her name she was terrible worse than the waiter. Very unorganized Ordered Woody Allen Rubin knish matzo ball soup fries coleslaw. Very very bad no taste. do not recommend waste of money fail! !!!!!!!!!! Should close down.  Who thinks this place is good must have been drunk and the manager there sucks

iRVJK6oensW-VOJjZYAXjA.text: Holy moly! The slices of pie are huge!!! Unfortunately, all I had was the Coconut Cream Pie, but the portion was ginormous! and it was very good. I saw the sandwiches that they were serving at the deli and those are HUGE as well, so if anything, come with an apetite!

_rz7ZnBlo2P8lMuEFrM47w.text: After having two pieces of cheese the size of quarters as a tapas at another restaurant, we were starving! Made our way to the Carnegie Deli in the Mirage. I had the pickled herring and the knish. Was such a huge amount and delicious! The server (according to the receipt was Michae) was amazingly friendly and very New Yorkish. Best service the entire trip. Best food the entire trip. Would definitely go back again!

-y-9poLb5TL-orve2s5EDw.text: I got a pastrami sandwich and the portions are big and the sandwich was good but not good enough to justify the $20 bill. Maybe I'm spoiled but in Columbus this sandwich would be $10 maybe.

H2y7zi7cNeXP6g-1KO1iIw.text: Had the tuna sandwich very good  as little pricey but  good services very good nice clean friendly

6pLkq-iWvQIBgg9XEGWbvg.text: I stayed in the Mirage so I was able to eat here for lunch easily. The line wasn't long. This place is one of those where you order at the register than sit down with a number. I ordered the tuna sandwich, it came out fairly quickly. It was alright, kind of bland but the fries were really good. Overpriced for the quality of food but it's Vegas so it's expected! It's mediocre at best.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

kSSBfdPqE7VKdermm9KxiA.text: Ordered the Chicken Soup with noodles and the maxi ball, still pretty good, but they changed the noodles and added carrots and celery? I liked the smaller noodles better, and skip the veggies!

oHgrEGUMka7aDtfww5-iEA.text: I ordered the noodle soup. It was delicious but cold. The waiter took my soup and heated it right up. I have been here before and everything is so good.

L0o6TEbicGepZO78iSgN7g.text: Came for breakfast on the way to Mirage, this restaurant is like a sub deli place with more table seating than average & extremely over priced menu! You stay in line to order your food , the counter poor your drinks & you sit down whenever is open and your food arrives with the waiter.  The food $& coffee was below average, small portion and over priced per haps! We won't be back here for sure since no abundance or any good experiences.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Here is the menu &amp; prices
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stay in line like jack in the box to order your food and pay to the register  but you pay big box for your below average food!

mkjb8YC8tQv1Tvt4pWFeCA.text: Food is good.  Sandwiches are ridiculously large.  Breakfast is your typical fare but good.  Overpriced really for everything but you are in Vegas, so what do you expect. I never have a great experience server wise though.  It's meant to be fast food really but you need your server to get more drinks, condiments, etc. And they are all way over stretched, running around to help you that much.  The desserts are good and a nice quick snack to soak up anything you might need to.

BThusH9_XY_kMYaOq4HjcA.text: Came here for breakfast and was sorely disappointed. Toast was basically not toast but slices of unbuttered, untoasted, room temperature bread. Eggs were terrible, bacon was meh. Coffee was very weak. The service was awful. Perhaps they were in the middle of a shift change but we were barely looked at, let alone talked to. We had to ask for milk for the coffee, we had to steal silverware from another table, and the server came over just once, to bring us our food. I felt like we were intruding somehow! I mean, I get that they're not a breakfast place per se, but if you have something on your menu you'd better do it right. And there's just no excuse for the service being that bad. I guess it doesn't matter much anyway because, with such poor air quality, I doubt I will ever step foot in the Mirage again.

0k83BpU_4QLABHUUi3zh-w.text: Carnegie is located inside Mirage.  Its closer to the Las Vegas Strip side of the casino.  We came here to try their famous Pastrami sandwich.  The portion size is huge, and it can definitely feed 2 people. Each sandwich cost about $17.  There was a huge pile of pastrami in the sandwich.  It was a bit hard to eat, so I just ate the meat on its own.  I wish there was some veggies like lettuce and tomatoes to go with the sandwich.    Overall, service was good here.  There are servers bringing your food to you, so customers just have to wait at the table.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hot Pastrami sandwich
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. fries

qRg_MXrlrSGn0sUpU2JWug.text: I got a corned beef and pastrami sandwich and let me tell you it was a massive!  The woman working with her in the counter with extremely friendly the older gentleman not so nice.  My sandwich was absolutely delicious and well worth the money.!

5sgoEphTQMterC5Ui6IyYA.text: If you are trapped in the Mirage hotel, this place is okay.  If you can leave the hotel, you may want to explore going somewhere else.  The food was okay.  I ordered at the register for take out up to my room.  For the 25 bucks I paid for a cheeseburger and fries (fries were extra) it was totally not worth it.  The burger was nothing special, neither were the fries.  Perhaps I should have given one of the sandwiches a try.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7EnuUiFbF0h5F-NoSzRucw.text: Heard stories of the legendary Carnegie deli in New York, but had no idea there was one in Vegas.  My friends had already eaten so I decided to take a quick bite here while they were gambling. I ordered a Reuben sandwich; nothing more, nothing less. I was completely shocked when they came out with my sandwich and it was 3 lbs of meat completely draped in cheese. It looked like a baby wrapped in a blanket. I barely ate a quarter of it so I had to box the rest. I was laughing until I got my check and it costed around $40. I looked at the menu and saw that they had regular sized Reubens and was completely shocked as to why they didn't give me that one. Did I say Super size me!? All I tasted was meat and cheese. The bread was completely hidden under all that ridiculousness.  By far the funniest experience I've had at a restaurant. They should really specify what size sandwich you want before ripping you off.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A toddler wrapped in cheese. I wanted a Reuben sandwich, not an alien fetus!

HE1Wf6goLArOVSDxBCSLpA.text: We liked it. A little pricey even for Vegas but great service.  Cashier was a bit slow but we attribute that more to the people ordering than their service. Got the Turkey club and Ham and Egg sandwich. One was enough to share. Loved the turkey club for the mound of bacon.

7MqluHK9w79GE32v3gQYrA.text: The pastrami sandwich is off the chain.  You have to get it, the best pastrami I have ever had. My husband got the pastrami hash with an egg, was good but not amazing like the sandwich.  Great service and nice place to sit while you wake up in the morning.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pastrami sandwich!!!
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pastrami hash w/ egg

6ZnIqGlZegn-DKgAz8rApg.text: Junk food please go some else..  Save your money  The service was fine   The bread was two day old !!!!@ Not good

-oP1g2zRipe7o1IQfZV32w.text: If you regularly eat at a traditional Jewish deli you will find this place to be only fine. Waaaaaaaaaay over priced considering it is in Vegas and everything in this city is therefore one shouldn't be surprised.  Cheesecake was wonderful. New pickles were delightful.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1LovmcML5Y_OurfkuXoqzQ.text: When in Vegas, I like going to Carnegie Deli for a Pastrami sandwich.  Was kind of disappointed this trip.  First, food is ordered @ the counter now.  2nd everything is ala cart.  3rd food was not as impressive as before.  I guess because it's ala cart, the sandwich does not come with a side of salad.  It still came with 2 pickles, was scared to ask for more.  It used to come in a small bowl and can ask for more.  Service was not as great.

ot15f8i7CiPr_FTaRVvlzA.text: This deli is located in the Mirage resort. They serve mammoth sizes of all types of deli food here. Some of the sandwiches that I have seen being delivered to other tables are almost comical in size. I can't see one person being able to eat them in one sitting. Come to think of it two sittings would still be a challenge.   I always have to stop here for a pastrami sandwich because I am crazy about pastrami and they do a pretty fine version here. Service is what I would label as "prompt" more than friendly. Decent place to satisfy your deli cravings but be sure you wear your "stretch" pants.  Cheers to all

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pastrami!

rRi19maeQmzmMyRgENOK6g.text: You cannot go wrong with this place.  Everything NYC authentic... sandwiches, cream soda, pickles, etc...you won't leave still hungry.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

pNe2SfPEP2RrkHjGU0r7hA.text: 3.5 stars I was looking forward to fresh homemade pastrami, since its really hard to find outside of New York City.  So i chose Carnegie dell located in the Mirage.  I ordered the pastrami hash, the pastrami was very good i like how it was toasted on the griddle, i just wish the potatoes were more crispy, more like home fries, the soft potatoes didn't do it for me.  Other people ordered a corned beef sandwich and a pastrami sandwich which were both large and tasty.  We also got an order of fries too, they were crispy, next time i'll ask them to fry some pastrami and put it over my fries with an egg on top?  Both sandwiches were good but i liked the pastrami sandwich at Stage in the MGM better.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corned beef sandwich
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pastrami hash. the pastrami is delicious, i wish the potatoes were crispy.

Zt5HJCTPZ-JEgstxMwAXog.text: This location is in Vegas. Been here before.  Still 100% happy with the food and the way we are treated.  You just can not go wrong with anything at Carnegie Deli.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

tk7ffUvCa1vwMH3FrmTE7A.text: I had lunch at Carnegie today and it was my first time ever. My boyfriend always raves about the Carnegie in NYC and didn't want to check out the Vegas lactation because he didn't think it would be as good. He was wrong! The food was great! Huge portions!! Once we saw all of the people around us getting huge meals we decided to share our sandwich. (Although I've worked in the industry for many years as a server and bartender, Ive always had a special type of hatred for the people who shared meals like sandwiches) but seriously this sandwich was HUGE! and delicious. We also had one of their potato pancakes, which was probably the best potato pancake I've ever had! So good. Although our waitress was a bit un attentive, we still had a great time. and the food came out quick! Next stop is Carnegie NYC! I've heard it's better than Vegas but I kind of think its impossible!

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Never seen this much turkey or bacon on a sandwich! So good!

cbxTOMIOFavNQIRAGEZTsw.text: They have changed the way they operate.  Looks like they are trying to save money, service is the worst, not because of the staff. well there was one guy with his sun glasses propped on top of his head.  He was the slowest person in the world.  Now you place your order at the old "take out" window, then grab a seat.  They bring your food out to you.  Just not what I expected. not sure I'll go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. At Carnegie at the mirage hotel in vegas.

TUKBL-qvRDlwc18YHKu_VA.text: Excellent food, virtually no service, stand-in-line ordering, and exorbitantly high prices make Carnegie Deli a questionable choice for a meal in Las Vegas. Before it went to its fast food format, I could justify the prices. It was in the Mirage hotel; it was in a tourist venue; it featured the food that made the New York deli famous. So, I could justify the price by the experience. Now, it's just a fast food joint, with good food. I'll return, when the restaurant starts to show some respect for its patrons.

1iRZqD8uNspq9osVeUfJxw.text: For some reason I can't find any decent delis with great pastrami in Baltimore. (Note to self: ask around). In Long Beach there's a no name, hole-in-the-wall place on every corner that serves pastrami. Anyway the pastrami was absolutely delicious here. It is rather pricey though. The sides cost extra and they charge to share.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pastrami on pumpernickel

JkErR0HTIFEnLv0WctqVKA.text: Pickle Palace is my favorite place. You have no idea how hard it is to find a good Jewish deli here in town.  Ask for pickles as soon as you sit down, then ask for some more, than ask for more and take them back to the hotel room with you. They are that good.  This is the same Carnegie you can find in NYC, minus the fact this one takes credit cards, NYC only cash.  Couple of pointers here: you are going to have WAY WAY too much food so make sure you share something.  It is also very pricey [like $25 for a sandwich but if you divide that by 2 =$12.50 sandwich].  This place isn't cheap but it sure is worth it.  My friend and I go here and to the one in NYC and we always get the same thing:  Reuben, extra plate extra Rye bread,  potato pancake or fries [depending on how hungover we are on the hangover scale], Russian dressing on the side, maybe macaroni salad, and ice teas [again NYC charges you for refills even for ice-tea].  You can't go wrong with this, trust me I'm a professional.

5FtftGG1wJxh0aZSqKEJ5g.text: I had the brisket and the beef was dry to my taste. My friends had the corn beef and pastrami and overall the corn beef is the best.  Overall, the food is okay.  Not sure i would go back.  I still prefer Schwartz and Abbe's in Montreal, Qc.  2.5 to 3 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brisket...is okay
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fnShEvTRtnMQS_b9YhWaNg.text: First i will say that the food was delicious! However $60.00 for 2 burgers, fries, a slice of cheesecake & a coke is a little crazy.  At that price you want to finish your meal but it was too much food!  Maybe they could give smaller portions and charge a little less. One order of fries would serve 2 people.  Service was beyond horrible. We ordered takeout to take back to our room.  I ordered a cheeseburger plain (just cheese) & fries.  My daughter then said that she wanted the exact same.  When I saw the man working behind the counter I saw him wrap up a burger with lettuce & tomato & start to put it on our bag.  I reminded him that she had wanted her burger plain too.....he was visibly angry and asked why she hadn't told him that.  I said she did tell him when she said she wanted her burger "exactly" like mine.  He then scooped all of the toppings off the burger slammed the bun on wrapped it up threw it in the bag.    He then started throwing dishes around (no lie) to the point that even his co-workers were staring at him.  It was all just surreal.  I can honestly say that had not/was not ever rude to this man, but I was not willing to pay $60 at a deli for burgers and fries & then accept a wrong order.   Again, the food was pricey but good however the service was scary.

6OjNEnCpfrKAaVCLr0_m_g.text: My wife and I Needed a quick meal before our show and made a hasty decision to stop here..it was close. Oh what a trap. To make it short the cashier was extremely rude, got our order wrong. As we were waiting for our $22 club sandwich thinking "$22 wow this must be an awesome sandwich" what we received was three pieces of s**tty wheat bread, a whole pound of s**tty turkey, and a pound of microwave bacon. Wtf. No mayo, they gave us some ketchup and mustard packets to go with it. Oh and one leaf of s**tty lettuce with a slice of tomato. Quantity over quality, plain and simple. I could have made 10 terrible dry sandwiches if I had another loaf of dollar store wheat bread though. Angst aside, we ordered it to go and shared a sandwich so maybe we don't have room to judge..

23m8b9byloQ140mNgFZCRA.text: Horrible food.  We ordered pastrami sandwiches, and although they were stacked high, the rye bread was stale and the pastrami was barely warm.  The worst ever.  I'm surprised Carnegie would allow their name to be associated with this place.  The place was empty at 9pm so that speaks volumes.

DNgrNkhF1dKpt_tTY3rsJg.text: Not a big fan of their matzo ball soup but their pastrami sandwich is delicious!!! A pastrami sandwich comes with 1 pound of meat so make sure you are really hungry or have someone to share it with.  My friend came here once before and was a little reluctant to come back since she had a bad experience with her server, but this time, our server was great!  They are very busy so be prepared to wait in line.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Matzoh ball soup... It&#39;s ok.
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pastrami sandwich (1 lb of meat)

QzL6blY9qIN30RW9zN7gDg.text: An ok version of the NYC institution. We have not had a hot pastrami sandwich in a long time so this worked for us. The sandwich was not nearly as large as NYC but plenty for my daughter and I. Taste was good but not as moist as I would have liked. The rye bread was dry. Not close to NYC standards. All told, it hit the spot though! We also shared a bowl of matzo ball soup with noodles. They provide extra broth on the side. Portion, like everything here, was huge. Matzo ball was light and delicious. Expect Las Vegas prices but you will leave satisfied.

IGPpkc_ogxIZi07JNdgeMg.text: This was the first time I've eaten here though I've passed by it many times while traipsing through the Mirage.  I had The Rueben for which they are famous.    "Piled high" is a term used too frequently by other places selling sandwiches but here they really mean it.  I'm not a lightweight and I had trouble finishing that thing.     The service was good.  Order by the register then grab a table.  The server will come and check your receipt and bring out your drinks then the food when it's ready.  I would come back and try other things, but there are so many options near and far it is going to be difficult to squeeze them in.

2sO_tlqCrcOYT15iU6iqTg.text: My family and I wanted a filling breakfast; however, did not want to binge eat at a buffet. We saw Carnegie Deli's display of cheesecake and breakfast menu and opted to stop and eat. The food is good and their cheesecake is very delicious. Prices for their food is steep, but they make it up to you by giving you large food servings. Good waiter service!

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Try their cheesecake or carrot cake!

03hyGXQH6mcFsw1CvLt1EA.text: If you're hungry and want A LOT of pastrami, and A LOT of food, with A LOT of smiles, go to Carnegie.  Make sure to order the fries too!  Friendly staff, plenty of seating, (somewhat packed) Awesome location inside Mirage (Makes you feel like you're in New York.)  It definitely is worth the money!

CGRQhIVGrD_5zvAAT0yzRA.text: Worst service. Longest wait . Good burger. Extremely expensive burger.  We waited 19 minutes to place our to go order.  Three employees said hi and them quickly left. When we finally placed the order burger was ready 30 seconds later. It must have been pre made.

U4KNVraphsRx364tULNliA.text: Short and simple review for this place:  Pros: Massive portions (how do NY people eat this much?!) Open till 2am Friendly service You don't have to fly to New York and wait in that insane line at the real location.  Cons: Prices are stiff.  They charge you extra for wanting to share one of the mammoth thing they call sandwiches  Like any other True fattie we ordered the Woody Allen which was 2lbs of pastrami and corned beef on 2 tiny slices of bread. I'm not insane and I do appreciate arterial function so me and the woman split this bad boy. Be warned if you are looking for taste, this is not the place for you. The meat was dry and flavorless and had to be drowned in deli mustard in order to be palatable. I have been to NY and have had my mind blown by a pastrami tower at Broadway Deli so I know that this isn't how NY sandwiches are supposed to be like. All in and all, we plugged away at it and doing so killed the entire bottle of deli mustard.   We can proclaim that we came and conquered "The Woody."  I categorize this one to the "been there ate that" category.So if playing Man vs Food is your thing then add Carnegie Deli to your list. If you still have a working mouth full of taste buds and enjoy using them, this place is a miss...

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. They call this a monster sandwich?!?
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Woody Allen.. 2lbs of pastrami and corned beef

2bFdcA2SfIz1YI0fv6PByA.text: A little pricey but the food was good, huge open face reuben sandwich which took a while to eat, I got the corned beef version and it was tasty and tender. I've been here a couple of times and enjoyed the meal both times, just be sure to go when you are hungry

CUQwZVnqKv6WtKfNAwBvrw.text: A-OK...    The good.......Very tasty, big portions, traditional Jewish fare, to-go counter or table service.  Artery clogging yumminess.   The bad....kinda pricey, very slow service...wallet emptying boredom.

_nRiP-lx0EHLLpoU75FJoQ.text: Consider this mostly to be a novelty sandwich place. You're looking at $20+ for the large sandwiches.  One tip I have is if you do get the large sandwich, make sure you have at least 2 different kinds of meats because it sure gets hard to eat after a while, especially since the taste of the meat gets old real fast when it's the same thing over and over again. My recommendation: corned beef and beef tongue.  The other tip is to maybe just split the sandwich with someone else, but be aware there's a $3 sharing fee associated with that.

bhKgeRHrxbMc2xcBwDL5cg.text: Hum... maybe I am spoiled by the original location in NY. For this place, I wasn't feeling it. Atomsphere felt more like a Denny's, light seems a bit dim, it was annoyingly dim. Service could be better, I attempted to wave a waiter/waitress/hostess down to get my check, but they seem to all ignore me. Took me about a good 10 mins to finally get someone attention, and additional 5 mins to get my bill.  Their pastrami sandwich was just okay, tasted more like a typical pastrami sandwich you can get anywhere. Maybe I came in with too much hope for this place, but at the time we arrive, it was probably a given when there was no line. I should have taken it as a hint that this place wasn't a hit in Vegas.  Will I come back? Nope.  Will I recommend this place? Nope. Was the sandwich picture worthy? NOT all at.

dxDDetjLDaJU9gIaju5Okw.text: Killer Reuben, a must share... We opted for the corned beef pastrami combo.  We also split an order of fries, some of the best, served light, crisp and hot.  Portions are ginormous, we had no room for the Devine looking cheesecake.  Definitely a good spot for late nigh dining.

dufncTnu3kCv6r3iDCDwqQ.text: We had breakfast here, way too pricey since it's in the hotel. We didn't feel like leaving the hotel so we weren't surprised it was pricey, stupid us. It took forever to get the bill. I heard their deli sandwiches are great, so next time we'll try one.

vgCBSCqMCguaZJVDW0bjwQ.text: Massive, Massive sandwiches! Quick service, at a reasonable price. The sand which alone will fill you up. Plus they give you deli style pickles with your sand which. They load the sand which with Tons of meat on the sand which.This place is just like the classic delicatessen in new york. I had the tatala a good combination of turkey and corned beef.

ND1DQNODtsZ3zff9lozKmA.text: The food is excellent, but I couldn't bring myself to order their famous rueben.  Even the smaller sized ones are just too big and I couldn't waste that much food :-P.  They have something for everyone here other than their sandwiches which they are known most for.  The matza ball soup is fantastic, as are the burgers.  I really like the pickles brought out to the table, but oddly enough, if you want pickles on your burger, you have to slice them yourself.  My wife had eggs, which were cooked incorrectly, but they fixed it quickly.  We came back late night on a different day for the banana creme pie, also great, but man, it was big.  Service was prompt and courteous, a solid play.  Just realize that the prices aren't cheap for sandwiches, but you are getting good quality food.

CO38lA8p8g3KRpdg9oIAPA.text: Wasn't worth the $30 roundtrip taxi ride. The corned beef sandwich was good but not over stuffed. They had no sour pickles only half sour. I felt like I was being nickeled and dimed like almost everything else in Las Vegas. BTW, it's now self service ordering and they bring you your food. Very poorly ran operation

4r3c7smh4DPaQka2pb28Kw.text: Enjoyed this place and glad I shared my sandwich :). I don't agree with them charging $3.00 if you share your meal with whomever your with. They should be thankful people are giving them the business and let it be. Don't get me wrong the sandwiches are De - lush and I will be back but lay off the $3.00 sharing charge.

yqjDOViLORsz6XfNEdL80Q.text: We got the brisket sandwich for 17 bucks. They give you a lot of meat but there is no flavor in the brisket. It wasn't very tender and on top of that, they have no sauces. So if you like eating dry brisket that you can't swallow, come here.

XK1IFviDK3Js4CM2cWPS7g.text: We were staying at the Mirage & came downstairs to figure out a late night meal without doing a buffet. I will admit this was conveniently located in The Mirage Hotel. Replica of the Original Carnegie Deli in NY. Everything is the same here. They are known for their outrageously large sandwiches. These sandwiches are not made for 1 person & must be shared. The amount of food that is wasted here is beyond ridiculous. Especially for those visiting most of us aren't going to take our food up to our rooms. Weren't able to find homeless people roaming outside to give our left overs to so it wait straight to the trash sadly. That being said love the diner feel here, casual & no fuss. We ordered a classic pastrami on rye. The sandwich was exactly the same in taste & shape of their NY location. The pastrami is properly cured, seasoned, & tender. It was freakin delicious. Piled high like a "Call your Mommy that's alotta Pastrami"!  The pickled were the bomb they house make them & baby does it have crunch & flavor. We tried to finish 1 sandwich split between 2adults & barely made a dent sadly.  The service here is not the best. reminds me of typical New York dilemma. Don't like the fact that you order at the counter & get a number since they have table servers. It's a disgusting tactic to get tipped before terrible service is given.  The food is worth 5 stars but all the negatives stated minus 2 stars.

ngzS7eXiswuoHRs-clWj-Q.text: Took a shot at eating at Carnegie even though I have never imagined spending $25 plus tip for a pastrami sandwich and a lemonade.  They dont have bulkie rolls so I got it on pumpernickle.  Wasn't the pumpernickle Im used to. It was more like brown bread and too soft to stand up to the meat and grease.  It became mush.  The pastrami was too fatty for my liking. It even had whole pieces of fat which I had to spit out.  I should have taken a picture to post.   I was really disappointed, but I didnt complain as I know some people like their pastrami fatty.

hSR0WA8uDydvsPk3U1402g.text: Been there more than a few times.... not for everyone. Comically enormous portions. the pastrami & rueben sandwiches are as tall as the plate's wide, the order of fries is best ordered as a community platter. Really exceptional breakfasts also, dynamite french toast... again an enormous portion. Seating is pretty tight though. In our city overloaded with the all-u-can-eat buffets, Carnegie Deli puts more than you can eat on a plate.

iklGFJP5sxCdRYdQNQJN-w.text: while I have never eaten the sandwiches or any entree I always go for the Cheesecake it is the best I have had I love the strawberry I am still giving 5 stars even if the last time I went they were out of strawberry cheesecake so I got the plain the cheesecake that day was not even close to as good as usual it tasted off and I did not even finish it but that was one time all other times were perfect

rDsMqSG68X6cbOs1B1r2bg.text: Huge monster-sized portions. Had the classic pastrami on rye and for dessert I had cheesecake with blue berries. Pricy, approximately $20 per sandwich.   Recommended.

56M9wl8-q_2RvprDy1pfVg.text: Ok, just letting you know... if size is what matters, then baby you can believe me, the sandwiches are HUGE... larger than what you can bite for sure!!!  While waiting you get to munch on deli pickles!  (yummo!)   Cheesecake the bomb!  So good... however, the corn beef in my opinion was a little too dry... I would have loved it if they'd just would have taken it out of the oven, broiler, what have ya, and let it rest to cook on it's own... just a little too dry... for me that is.    It's pricey, so don't panic when you see the bill!  Is worth it?  Yes, if you're don't live in Las Vegas... try something once... it's always been my moms advise!

mMbK6snOKbb7GSWtJ1LEtQ.text: The Reuben:  Godzilla, that thing is huge (TWSS!)  So I still had alcohol in the system after 1am, and didn't really think much about the nearly $30 price tag for the sandwich.    When it came out, I realized why.  I think there were literally a few pounds of meat on this thing.  smothered in cheese and some kraut (honestly wish there had been more kraut), i have never seen a sandwich like this in my life.  it's served open face, also.  you're using a knife and fork with this bia.  Now, I can eat my fair share of food, but I seriously doubt I got more than 1/3 of the way done with it.  Others around me sat in amazement when the waitress brought it out.  As did I.    I'll tell ya.... $30 is a helluva lot to spend on a sandwich, but when it can feed a family of five, it's not so bad.  Do your research before dining here.  I had no idea what to expect.  It made for an interesting morning on the pot.

OKV8hhQvrPuZchX25dpvPA.text: The only reason I can think of for these 5-star reviews of this restaurant is that people were DRUNK when they wrote it. This deli is by far the most OVERPRICED and HORRIBLE food I have ever eaten.  And I am from Los Angeles where we have EXPENSIVE DELIs.  Their Matzo Ball soup tasted like dish water, and their corned beef was COMPLETELY dry.  They charge $16.99 for a lousy corned beef sandwhich with NOTHING on the side, and they have the audacity to charge you a $3.00 sharing fee on top of it.  $20 for a lousy sandwich with nothing on the side.  Even in Beverly Hills, I can get a sanwich and french fries for $15.   NEVER AGAIN!

Jyva5aQDOKIKQuiWCqjGHA.text: This is located inside the Mirage. It open very late, luckily. I was hungry as I was drinking all night and gambling. We ate here twice!! Two nights in a row cause we were in the Mirage gambling. The Pastrami sandwiches was very good, it was huge. It's good for late night and lunch I would think. I must agree, the prices are super expensive. I think it was 15$? or more. I guess it's located inside Mirage which is why. Hey it's still beat eating McDonald though and it was the only thing open. I shared this with my girl and it got us both full.   I would recommend this place if you're gambling at Mirage late at night and wanted something to eat. Or eat it during lunch and share it with someone on an ordinary day in Vegas to save some cash.

2Lx6OJT2pNLhZirvlo3mYA.text: Like you see on Travel channel about the NY Carnegie Deli.  You tell you self that sandwich aren't that big and good. No lie they are huge and great!   Also I thought there chicken broth soup was the best.  Nice a simple and deep on taste.  Thumbs up from me!

-RiH79AKqbop64tSFdb-KQ.text: After waking up from a late night of partying and craving breakfast at 12 in the afternoon. My girlfriends and I walked around the whole Mirage hotel looking for a restaurant to serve breakfast. Finally, we found Carnegie deli that served breakfast all day!  Dying of hunger, the service was quick and efficient. We were sat and a server came to us right away. I got the basic eggs and bacon, the portion was more then enough.  My friends and I were more then satisfied that we came back the next morning to have breakfast. None of us had the pastrami sandwich, but it looked ginormous! I'll have to go to NYC for that!

rZe-v_CAz5KKImmkqUMRFA.text: Incredible sandwich.  Great Service on the night that I was there.  Will definitely go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Have you ever wondered what a 2lb. Sandwich looks like?

A21LQkh-sEeQHTInfKvSmA.text: BIG, LARGE, ENORMOUS, GIGANTIC, GRANDE, HUGE, COLOSSAL...that's how I describe these sandwiches. I guess you get the point. I didn't even know they had a location in Las Vegas.  I tried this place in New York City, I think the original.  I'm glad it's in Vegas, because I travel more to Vegas than to New York.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corned Beef &amp; Hot Pastrami
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Woody Allen

1WgNkwz706wCj4KhIw2CxA.text: It lives up to the hype for sure. Best pastrami i've ever had! Perfect meal to split. what a beaut.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. hot pastrami with cheddar on sliced sourdough.
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. hot pastrami with cheddar on sliced sourdough.

Qjm9eB-EMwLfkVM6g1b8AA.text: Ordered and Woody Allen, Rootbeer & fries. $35 dollars later I'm now in possession of enough tasty sandwich to feed a family of 4. Everything was great and tasty and fresh! Worth the money and it was made and ready so quickly! I ordered "to go" since I knew I wouldn't be finishing it, once I ate my fill the sandwich still looked untouched and so did my fries. They threw in 2 whole large pickles that were fresh and crunchy crisp. Worth the price and DEFINITELY filling.

MNV_TFQU9zFtM3FrX0dw-w.text: Though mostly empty, the service was incredibly slow and rude. Overpriced, but that was expected. My food came out lukewarm

txygxSNMMLKomRVNcdSqnA.text: Came here for a quick breakfast.  I ordered the Sausage Omelette, which came with potatoes and toast.  I gave this place a 4 star because the food was great and the service was pretty awesome.  The waitress basically gave us comped orange juice and she was on top of refilling our water.  It was a nice experience to basically have infinite amount of water.  The egg was delicious and the sausage inside tasted good.  The potatoes were a little on the saltier side though.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sausage Omelette (Comes with toast and potatoes).

7yU9K2nt-3WtPJQg3l8F-Q.text: We weren't sure what we were going to do for dinner. Since I was starving, I needed a snack. We were staying at The Mirage and decided to swing by Carnegie Deli on Thursday, May 11th around 7pm to grab some takeout.  *CHOPPED LIVER PLATTER: potato salad, coleslaw, and chopped liver with lettuce, tomato and onion ($17.99) *THE REUBEN: Our "famous" open-style sandwich piled high with your choice of corned beef, pastrami or turkey, Topped with melted Swiss cheese & sauerkraut ($24.99)  The sandwich was huge. But for $25, it better be! I asked for both corned beef and pastrami in the reuben, but I think they only gave us pastrami. I like my pastrami a little fatter as I think it makes the sandwich more comforting. The boys and I shared this and it was enough to feed the three of us. The chopped liver platter was a good way to sample some of their sides. I liked eating the liver with the reuben as I thought it added an extra creaminess. The rest of the salads were just okay. We also got two pickles so I think each order came with one. I love pickles, so I enjoyed these.  Expensive, but huge sandwiches. I've actually never been to a New York deli, but overall, I thought the sandwiches here were just all right.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pickles
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. CHOPPED LIVER PLATTER: potato salad, coleslaw, and chopped liver with lettuce, tomato and onion ($17.99)
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. THE REUBEN: your choice of corned beef, pastrami or turkey, Topped with melted Swiss cheese &amp; sauerkraut ($24.99)

a5UmZ4Xwpkc5BJEs-foDpA.text: This is a shadow of its former self. It used to be an abbreviated version of the Carnegie Deli in NYC which sadly closed. They have done away with table service. You now have to order up front from a limited menu. The pastrami sandwich was great but a little dry. Cheese cake was good but I have had better. It has lost its atmosphere. Kind of like going to the food court in the mall.

lbecU_vnB9k8lmrAkY7FvA.text: If you walk into the Mirage and start exploring the casino floor it shouldn't take very long for the smell of the Carnegie deli to catch your attention. A look at their menu will also catch your attention because the prices are ridiculously high. $17 for a sandwich? Seriously?   Well if you like Pastrami, whip that debit card out and order a Pastrami sandwich. And be prepared for a downright massive sandwich to be put in front of you that will make your eyes do a double take. It's freakin HUGE! And yes, it's as good as it looks. Again, if Pastrami is your thing or if you're craving it, you need to give Carnegie a try. I'm also a fan of their Lox and Bagel....it definitely took care of my craving for lox which I get from time to time.   Service...can be hit or miss. And sometimes the staff can have an attitude. And again the prices are RIDICULOUS! While my debit card wasn't happy I walked out of Carnegie very happy and my stomach wasn't complaining either.   4 Stars. Even the ridiculous prices won't keep me from coming back.

7P7cZ-HAB-fRh2Lh6THFuQ.text: Hubby and I stopped by to grab some sandwiches to go. The line wasn't too long to order at all and it was about a 10 minute wait time to get the 2 sandwiches which isn't bad considering there were other take out orders waiting ahead of us.  Hot Pastrami ($17.99) - You can add cheese for an extra $2, I added Swiss. I asked for sourdough bread and that wasn't a problem. The pastrami was tender and delicious. I was impressed that the bread didn't break while eating the sandwich, it held the meat nicely. Some people think this place is too expensive. I personally don't mind paying the price per sandwich because it's stacked, tasty and filling. The sandwiches also come with a whole pickle and you can add a side of fries for $2.99.   I've eaten inside a few times years ago, but have only done that when company is in town and wants to come here. Hubby and I usually just pop in to grab a couple of sandwiches to go. They also serve breakfast, soup, salad and have dessert. Carnegie is located inside The Mirage.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pickle that came with my sandwich
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hot Pastrami on Sourdough (swiss cheese extra)
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hot Pastrami on Sourdough (swiss cheese extra)

_-BfymtDi68U9ZIahwR0Bw.text: We were @ The Mirage for a large convention.   During one of the lunch breaks- we hurriedly went to the Carnegie deli.  There was already a fairly long line for the lunch crowd.  The deli seemed to be able to handle the large crowd; quickly and efficiently. Even affording everyone a seat, by the time your sandwich is ready.    I opted for the lunch combo of half a sandwich, potato salad and a drink for $15.99.  The sandwich was piled with too much meat for anyone to really eat.  I added cheese to the 1/2 sandwich for $2.  The meat was cold, but thickly sliced and good. The potato salad was a tasty rendition of deli/German potato salad.   Service was fast and friendly. Restaurant was clean and had adequate seating.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vQ8RG4jSbEbiUEUG_WAn6Q.text: Having had some amazing pastrami in other parts of the US, Carnegie Deli is just as good. Of course the portions are huge, enough for 2! The pastrami is cooked perfectly. I took my boyfriend here for his first time and he was highly satisfied with the corned beef as well as pastrami!

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

75sa_ExDeBF69eIPfwq8zA.text: Wow! Found Carnegie on Yelp, decided to try before Beatles Love show at the Mirage. Best Pastrami Ever! And the portions are Huge! Don't be fooled by the prices, one sandwich feeds 2! We had the Rueben, Amazing! Our friends had the half pastrami deals and loved them! Staff was first rate too! I highly recommend Carnegie if you are visiting Las Vegas. So good!

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

RIeEZBl2FmipOmSxkrOQdA.text: Woody Allen.   Thanks for the pile of meat but didn't get to chow the whole thing and guess what. Forgot my other half at my sister's ref to bring back w me on the plane tonight!  Shucks!  Grab one for yourself and finish it for me.  If you do let me know then next summer I will finish mine!  Thanks again for the pastrami and corn beef!

ZPPn87_EcdjktlJcsSm72A.text: We needed a quick dinner before seeing a Cirque show and this ended up being quick and tasty. Orders are placed at the counter, a number is given, and then food is brought to the table.   The menu includes the typical deli sandwiches, soups, and an impressive selection of desserts. Pricing initially seemed high, but once we saw the portion we agreed that the price was reasonable. The dining area has a cafeteria feel plenty of seating in an area closed off from the casino.   Since my husband and I weren't too hungry we shared a Reuben which is served open-style. If we had been really hungry this still would have been a significant amount of food to serve one person. The sandwich was really good, every ingredient was delicious. The meat made up most of the sandwich and was piled high with plenty of melted cheese on top. Breakfast is served all day so my brother opted for breakfast and really enjoyed it. On next visit I'll have to get try deli favorites like blintzes, potato pancakes, or matzo ball soup.  Overall, a good option for good food served quickly at a reasonable price (for The Strip).

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MwE6kH1EyCWz3fiv_XcGgA.text: Best Reuben I have ever had. No joke. I have always thought of Reubens as either you love or hate them, there is no just so-so type of Reuben. Carnegie sets the bar so high that I don't know if I will ever find one as good. The portion size was massive and impossible to finish! (That is a full size pickle in the photo). We were contemplating where to go to dinner prior to a show at Mirage and I am extremely happy we picked here. Love the NYC deli feel and we will return again for the food and pleasant experience from everyone there.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9ONYY58COSyKqPZC0noW7A.text: We had dinner here Saturday evening before The Beatles Love show at the Mirage in Las Vegas. We both ordered the Pastrami Sandwich and Potato salad for dinner. Our sever was great as the place was very busy and he immediately showed up cleaned our table and took our order back to the kitchen. Our sandwiches came out stacked with Pastrami on warm delicious Rye Bread. Very good sandwich with Pastrami that was so tender it almost melted in your mouth. The potato salad was also delicious. This restaurant although a little pricey which is the norm for the Vegas Casino Hotels was very good and well worth the cost for the great service and delicious food. Our server was well aware of the time that our show started and made sure we were served quickly and we ultimately had plenty of time to get to our show on time.

n81IS9iy6jfe2R2E7SSqVQ.text: I have a friend from Brooklyn who told me about the Carnegie deli there, how the sandwiches were very expensive but would feed a family of four. This place is just like that. I don't even remember what I ordered but it was flippin' amazing.

hsJuKhu5hPcW-9wLDVJThw.text: So, we had a myvegas redemption for a free cheese cake & I was very surprised to get a huge piece!!! Definitely enough to share with another person. We got to choose which flavor we wanted, so we got the chocolate truffle. Now I know redeeming points for a free cheesecake is DEF worth my points at this place. Not to mention, it was our very last thing that we ate before flying back home. Definitely satisfying. I have yet to try their other flavors! Can't wait for the next visit! Also, I have yet to try their food menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

V4fbZpGTSaX8uKmJ1FLqAQ.text: $20+ huge sandwiches that would be perhaps 3-4 sandwiches anywhere else. Nobody at our table could finish their 1/2 sandwich portion. Pastrami is amazing. Ambiance about what you'd expect inside a casino.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Turkey club
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Woody Allen

REFz9ErGuUymgXgya7YfKA.text: Hot Pastrami Sandwich at Carnegies in the Mirage ! Best sandwich I have had. Way way better than Canters Deli which I was disappointed in . Can not beat Carnegies!

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

AlswAO3FC8h5ANEErKXjYg.text: Overpriced and yea doesn't look like the photos you see and wasn't great. But had sorry looking bacon. Rueben was ok. But it's priced Probly double what should be.  Coleslaw is basic not good coleslaw. Wanted to like this place. Too bad

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rueben

BNrG-SmUpwUU4CPo4-VoXw.text: Wow what a delight!  We visited Carnegie Deli after the fabulous Beatles LOVE Cirque du Soleil show at The Mirage.  I hightly recommend the pastrami sandwich with cole slaw!  I would make the trip back to The Mirage just to go to this eatery!  Sandwich was filed HIGH with delicious pastrami on rye and the waitress was very efficient with refilling drinks.  The food is a little spendy but oh so worth it!

wD0yNJaw1aJMba4EfZuU1w.text: $25 for a Reuben?  This place is a joke.  The food is OK at best.  Reuben was dry and uneventful.  They should be ashamed for these prices. You'll be going the way of the NY location soon.  Good riddance.

n0dsGaVUDxghMdMZVr23Fw.text: Five stars for their soup. I ask to hold the noodles and other stuff and just fill up my to go cup with broth. If you are sick or just need some hot yummy soup, this is a place to go!

okb4PTVoc-7GIAshb_-pog.text: We stopped at Carnegie for breakfast and there was a huge line of people in front of us, which is pretty nnormal for this place. For 2 of us, breakfast was over $40 and it was HUGE. When I say HUGE, I mean we could have split one omelet, never mind that we each got one. Basically, we only had breakfast to eat all day since it was so much food.    My boyfriend wanted to go back for lunch before we left Vegas when he saw the pistrami/corned beef sandwiches. It didn't interest me, but he was very happy. I wasn't that hungry and truthfully, even if I was starving, I would never/could never put a dent in one of these sandwiches. One sandwich was $25 and it was bigger than my head. He couldn't open his mouth that big to eat it. Everyone was raving about the great sandwiches and actually taking pictures with the sandwiches because they were so big, but I wish they could have an $8 or $10 sampler, so normal people like me could have a normal size sandwich......... even if there's only one piece of bread!  The food is good quality, and the servings are large, but be ready to pay. I'd rather have smaller quantity for less money. Service is pretty slow both times we were there and not very friendly, but that wouldn't stop my boyfriend from coming back. If we do go back, I will do the same thing I did the second time we were there - just  order water and be careful not to get caught having a bit of his sandwich, since they charge $12 for sharing.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. HUGE sandwich

YKk6oxKmA9zxNgDjfOXgDg.text: The Reuben was amazing!  It took awhile to get it 30 minutes and they weren't that busy, but well worth the wait.  Had planned on eating their, but had to get a to go box!  2 1/2 hours later I finished!  All I need to eat all day!

UYnsSo6k_ksT9XDOQxR7Xg.text: The matzo ball soup tastes like they poured sink water don't think that's a good chef, little kid could make a better matzo ball soup you should be fired

BP3nMDMO46-3lDnVuYH0RA.text: Monster sandwiches. Yes they're not cheap but great quality meat and one sandwich could be split between 2 people.

AeNxRhuTldUvCNJP3acUGg.text: After a long walk on the Vegas strip I decided to head back to my room , I was feeling hungry so i decided to try this place was a long line but so worth it !!!! Im in love with the cheesecake I tried the strawberry cheesecake and my other half tried the cherry cheesecake yummmmm! I definitely recommend coming it's a must.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheesecake
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cool pictures
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carnegie Menu

3jeyKE4efvQb1_LrxSJuPw.text: We had a MyVegas reward for a slice of cheesecake that we redeemed after having a large dinner at Portofino.  We ordered at the counter, took a number and our order was delivered to our table.  In our case we ordered a slice of plain cheesecake along with a coffee for my wife.  The slice was very large and we were pretty full, so we were barely able to put a dent in it before requesting a doggie bag. It was as good as promised when we ate it over the following 2 days.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. plain cheesecake

OpYkByBSOdxDohiGg8L3fw.text: Huge sandwiches.  Like nothing you've ever seen before huge.  We honestly don't come for lunch often here.  So this review is about BREAKFAST/BRUNCH.  Ever since BB-Kings closed (which was my favorite mirage breakfast spot), we've come to Carnegie instead.  Again, the portions are just ridiculous - so you can share anything you get, even the sides.  But the food is good and plentiful and we keep coming back.  It's always insanely crowded, just FYI.

7KpxJPOQcC5gIWqWDtKuCA.text: Why does everything have to be SO BIG?! Usually we Yelpers don't complain about that (ha!), but in this case it's just ridiculous. Not to mention the potential for inducing heart attacks is immeasurably increased. It must be part of the appeal / gimmick, but too bad larger sizes don't translate to better food quality.  We were here for breakfast at 8 AM after a long night of partying and gambling (we hadn't slept yet) so at this point everything * should * have tasted good, right?  My Grilled Cheese with ham was hearty and a decent size -- thankfully not a monstrosity. The "Hash Browns" were more like a plateful of overcooked potato chunks, most of which were too hard in texture to eat. The "Side of Bacon" turned out to be an overflowing platter of much-too-crunchy, strange looking meat strips.  Service was friendly when we arrived, but seemed more hassled as the room began filling up for breakfast.   All in all, an okay experience but would only come back for convenience (a.k.a. when staying at the Mirage and cannot make it to a restaurant outside the hotel).  TIP: Size isn't everything.  DATE TIP: Size isn't everything. Wait, what?! I'm talking about the sandwiches!

CLSvBEtPmLuf3znIz0fq8w.text: Holy sandwich, Batman!  If you ever have a hankering for gigantic sandwiches where the meat is literally piled as high as your head, then you my friend, have come to the right place.  After indulging in Fat Tuesday's awesome big-ass drinks, we decided to eat here. For some reason, alcohol will imbibe some sort of food courage in you. Specifically the peach bellini with an extra shot.  My brother and sister-in-law were smart and decided to share the "Woody Allen", which was two lbs of meat (pastrami and corned beef, but they got all pastrami). My husband and I, alcohol in tow, decided against logic and each ordered our own "Woody Allen", all pastrami. Once the food came, our mouths dropped in amazement... These suckers were massive! Each half of the sandwich was precariously held together by wooden skewers. I took one bite and immediate felt giddy with happiness. Meaty, juicy, and packed with flavor... Definitely worth the $20+ price tag. We rashly ordered sides, but figured we might as well, since it was our last night in Vegas. Go big or go home, right? Two sides, coleslaw and pickles. The coleslaw was okay, but their house made pickles were delish!   45 minutes later, we tapped out. Needless to say, our eyes were too big for our tummies because we both ate equivalent of half a sandwich... we should have just split one. Took our leftovers with us to eat as a late night snack.  Go. Eat. This. Now.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. pickles
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. meet the &#34;Woody Allen&#34;
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dwS4h3mNC6x9h6Qw42ljGw.text: I have to say, reading all these good reviews about this place makes me wonder if I dined at the same place as all the other reviewers. To me, this place was just OK. Everything seemed a bit overpriced for my liking, even by Vegas standards. I ordered a ham and egg sandwich that costed $12.99. Granted, they did pack that sandwich with a lot of eggs. Still, a reasonable price would have been half of that price, but whatever, we were hungry and didn't want Denny's on the strip.   This cafe did it's job for us in that it fed us when we were hungry late into the night (or morning). Would I come back? Probably not. We probably would have gotten more bang for our bucks at Denny's instead.

BobAWoDLoUwasjpyuxfgrA.text: Good not great but huge portion sandwiches so I would split for two people. Meat is tender and flavorful but everything else is just okay. Worth the trip just not a repeat for me.
