Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Giant potato knish. (Normal-sized fork.)

gAhjSx0vcvXA_cMSSaTH6w.text: This place is a staple. The Woody Allen is a must get. It's comes packed with a ton of two types of meat. The pastrami and corned beef. I ordered to go and they asked if I wanted the bread on the side. Great service and yes, made my to go meal perfect for the room. The strawberry cheesecake was good and creamy. I still enjoy coming here.

boUULvvTcAhn1Do9cpUtwA.text: We used to go here years ago.  First thing I noticed is they've downsized the menu, and now you order at the counter.   Next thing I noticed is you do get served quicker which is a plus, but frankly I miss things like matzah brei....the potato pancake was ok, maybe not quite cooked in the middle.   The pastrami was decent, although maybe a bit more in the salty side than it should be.   Pickles were ok, not quite crisp enough.   Portions still fairly large, although I seem to remember bigger.    I'd still stop for a quick bite, but miss many of the foods on the old menu and the old school waitresses that made it special....

st6O4OKGot1w6tBZAEkW9w.text: Love this place. The line moves fast, the menu is varied and the atmosphere is SO NYC. I play MyVegas, the free MGM game on Facebook, so I scored a free slice of cheesecake. Full price it's $10.99-$11.99 depending on what slice you get. I stuck with the classic strawberry, and while our host couldn't answer if it was gluten free or not ("Is there gluten in this?" "Gluten? It's cheesecake.")  I still enjoyed it while the bf saved the gluten questions and played some slots. It's perfect for sharing like everything here is, and very delicious. If you're looking for a taste of authentic NYC, stop by!

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zuD0izwV0d_jlHmPbbBpJg.text: Was in Vegas to run a 1/2 marathon and stayed at the Mirage and of course being originally from NYC and knowing great pastrami sandwiches. I just had to get a Rueben Pastrami on rye. Omg I was in heaven. I got it with French fries and a side of coke slaw. They also threw in 2 luscious pickles. It's a little pricey, but that's expected in a hotel restaurant in Vegas. Hint if your a veteran get a players club card from the casino. You'll get great discounts at various restaurants. They gave me one here. Ok  three thumbs up for a fat over the top sandwich  on 11/14/2018

haoBTXWQiZkikDl7c_9Dkg.text: This is what a deli is all about. Fresh meats. Plentiful servings. Delicious breads. Makes one yearn for the northeast.

E0k1UE4c0iedgiTl3ptHTg.text: Cashier was a little rude, not friendly.  Ordered a burger and fries.  Very delicious.  Our waiter was very nice and friendly; always smiled.

6o2_RYqCxqQN9r6VmSjOsQ.text: $25 for a Ruben is a lot. But you get a lot of sandwich. More than one person can eat. We shared it between 4 people and with fries it was enough.   Half sandwich combo is a good deal and cheese cakes look fantastic.   Will go again.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

WFcX__978kvXuVoAMgVjPQ.text: One of my dear friends who lives in Seattle invited me to help him celebrate his 50th birthday in Las Vegas on June 25th, and they were staying at The Mirage.  Have been wanting to try a pastrami Reuben here for about two years, and this was gonna be my opportunity!  At 10:00 am!  While I was extremely enthused about the sandwich, don't usually stretch my guts to capacity that early.  Will get to it-  Ambiance/Cleanliness-Well, it sure ain't like any of the delis in NYC that I grew up with....it's like a coffee shop/diner as filtered though Las Vegas functionality.  Clean....nothing very special....3 stars.  Service-The hostess was lovely, but when I ordered my sandwich, the manager said that they were out of pastrami, and I got fairly nasty, fairly quickly.  Magically, the necessary pastrami was located, and we were in business.  Food came out within 10 minutes of ordering.  Since they made it happen, something that should NEVER happen again....4 stars.  Food-One of the best sandwiches I have ever eaten in my life.  It was superb!  My friends had breakfast food, and I can't comment on that, other to say, I don't see the point.  My Reuben?  Perfectly toasted rye, with a nice Russian/Thousand Island dressing, perfectly drained sauerkraut and a solid maybe 12+ ounces of delightful pastrami, hand cut with melted Swiss cheese on top.  It would make a fabulous last meal!  I'm subtracting 1 star for the price of $25.00.  That's steep!...4 stars  I'll be back for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cinnamon roll, I was told it was quite tasty.
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Another omelet
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pretty sure this was their ham-n-cheese omelet

pJYlpWE6QrVAW8GeyqfG6w.text: I literally stay at the Mirage knowing this place is inside (that and I do amazingly well at their Blackjack tables). I grew up in Jersey with access to some of the best diners and delis that NYC affords, so it kills me when I read reviews from people who dont understand the concept, type of food, etc. An authentic NYC diner offers massive portions of meats on bread, does breakfast insanely well but basic, and features a lot of kosher Jewish stuff. I've had everything from the matza ball soup to the massive pastrami sandwich and it's about as good as it can get for being on the other side of the country. Love getting an egg cream and the macaroni salad is spot on. Service for me has always been fine. Will be back soon!

BXpK9twzzNgFib6G9dAAIg.text: I have always heard about this place and Wow!! what a pastrami sandwich! Service at the counter was friendly and helpful since being our 1st time. We split the sandwich and it was plenty of sandwich for the two of us. Our server Patrick was very friendly

1VwH4fG_9Z2eO72auEOqgQ.text: Ok cool... I saw a thing about the NY location on the Travel Channel and I got to try the one in Vegas. This is more of a place to go to so you can say afterward to your friends, "Yeah I've had Carnegie Deli!" and that's pretty much it.   Their sandwiches were not bad, but I don't know when I would ever crave something stacked with meat that is a mile high. Although I must admit their their pastrami and corned beef were pretty darn good... It's a fun place for late night eating, and to see people's reactions when their food comes out, haha. This place charges a fee for splitting plates... thank god it was not a per person fee!

7omqaydTD5zBsvBS65CKLQ.text: The Woody Allen is just HYPE. I came here for our last meal in Vegas and since we were staying at the Mirage, it was convenient. We ordered to go and went back to our rooms to enjoy a nice quiet lunch since the restaurant was bustlin' with morning brunchers. Originally we were going to order just a salad and maybe an omelet, but I let my eyes eat and so the boyfriend and I decided to split the Woody Allen. I admit, its a sight or the eyes. The meat wasn't distributed well though. I had wished they had mixed the corned beef and the pastrami together more instead of one on top of the other. Luckily we asked for extra bread so I was able to make two sandwiches out of my half of the sandwich. Yes there was THAT much meat! The meat in general was pretty dry and lacked a lot of flavors. I barely finished it and saved my second sandwich for the flight home which looking in retrospect was a darn good idea. ;) I think it tasted better on the way home all soggy than it did fresh. I am SOO happy we ordered fries because it was probably the most enjoyable part of the meal! It was perfect shoe string fries, well fried and seasoned! Order this and skip the woody allen. Their menu is extensive so I'm sure you'll find something  We didn't get charged for sharing which I'm thinking is because we ordered it togo. Awesome! Just some food for thought!

ULXrFjVEG_Rmp3bIbe2bJw.text: Having heard so much about this place, I made it a personal mission to wrap my lips around a giant meat sandwich while I was in Vegas this time around.   Being Miss Drunkie McDrunkerson, I sent the beau across the way to pick me up the fabulous sounding Bacon Whoopie (chicken salad with bacon!). He returned with the most fabulously large sandwich, and I was ecstatic.   The chicken salad was delicious--better than the stuff I make at home--and the bacon was thick and crisp. I had Swiss added and  asked for sourdough and it turned out to be the perfect combination.   My only issue with this sammy was the way it was layered. I get the whole 'big sandwich' theme going' on (I know they have a reputation to keep) but I've never been someone to get excited over a third piece of bread in the middle of my sandwich. The layering went like this, from the bottom up: bread, chicken salad, Swiss, bread, bacon, half a head of iceberg lettuce, one whole tomato. I promptly dismantled the thing and layered it the way it should have been: bacon and other toppings carefully crammed against the chicken salad and cheese and topped with the second (and last) piece of bread.   I will definitely eat here again and I won't have any problem putting a little work into the darn thing to make it perfect!

-O0Cydp9iJf1_6MpL9T3uA.text: What's not to like about a mile high sandwich filled with pastrami!   Yum!

5esQ0cvZqr4YZv4Kd7JHXQ.text: Corned beef sandwich and new york style cheesecake forever! I ate here twice one vegas trip

ifn-vDsoB6DsMckGR1TkNQ.text: It is horrifying how quickly I can inhale one of the pastrami sandwiches here. We're talking Shark Week or something.  There's like a pound of meat on the thing, and there's legitimately spicy brown mustard dripping out of the sandwich onto my hand, from both pieces of soft, seeded rye bread. I'm lucky I don't bite a knuckle off. The pastrami, cured and smoked in-house, is tender, flavorful, moist and marbled with fat. Yeah, it's not diet food.  Since Carnegie is open all night it's one of the best late-night options in town, especially if you're not trying to eat bar food or casino coffee shop fare.

qdFLg2JMOIu6B5ESGoRXdg.text: Been here twice before and looking forward to my Woody Allen overdose again this weekend. May just have to go both days I'm in town!!!

MVsE0tJN9NAXmOZBiEouHA.text: Service was horrible, cheesecake was pretty good... you get three strawberries with no strawberry sauce... was very disappointing as we had high hopes :(

PddmiQ1pMQeB6zyCt6kLmA.text: Hubby and I arrived late and was looking for a place to eat and this was one of the restaurants that were still open so we decided to give it a try since the buffet was closed.  Their french fries were cooked perfectly (well, to our liking that is) but the chicken salad sandwich we ordered was a little on the dry side. Our server was a little slow to accommodate but otherwise an okay place.

JvH8Q_7Hak7L7HL2v0UjXA.text: Long wait, slow service, a little pricey, $3 charge to share but huge portions.  Although I was expecting much more, the pastrami tasted decent. It was tender and thickly sliced, but the flavor wasn't anything special.  Maybe the one in NY is better.

Hcz4gFyfEgZKxN65BWbOXw.text: Omg, worst than Denny's!  And it's expensive!! Got myself a lobster roll and it tasted like lobster just came out from freezer. 3 pieces of salmon cost $17! A cup of coffee and a cup of juice is $4.25! 3 sunny side up eggs are very raw in the middle but burn on the outside!!! How can you even do that? Lol

o6jBfcOeZysi_FkUh8IB3A.text: 2 stars for what I order I kinda expected better   for all the choices listed I think I should of went with something else I was told there rye sandwich was massive should of known that before I placed my order for eggs hash and all beef franks, my friends corned beef omlette looked better, their pickles that the offer you are saltier then you expect, Valasic pickles got a better crunch and taste in my opinion the ones offered here needed water to get through it.  sunny side eggs standard, hash was standard also, all beef frank 1inch sliced just ok  I don't think I would visit this place again, sorry folks no go for me  food ** not so great service *** es ok price $$ most dishes over $10 ambiance ** middle of a casino haha diner feeling so not there

FFUprED36Ql9RKT8rFjnCA.text: Good delicatessen!  The matzo ball soup was excellent. This place definitely knows what their doing!

fxoK7iqKUpxLrczyq4qsEg.text: We ate at the Carnegie Deli twice last week.  The first time, my mom and I split a corned beef sandwich and it was delicious; the meat was extremely moist and it practically melted in my mouth.  My husband got a ruben sandwich and enjoyed it.  We liked our meal so much, we decided to return the next day.  Unfortunately, our experience the next day was just so-so.  This time my husband & I split a corned beef sandwich but the meat was extremely dry & chewy.  I couldn't even eat it.  I had a bowl of matzo ball soup instead and it was delicious.  I was really disappointed by the corn beef and based on the inconsistency, I probably would not return.  A Jewish deli HAS to do corned beef well and I don't mind paying the high prices if it's good but based on our experience, it's not consistently good!

fKMOri0cRUx93szODUkbRw.text: This is a pretty good knock off of the original in NYC.  Granted the fact that the portions are not as obnoxiously large as the one in NYC it tastes pretty much the same.  Plus it's still way larger than any sandwich ever needs to be so I guess I should stop complaining lol.  Minus a star because our server took forever to get back to us at any given time and it so wasn't busy, it was like a late Friday after noon!  It's all good though :)

rMS-U_x10V0pBVOy_ViM2w.text: Like my friends Dennis T and Smitcha B said before... This place is just alright. It's open and it's food.  The problem I have with this place is that the portions are HUGE. They are meant for giants from Harry Potter. I think Hagrid would go to town on this shit. When i'm in Vegas, the liquid diet commences and I can't eat much. When i say liquid diet, i mean i'm drinking a lot of booze. I dont' mean i'm starving myself to shrivel up like a supermodel. C'mon now, I love food! Anyway the portions are HUGE. Even if you try to order a regular sandwich like I did, the amount of meat they give you in the sandwich is at least 4 inches thick. I honestly cannot eat THAT much pastrami.  People who order the triple deckers are nuts. Has the guy from Man VS Food come here yet!?!? It's disgusting. Anyway.. the quality of the pastrami itself is sufficient. I ate about half the meat in my sandwich but I found myself dipping it into a lot of ketchup and deli mustard. I came back for breakfast because this was the only place close that wasn't a buffet. I had the 3 eggs [scrambled]w/ bacon from the breakfast menu. I think the eggs they were steroided out eggs or something because it DID NOT look like 3 eggs. It eggs took up more than half my plate and looked like at least 6 eggs. INSANE. The pickles however, would be enough for Snooki from Jersey Shore to cream her panties.

YyuvJG5hSGXmGMckiSd8fA.text: $3 for Sharing...  What a rip off, we had a sandwich family style and they charged us $3.  We got nothing extra for sharing.  Basically they bring you a sandwich, get an extra plate,,$3...  Its not like they are splitting the sandwich up inside the kitchen or giving you extra bread...  If a Chinese restaurant had that policy, it would be $3 more on every item...  Crazy business practice...

Ysid1FIZVoBu1O1CYPiq2g.text: Fabulous food. Insane prices.  Sanwhiches the size of your father's head.  For a 'food Jew' (definition:  a person of Jewish background who only participates in the food aspect of Judism when available 'cause it's that kind'a good) I was OBSESSED with the matza ball soup, and I know my matza ball soup.  Yum.   The pickles were AMAZING.  AND I DON'T EVEN REALLY LIKE PICKLES!!  They have a sharing fee of $3, so when I had a taste of my husbands omlette (also amazing!!) I felt all crazy and sly doing it.  I have never felt that way about eating eggs before. Good food. Fun. The line can be long.   It sounds insane to pay a $3 sharing fee, but the food can be HUGE so it's worth it. (One lady was so taken aback by her meal that she simply stared at it for a full five minutes before digging in... I watched it happen..)

Sq8zzRFcWEfNcLyQ4uXBJQ.text: Pretty good spot  I ordered the pastrami sandwich which we had to share haha  Pickles are good Kosher  Kinda reminds me of canters in la

g0QzzvakOrZtMxJCT5_E8A.text: The Skinny: this is a place where you come to get f&*ked up by a massive so-so pastrami, tongue, brisket and chopped liver (2)value: there's a lot of meat but it just ain't that good (2) service: good efficient - gave us extra bread to take home(4)  We've always walked past Carnegie Deli in Mirage to get to The Forum Shops at Caesar's Palace. The alluring scent of smoking meat from Carnegie wafts over the whole area and we've been eyeing to try this place for awhile.  Not being able to choose, we decided to do a sandwich and did a custom meat sandwich that includes 4 meat choices. So we tried the brisket, the tongue, the chopped liver, and the pastrami.   When the sandwich got to the table, it was shock and awe. It was something straight out of Man vs. Food in montrosity. That being said, was even that good?  The answer is not really. The brisket is pretty bland while the pastrami is surprisingly tough. The tongue is okay but really needed to be heated up with the rest of the meat-fest. The liver was well seasoned however with this sandwich - there was just too much of it to really enjoy any of it. As for the bread... what bread? It sort of gets lost in the shuffle amongst all the meat. But when you got a taste of the rye, it was rather dry.  Our service was okay. She was actually quite nice and gave us some extra bread to take home when we asked for a take-home container.  Curiosity satisfied we packed up the remains of our sandwich. It took me and the hubs 3 days to finish that monster. RIP mo-fo... you were one bada&*-kicking Sammy. 2 starred Godzilla sandwich.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Free pickle
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Choose Your Own Adventure - Pastrami/Tongue/Brisket/Chopped Liver - it took 3 days and 2 people to lay this one to rest - RIP.
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JLWYyrtdi2jFXeLcxiE6mA.text: We decided to try the famed Carnegie pastrami and corned beef inside the Mirage.  We put our name in for a booth and waited less than ten minutes. Bravo!!!  We sat down and all decided on the Woody Allen, which was a pound of corned beef and a pound of pastrami on two slices of rye bread.  The pastrami was tender and moist , but the corned beef was a bit on the dry side.   We did add their spicy mustard to liven up the meat and tried their whole pickles which were zesty and tasty.  The corned beef was exceptionally lean with the pastrami being on the fattier side.  Nothing to get really excited about, but fun to try.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Woody Allen Sandwich at The Carnegie Deli Mirage Casino

Z-OAuN97Ww0H6Ejgy_jeWQ.text: Big sandwich...that's about all. The taste was ok hence the three stars.  Ordered one sand which and two drinks with an ordernof fries for $44. Gave a $6 tip and the lady at the register snickered. What?  Wait...I tipped before any service was given. Lucky she got anything at all for doing nothing at that point. Big sandwich, that's all. Been there done that and won't be back....

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xLVovnmlTMb0F0AcUIhlVA.text: I will echo some of the other reviewers in that I was extremely disappointed to see the menu and service changes that have taken place recently at Carnegie Deli.  I did not like the format of ordering and paying at the counter first, the reduced menu selections, and reduced staffing.    Soda was served in plastic cups with plastic lids.  No complimentary pickles.  No specials.  Waiter shamed us into our order-- "are you sure you want two sandwiches, most people split."  The size of the sandwiches has always been part of the fun!  They have taken one of my favorite Mirage food choices and ruined it.  I will not be returning unless they change it back to the previous style of service.

pqaQP2CG_3Ydn1kuS5M7-w.text: This was the most horrid place I've ever been to.  Costumer service was terrible! There was a tall old guy who made us move tables and he was very rude about it, and on top of that they gave us the wrong order. We ordered a cheese burger and we got a giant pastrami sandwich instead that was just plain nasty. NEVER GO HERE THEY SUCK !!!!!!!!

CY28SrdOMwQB7dlFulj0Eg.text: It really makes me sad to write a bad review for this place, but I really feel that the remodel ruined the experience. The first time my husband and I came to Vegas, this was where we went and I've never forgotten it. He food was delicious and worth the seemingly exorbitant price, and it was warm and friendly. A traditional sit down restaurant.   Now, it might as well have been turned into a fast food establishment and it has lost all of the charm that made it so desirable. I'm not going to stand in line and order and $18 sandwich at the counter, without being warmly greeted or treated like much of a person at all. The servers seem to have been forced to take on more than their fair share, and as much as our server was still really sweet, it seems like they have been run completely ragged. I'm sure their tips have been severely affected by the change, and that upsets me even more. You can really tell a lot by how management treats their employees. Forcing them to take on such a significant amount of work has caused a slow and decline in service.  If they ever decide to change back to a traditional restaurant, I'll be back. Otherwise, one of my favorite Vegas experiences has been ruined (I have my suspicions about mirage adding a new restaurant "the pantry" and wanting to make it seem more appealing) and I will not return. I'll likely never recommend this place,  either. There are too many great restaurants in Vegas to be treated like zombie cattle running through a line. So so very disappointed.

4PBFvkLup-Mv9_5mgwErJA.text: Never had the privedledge of the original deli in NewYork, but now they are in the west. The Carnegie in Mirage has all the incredible corned beef, pastrami and turkey. Huge sandwiches, delicious fries, lots of choices We had dinner and then breakfast the next day-corned beef hash with,an egg. Lots of meat, big plates of food, most can serve two. A bit of heaven.

7Oz0PWR8oHukZWYW7ETMJw.text: Food poisoning!   If I could give zero stars I would. Just horrible!  The place has changed! It's now a fast food type place, order and get your own seat. I originally when there for their chicken pot soup which they no long had. Should have turned around and left!!!  Had their matzo ball soup, the matzo balls (2) came in a plate with a cup of what I call salt water separately!  It was so salty that diluting it didn't make it better. When I told the waiter, the guy said: "it's like that, you may not be one that eat a lot of salt"! Um, I've never had such salty matzo ball soup given to me where the matzo balls are cold and separate from the soup!  Ordered the lobster roll. Should have known better.  Don't know which gave me food poisoning but....  Beware!!!!

9qZLFQDDrxrXCJtmyinlWA.text: Always loved the food here and the fact that it is 24/7, but since my last visit they have ditched the serving staff and you basically order at the front (which seems to really slow things down) and then you go sit and they bring you the food, you don't really have a server, so if you have any additional requests, it can become difficult to flag someone down and have your request taken care of.  Quality is still good, loved the corn beef hash and the breakfast options.

gKfDLKmZ43yqGTltNEM-ow.text: The food is Amazing!!! The service was HORRIBLE! So you order your food, get given a number and walk out to the dining area to find about 8 tables piled high with the plates from patrons long gone. Really? Nobody can wipe down a table? We literally had to stand and wait for about 10-15 minutes for someone to finally listen to us and clear a table. We asked the guy up front and he just said they'll get to it when they get to it. We tried to flag one of the servers down and they blew right past us. When they did finally clear ours. They didn't bother cleaning any other tables and so we had the entertainment of watching patrons go through the same thing we did each time until our food came out. Now the food was amazing, the Reuben, the Turkey club, the Pastrami, the knish, the cheesecake. All so amazing! But the only way I will eat here again is takeout.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Reuben
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Club

9qOyDRvt_k1XYohEZJp9sA.text: If you moved to North Alaska from New York and find yourself at The Mirage with a craving for deli, this is your spot.  Otherwise it's a ridiculously overpriced poor imitation of a real deli.  Lox and bagel for $23.00??? Really???  Captive audience with limited choices is the only reason that places like this exist and survive.  Stick with the buffet, the food quality is mediocre but at least it's inexpensive mediocre.

ioyvevRO9rg-HnxT3yAX5g.text: HUGE pastrami sandwich that two of us shared and still couldn't finish. It must have been 5 inches tall! Delicious and surprisingly lean. Add a dish of fresh pickles and mustard. It is perfection.  Highly recommend. If you can, pack the leftovers. You'll wish you had them after a few hours in the casino.  The only downside is the smoke filters in and really takes away from the enjoyment of the lovely food. This seems to be the smokiest and unluckiest casino on The Strip.

fqwVI0oHXXgwcMZGCUKXGQ.text: So like most people, I have always heard of the brilliance of Carnegie Deli in New York.  When my boyfriend and I found this hidden away in The Mirage, we decided to jump in and order some food.  The place was busy!  Although the seating area was at max capacity, the service was still pretty good minus a few blunders [i.e.  The boyfriend getting coffee when he ordered a soda].  Blunders are forgivable; especially when the place is busy.  So the boyfriend ordered some kinda of burger with a huge plate of fries [I don't know why fries aren't complimentary on The Strip --- not American!] while I stuck with the Meat Loaf.  Portions are gigantic --- just like the hype!  Too bad everything tasted bland.  The thing that makes me give it 3-stars though is dirty utensils.  I don't care how busy it easy.  Dirty utensils at my table and all surrounding tables is NOT OKAY!

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meat Loaf Dinner

ryCUAjbhKKBrVoI-qDQy_Q.text: For a late breakfast, i talked my hubby into splitting the club...and thanks goodness. The two of us -- starving as we were -- could not finish it. We left behind enough slices turkey for a large sandwich. So damn good though.

aZPYzj4Nx4GGYruiivPRHA.text: Must go check this New York Deki out!  The woody sandwich is fantastic must share!  I'm from New York and this is close.  Winning best realtor of the year 2years in a row in Las Vegas I know what I'm talking about 702-219-2585

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. There woody Allen so good like New York

CTw9l-1pGeHLQ-s5lUCUrw.text: I was here when it first opened up and it was amazing..homemade pickles in the table the attention to detail was on point. I have come back to celebrate my aunts birthday and she was so excited because I was raving about it. We get here we are greeted by the hostess Dorian she didn't know how to take an order I had to correct her 3 times, she got very nasty and short. We seat ourselves and we were finally greeted by a very wonderful server named Sandra she read off our order and Dorian had put the wrong sandwich down Sandra took care of everything with a smile always checked on us and saved this experience. I am in the food industry so I understand but when I spend $80 on mediocre food for 3 sandwiches  I expect the attention to detail to be on point...it's not like it was before I would have gladly spent $100 but not anymore  and to pay for parking  on top of it? Cut us a break... the only reason I gave it 3 stars is for Sandra...

PYECp38qY37Qynz_kjdlYA.text: Food was great. The cheesecake is delivered from New York three times a week to Las Vegas. It's a must try. I can only complain about the waitress not being attentive. We had to ask for our drinks to be re-filled and our dessert to be served.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New York Cheesecake
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Turkey  Club (Don&#39;t know where to start)

qG757ayxzl6AqUNmrvlIIw.text: Stopped in for a slice of the Cheesecake.  Back home we have Noshville, which tries to be a Carnegie Deli, and they sell this particular style of Cheesecake that my wife loves.  We didn't have anything but the Cheesecake, but I did observe a few things.  First, the sandwiches are HUGE, easily enough to share. Second, the service is SLOW. Don't come if you are in a hurry, you will only be cross.  No complaints though, everyone seemed pretty happy with what they were eating.  I'd stop back in and try a sandwich for sure.

O7Va2Sqgv1lnrruaINUHTA.text: They refused to put condiments on my sandwich. I asked for mayo, oil, vinegar; the guy looked at me like I had insulted his mother.  $18 for a sandwich so tall that it's impossible to eat.  Nothing like NY bread, or quality.  Very disappointed.

LBVeD-uUm8L6mjN-Kcbu_g.text: Huge portions of high quality meat in their pastrami sandwiches. Rich and creamy chocolate truffle cheese cake. Come hungry and ready to have left overs!

ePjo8MMUd0qhD66p1F2h-w.text: when you see pictures in the magazines, you say that sandwich is not that big.  But when you actually dine here, you see first hand.  this sandwich is huge.  If you are a Hot pastrami lover, then this is your place.  Sandwich was great.  getting hungry just thinking about it.  looking forward to my next visit.

GyjdRPEpqOme8gZKsl-I0Q.text: We order the RoastBeef sandwich. It was way too cold for me. I mean maybe it's the way it is but not my favorite. Now my friends order the Pastrami sandwich and that one was really good. I mean Really good. Make sure if you go there try it out. Other peoples good choice was the Reuben.   I didn't have my phone for a pic but it's pretty much what you see on the other pics.

LBa2KTRXkxE-P8DJwWzuJQ.text: It was very hard not to conclude this was openly discrimination.  It is ashame we get to this low.  Today at the Carnergie deli the one at Mirage hotel. The Spanish casheir tream me like trush( I say spanish base on her appearance and accest).   I stand there about 15 min wait for service, while the cashier busy talking to another employee, then she end up help another couple who come behind me.  Anyway, after I order my food, she asked for my ID, because I told her to charge to my room. That was fine for me, but the other customer who did the same thing charge her bill to her room, she didn't ask for her ID.   She put my food in the bag like trush. I have to ask her to warm my food, and even ask to put in a container.   I was at the same place yesterday and order the same, and the service was very nice.   Although I stay at The mirage, but I believe this is my last time to eat Cargegie deli.  Your need to give your staff proper training. Also they need to be reminded to lieve their person at home

9iahPdryYQp-TlzFViGZpw.text: Where the heck did my review go. Oh well - Pleasantly surprised with my dinner. My waitress was awesome. I've taken a shot of her for you guys to see. Ask for the French Fries well done - they were so good.
