ccL_Bg3GQ0d8jB97IaIcGQ.text: This place has went downhill. Ate here a few years back and the food was great and really large portions like they used to do in NYC.  Now, the service is average and the food is just like any old deli.  Not a fan!

vmMLAAXPkOLoN0xXbL_83A.text: We were at the Mirage feeling hungry, and this place was conveniently located near the entrance. We noticed the lineup, and the signed photos of Billy Joel and Lenny Krevitz on the wall, so we decided to try this place out for a quick snack. They sell sandwiches, omelettes, and big cookies! We ordered two boxes of fries for 2.99 each. The fries itself weren't very crispy but that could be due to the fact that we let it sit too long in the bag as we walked back to Caesars Place. As a ketchup lover, I appreciated that they gave so many packets of ketchup! The service was very quick here, and all food is available for takeout.

gcR-h3_l-c_iLF72wRWqBA.text: The staff could not keep up with the dirty tables. So we had to wait a long time for a seat. While the servings are quite large, I didn't find the quality to be that great, especially for the price. The cornbeef was flavorless... and the pastrami very dry.  I would have give it only 2 stars, but we got a discount through the MyVegas Slots app so we only paid for one sandwich.

0V06Tl6c4z3yo1uCreev2g.text: We always visit Carnegie in the Mirage Hotel and Casino while we are in Las Vegas.  It's our favorite place for deli Pastrami sandwiches.  We share one very large pastrami sandwich and an order of fries, and add a couple of beers. It's the pastrami in the West.  We have had dessert also and their pies are large, but excellent!  The service is outstanding and the orders arrive very quickly.  We always recommend this place to others.  Glad it has not changed because it's consistently great!

OG9_vBXlwPIn9p4ZuMmxHA.text: Such a disappointment...mostly because I had to put my house up to pay for meals for a party of 5 people. And to top it off the food was nothing special. Bigger and more does not make better.

rmGrcAB48TJlEjZPoA7h0w.text: Note - It's been years since I have been to the Carnegie Deli in NYC, so I can't quite compare it to the original.  My husband and I ate here one afternoon. We were staying in the mirage and wanted a little lunch after our day lounging at the pool. We decided to give it a whirl and got it to go.  We split a order of fries and the turkey club and it was more than enough. It was a good turkey sandwich -- especially considering the size. We likely wouldn't ask out this place to eat had we not been staying in the mirage - but it was good for a late lunch. It's very pricey. Since we split the sandwich it wasn't too bad -- but I'm sure we could have found better/cheaper sandwiches on the strip.. Had we not just wanted something close. I'd eat it again but wouldn't be a top choice.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Turkey club

n2N1q_OsdDWVZuz_4IiI2g.text: The food was good. But our service was horrible.  Chasing the waitress for 15 mins for our fries.  The inconsiderate service and constant ignoring our calls. Just a horrible experience.

RHR9AA_kenLQm8i49JSjOw.text: Great food here always got to get here every so often. One of my best places for a good deli sandwich.

abS9ZbNTrZZCl5TVauNn8A.text: The pastrami had a legendary reputation and lived up to it. Wife enjoyed the egg salad sandwich. Busy Saturday night but food came out reasonably quick.

vkur9r8XODSHojZyxhdDBQ.text: OK, but expensive and not as advertised. Been wanting to go to Carnegie in New York for decades, but you snooze, you lose. So, LV was going to be the second best thing. I knew a Woody Allen would be expensive (it was nearly $30 by the time all was accounted for). Yes, it was a good sandwich with a lot of meat...but NOTHING like the pictures of the sandwich they post. See my photo for the comparison. I get that Vegas is the city of dream and illusion, but some truth in advertising is still called for.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The promise...and the reality.

SdqJdejIg2XaCeZW8FsCfg.text: I stayed at the Mirage the last time I was in Vegas and Carnegie Deli was the perfect place to run for a quick, but satisfying meal!  I loved how the restaurant imitated the NY deli, from the fresh food to the cafeteria-like dining room!  The prices are much higher than you would expect, but that is consistent with the rest of the food in the Mirage and other Vegas hotels.  Carnegie has a register and menu at the entrance where you order and pay.  You can order your meal to go or you can sit in the deli dining room and have someone bring your food to you.  The dining room is comfortable and casual.  The sandwich portions are massive.  I couldn't even finish one half!  They had several choices available for a "Make Your Own Deli Sandwich" option.  My favorite sandwich was the roast beef and cheddar cheese on whole wheat bread.  All of the meat, cheese, veggies and sauces were fresh and delicious.  I also, surprisingly, loved the Matzo Ball soup!  I didn't really know what to expect, but it was really good!  Although I did not try it, the Reuben looked phenomenal as well!  In addition to lunch and dinner, Carnegie has a decent selection of breakfast items on their menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roast beef sandwich &amp; Matzo Ball soup

TatzRZqPyfph4BytsD7vlQ.text: A 3.5 stars spot!  Having a deli in the middle of the Las Vegas strip is very very tricky!  People expect to get HUGE portions, but to pay affordable price. For most delis that would work, but for a deli that I located at the Mirage casino it just can't happen.   The food is good! It's very tasty-  The sandwiches are big.  Their shnitzel is crispy and good. Their turkey sandwich is yummy. Their matzoh ball soup is just like grandmas.   One of the best parts is actually the service!  Super nice friendly servers will do ANYTHING to make you happy! Especially Pam- she did a fantastic job!  And been doing that for years!   Another cool thing about this spot is that they give discounts to locals!  And this thing can be an issue because this place is expensive!   So overall it's a good place! Not the best deli I've been to, but tasty and super friendly staff. Too bad their expensive!   Trust me. I know food!

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo Turkey sandwich, chips, pickle and soda.

KDBkEPmsy6oZjeMBnDMF_A.text: Too many libations at rhumbar drove our threesome here for some good eatin'! It's been a while since I was here and I opted for the giant hot dog with saurkraut. For $8, minus the 20% locals' discount (which they don't advertise) it's not a bad deal.  I got the discount when I showed my license with my credit card but had forgotten about it otherwise. My local friend got shafted on that. May that be a lesson to always ask about locals' discounts!!! We all had the hot dog and with the addition of mustard, mine was quite tasty and filling.  You can always choose a giant sandwich to split or other deli staples here as well. Service time was quick and I guess we got lucky that it wasn't packed.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Locals 20% discount. ....

f1wyuxCIzup390266O9LMQ.text: It's nice to still have the Carnegie Deli since the original in NYC has closed. Food is great but prices are somewhat pricy. They have changed the type of seating in the restaurant... you order like a cafe, take a number and find your own table. Fine, but not a typical restaurant experience.

0jsHnZ0h6amZNiGBgvJwQA.text: Since the Pantry, Mirages other 24 hour restaurant opened, I think the line is smaller at Carnegie Deli. But why on earth did they change the format from sit down restaurant to order from counter and grab a number and find a seat?   I agree with other reviews here, it certainly has lost its appeal, even though their sandwiches (just get corned beef or pastrami; rest are average and all feed an army) are the same as is their breakfast, just like how I remembered. Pantry's smash Browns kicks butt over Canegie hash browns though.   I guess one good thing is you don't have to pay tip or do you still have too with its new format? I left standard 15%. Curious what others have done.

svmvMrAv6IWdoD2ZShAHgg.text: Got into Vegas around 10 or 11 at night, and came here for the midnight munchies.  There was a wait even at this time, but it was reasonable.  The pastrami sandwiches here are HUGE, as mentioned by other Yelpers.  My boyfriend claims it was the best pastrami sandwich he's ever had, and he's clamoring to come back.  Very very good and one of the good value places in Vegas to eat at.  Their cheesecake is also delectable.  Definitely stop by here when your stomach and your wallet needs a break from fine dining.  *** update 3/27/08 I had to take off 1 star for service this time.  The bf had a craving for pastrami so we came a little around 1 am.  The servers were unfriendly, a bit understandable for 1 am, but I was disappointed.  I also ordered a potato knish, which is huge.  Yummy, but perhaps you'd want to share.  Picture above.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Potato Knish

LxhErfBpJTGLezFiax60rQ.text: Randomly went here with my best friend while in Vegas. Didnt know what to expect. Ordered a pastrami sandwich. BEST.SANDWICH.EVER. The pastrami was so soft & warm. Everything made fresh.. right down to the pickle. HOLY CRAP. & the portions were HUGE. It was a little pricey $16 for a sandwich but totally worth it considering it took me 2 days to finish the left overs. Please go to this Deli when youre in Vegas. Youd be a fool not to.

8g_CDYN-VRirxomSLZB5CQ.text: I visited this restaurant off a glance of the menu - since I love pastrami and corned beef.  However; to my disappointment, this HUGE sandwich (with enough meat for three sandwiches) was dry and flavorless :(.  I would never eat there again!

lHrGO85291SHHe9gp76Srg.text: The Carnegie Deli is absolutely a must whenever I visit Las Vegas. That I was staying next door at Treasure Island and also seeing the Cirque show "Love" was the perfect storm. Having been in New York last month and been to the original, this was a real treat getting a monthly dose of the Mother of All Delicatessens.  Grab the pastrami sandwich to go and went to town on it. As great as it always is. Special kudos to Seth at the counter for great service, personable and friendly. Very efficient and I was on my way with pastrami utopia.

PDNV575ohX1HCFgBGraA3g.text: OPEN 24/7!  Stopped by here after we came back from Marquee & changing in the room.  Not much I remember really of this place since I didn't order anything & was dozing off at the table.  Seated fast, food was brought out fast, the portions looked big, and our waiter was nice.  It must have looked like some of us were drunk so he asked us if we needed bread.  The pickles were okay, some didn't really look fresh though I still ate them, haha.  I tried a little of my friend's corn beef hash which had a lot of meat.  I don't think anyone was able to finish their meal, the portions were so big.

YXFyPyCyonpDtOuQZhwTPw.text: This was one of my favorite places in Las Vegas, WAS. Not sure what happened or why they changed it.  It's now run like a fast food restaurant, order your food and they bring it to the table. They had one of the best burgers on the strip, past tense.  I wanted it medium rare, no can do.  They only serve burgers medium well, not medium, not medium rare.  My guess, based on the bland taste, is they are par cooked in advance.  This pains me to say,  but stay away.  Even the pastrami was bland and cold.

rL3BgUdM1XD-_E3W-mZOJA.text: I've eaten at Carnegie Deli dozens of times, the corned beef rueben is our go to sandwich. It's plenty for my husband and me. The restaurant week menu convinced us to come in and try out their pastrami. We had each had 1/2 "Woody Allen" with pastrami and corned beef, a latke and a slice of cheesecake. It was filling! The corned beef is still the best in Vegas (better can be had at Katz's in NYC or Langer's in LA). The pastrami is good, but not as lean as we'd prefer. We'll stick to the corned beef in the future. The latke and cheesecake were tasty as usual.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. restaurant week cheesecake
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. restaurant week wood allen w/latke

eBz68sIHcTAzy7hoeIWpjA.text: This actually is a real deli, thus the prices are high, but in a way you get what you pay for. These are real deli sandwiches, piled high with good quality meat.  We had breakfast and everyone enjoyed their meal.  I had the cheese blintzes, and they were some of the best I've had.  This Jewish boy from Los Angeles never had them deep fried.  They were so lightly deep fried, and they kept their crisp.  Very delicious.  Overall, I enjoyed and would return if I stay at The Mirage again.

xLZFtxqyCJwIYMpQPUkGEQ.text: Granted, hunger makes me moody and judgmental, but my experience at Carnegie made me moodier than a New Yorker pushing her way onto the 9 train. Soup sounded like the ideal late night snack, and when you think soup, how can you not think Matzo ball? So, we arrived and ordered this potentially brilliant treat.  In the meantime, my husband was trying to find out if their bagels were True New York bagels. Our waitress had little idea, and my husband got up to ask the hostess. She said, "Everything is just like in New York." However, about that time, the chef showed up and said the bagels came from Great Buns. I doubt the bagels are going from Great Buns to Manhattan. The whole bagel episode frustrated me.   Then the soup arrived. The Matzo balls were giant and yellow-tinged. The broth came on the side, and the waitress ceremoniously poured it over the lurking balls. That was the most exciting part of this experience. There was not a morsel of chicken to be found and not a single vegetable, not even a carrot sliver! After my first slurp, I pronounced the broth flavorless, but then my husband took a sip and said he kinda liked it. So, I continued to ladle it into my mouth. Honestly, however, it was pretty flavorless and an unappetizing shade of yellow.   I thought I may be in a mood, so I decided to snap into a pickle, as pickles generally make me happy. However, there was no snapping to be done. The pickles were as mushy as the Matzo, and the flavor was the most insane combination of salty and sour. It was an insult to pickles. It made me want to cry. It was late.   I was tempted to give one star, but out of all fairness, I only had soup and a bite of pickle. Still, I am not sure I would trust a place that can't impress me with those two simple items. Better to save my New York cravings for New York I guess.

DAdif4d7zl7ieDKOhYpwrg.text: I love this place for the pickles they give you once you sit down at your table. Okay & the food is good too!  Been here twice, ordered breakfast types foods both times, & it definitely hit the spot.  They are known for their pastrami sandwiches, which is something I'll have to try next time I'm there!   Good service/quick as well No need for reservations

jKDK6Gju8x0vV_2TwyWc3Q.text: I wish I could give them 3.5 stars.  But, what the heck!  I'll round up.  We came here late one night after watching a show; we were trying to find a simple meal.  Instead, we got a meal that could last us for days.  The pastrami and roast beef : these are meats that I usually find too salty for my palette, but they were absolutely delicious here.  Especially with the bread and coleslaw we continuously requested!  Great service, even when they are busy.  Keep happy and smiling and they will do the same to you.

5frM4kGlnp-plYUEN9IQ4w.text: I'll rate a 5***** just because this place deserves a much higher rating overall ,the food Is so good here, pastrami is as good as you can get! Deserts out of this world! You should try it for your self Huge portions be prepared to share with somebody $3 extra plate charge a fair price I can eat and I couldn't finish my 1/2 Ruben they are that big! We also got fries to share and we couldn't even put a dent into those they too were good but I'd pass on them next time no need for sides with  Sandwiches this big don't let the lower rating scare you away ,I'm hard on places that don't stand up to the hype and hate to just give out 5 star but this place earned it !

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Now that&#39;s a Ruben!!!

BbC10smsX2n_kpRNrkcheg.text: Don't get the chicken salad - at $14 a sandwich it's just not worth it. The bread isn't great, it's a bit stale, and the chicken salad is rather bland. It might be a better deal than room service, but again the taste just wasn't there. Great portions, but not great taste. I didn't try the dessert, but the portions looked huge.

0B9nij6kGXqOlkBevwIqLw.text: great service and the food, the portions are unbelievable  shared with my wife and still left over plenty  late night dinner at 1AM in the casino, dirty stay outs I guess but was great

myPjs_Y3TzOxHjFGOZ9hEQ.text: Truly amazing sandwiches. Absolutely hits the spot if you've been drinking and need to fill up on food. Just be careful what you order and make sure you're on the brink of starvation, the portions are insanely massive. You get heaping mounds of meat in your sandwiches, almost to point where it's laughable. I ordered the Reuben that was super delicious. The only annoying thing was that I had to take almost 3/4 of it to go because I was so stuffed from eating the 1/4. So I ended up having to lug around 3 lbs. of meat all over the strip in a doggy bag. We didn't have a microwave in our room either so after it went cold it wasn't that great the next day. It had become a coagulated pastrami and cheese brick. Pretty nasty, ended up just throwing it away. For a $24 sandwich that kinda sucked.

yNznzOVfVpXRIHYtZA6KjA.text: For the price ($15), I just knew the pastrami would be delicious. WRONG!!! No flavor at all. The only compliment I can give is the fries were hot and good.

MicbkN77lDILPEvS7cW_Eg.text: I regret suggesting we try this place again. I'd thought maybe the dessert would live up to its reputation in NYC but alas, I was wrong. Twice.  The 5th Avenue cream pie sucked big time. How can they go wrong? Could it be the water?   I will definitely go to the original one in NYC when I visit next time. The cheesecakes, 5th Avenue and the borscht are the best there.   Sorry DD.

fmolUdIyFRtJQLkAFDI0tg.text: I will tell you that they have the biggest corned beef sandwich I have ever seen and it was delicious.  I was not a fan of the breakfast but the sandwiches are great.

PRPmUlG4yVZMhH7qdS0vXQ.text: Over-the-top portions. The Woody Allen is a little much, but good to split between two. I prefer the breakfast. There's enough to hold you over until dinner.  Not cheap, but hey, it's Vegas. There isn't much seating. Get there early to avoid the painfully long wait.

Qor3iRk0mT1U0ZbSvuz-Nw.text: Almost $30 fucking dollars for a Reuben?!? I understand that you're Carnegie Deli and to make matters worse you're a transplant location in a shitty Vegas hotel, but let's be reasonable here. I wouldn't pay that price in New York and I certainly wouldn't pay it here. I don't care how delicious you are, you are a SANDWICH!!  And $10-$12 for vodka sodas and jack and cokes?!? I remember the good 'ole days of living in the Northeast when one could go to one of these delis and have a fantastic lunch or even dinner at a fair and reasonable price. If Carnegie Deli has its way, those days are long gone.

Q4kjh02Gj4-Fm1hpPdcArg.text: Hello , sad to report such poor customer service ...our retail team at a neighboring hotel wanted to order a special lunch from Carnegie deil. We tried to place an order and have it picked up. Only to be told they would not place an order for us.  We were first told that they do not take credit cards over the phone, which is understandable However, after making arrangements to have the order picked up we were rudely told that they do not do "pre-orders".  Its funny... I can actually call New York and have it flown in, but I can not get an order placed two hotels down.

p5ZsRbuTfmkDpKQFLBVmOA.text: Wholly mounds of meat, Batman!  Carnegie Deli is a casual deli located in the Mirage on the Las Vegas strip.  The friend who recommended Carnegie warned us that the portions are huge and she was NOT joking.  The sandwiches are mountains of meat that can easily feed a small country.  We had the Brisketball, which is topped with turkey and brisket and the Woody Allen which is topped with pastrami and corned beef.  Each was absolutely delicious.  Plus, Carnegie has a wonderful spicy mustard that complements their sandwiches well.  If you're eating at Carnegie be sure to come hungry and bring some friends because these sandwiches are not for the faint of heart.  My only regret is that was too full to try one of their cheesecakes.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Woody Allen sans bread.
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brisketball

6LWbTTI6_Hv5GMGXqxMTJA.text: I'm not into pastrami and apparently that is what Carnegie Deli is known for. They pack their sandwiches like a mile a thick full of meat so of course they're going to charge you if you decide not to get anything else and share it. Fries aren't included!  I ate at Carnegie probably a total of three times on my last visit to Vegas. Their home fries are THE ISH and I'm not even exaggerating. I was seriously considering getting them for dinner but I thought it would be too weird. For breakfast, I've had the mushrooms & onions omelette and the fried onions omelette. You get your choice of bread (or bagel), and home fries or french fries. GET THE HOME FRIES. I don't know what kind of magical excellent crack they sprinkle on those things but they are the most excellent home fries. Their omelettes were huge. I was able to divide them into two meals both times.  The onions were sliced thick and you could tell they were fresh.   Their combination matzoh balls and noodles soup was a pleasant experience. This was the first time I've actually tried a matzoh ball. It's on the plainer side but it reminded me of a mixture of tofu and ground beef all mashed together to make this healthy tasting meatball. They serve it to you in a plate and the soup is served separate. Once they serve it to you is when you should pour in the chicken broth and mix it all together. Very cool! I appreciate them taking into consideration the potential mushyness the noodles can get if the noodles and soup were served together. They portioned this just right. I was satisfied in the end.  Although I frequented Carnegie on my last stay, I don't think I'd ever go out of my way to come eat here. It's just A-OK in my book.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. After: Combo matzoh balls and noodle soup.
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Before: Combo matzoh balls and noodle soup.
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Free pickles.

gDU1RZsB16Is2nbgAe-Vkw.text: Pretty darn good pastrami sandwiches, hard not to eat here once when in LV, they have kaiser rolls for sandwiches, but i think they are not on the menu.

V3G7PD10vF8D2dlHdyvRWg.text: MASSIVE sandwich. good enough for two ppl or 3 ppl if you are really light eaters.   Got the $18 Woody Allen's sandwich - loaded w/ tons of pastrami and corned beef.   Though it was huge, the taste was just okay. Both the pastrami and corned beef were thinly sliced and was a bit on the dry end. The pastrami tasted like hot dog. Service was fast but that's because we requested for it since we had a show to catch in 30min.  i, personally, still prefer Langer's juicy thick cut pastrami at Los Angeles, CA.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. half of the sandwich takes up the whole plate
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Woody Allen

Wq-7NyvH5l7mpj5jq5OoLg.text: decent deli. a bit overpriced for casual deli...but you get the portion you pay for.  Sandwiches were HUGE and even the omelettes are bigger than usual.  Good place to eat if you are staying in Mirage, however I don't recommend coming here if you are not in a nearby hotel.

E-c4jCP1OyXMrk0j5Pm9JQ.text: We are striking out today as far as service goes in Vegas. But this place is seriously awful. Super overpriced sandwiches. We got just a piece of egg and bacon on sourdough and that's it plain and the bacon it's all in the eggs so if you want take it off can't even try. I don't get it you walk up an order and someone comes and brings your food. I'm not a meat eater so I guess that's why don't like his place but there are so many better places here in Vegas

pxgtDHAzvTIJAfXxj2l3Gg.text: Got a turkey sandwich and it was very dry and small ... I started Laughing when it came out because in the picture it shows a big sandwich

WLiXJ5zk8Xv8RDURklsimg.text: I should have read review first.  Bring a loaf a bread and share.  I didn't even get through half the Woody Allen sandwich.

7-CtEI0TM76kzd6Y1BBtig.text: If Joey Tribbianni were a real person, I imagine he would be a regular here!   The space is a little crowded but has a lively atmosphere right inside the Mirage. Upon sitting down, you receive a plentiful bowl of pickles that provides some great snacking. After seeing the massive plates around us, my dad and I decided to split the Reuben. They do charge you a couple extra bucks to split a meal, but when you're not taking any leftovers home anyway its definitely worth the savings. We substituted the corned beef for pastrami, and the open-faced sandwich took up the entire plate. It was absolutely delicious. The potato salad wasn't bad, but nothing homemade.  The prices look a little steep at first glance, but once you realize you can eat for days off of one meal it makes sense!

-NFmcETzMFOD9VAMXWGJGw.text: The Roasted Chicken is super dry so make sure to grab a lot of gravy. All in all not very impressive. We settled for this place because my fiance was sick in the room.  Unless you really wanna try their pastrami, I would skip this spot.

YseeAQKkHV_FpepIUGhibg.text: Met family to eat there on New Years Eve.  The wait was long to order and the food was mediocre.  The portions were gigantic to make up for the steep prices.  The quality of the food was average and the service was less than optimal.   We weren't able to sit near each other but after a little while, a table became available so we scooted over to be with the other couples.  At that point, the manager came over and told us we were going to be charged a mandatory 18% gratuity.  All we did was switch places to a table that someone else had!  When we told her the situation, she said it was mandatory and she would adjust all our bills. When we didn't hear back from her for approval (we paid via credit card), we left a cash tip.  As we were leaving, I decided to check our bank account (I didn't really trust the manager) and found they had, indeed, charged us extra without our approval. When we brought it to her attention, she was belligerent, quite rude, and spoke to us like we were stupid ("let me see if I can figure out how to say this nicely in words you will understand"  -Both my husband and I are business professionals and gave her no reason to question us otherwise.).  She then said she would 'fix' it since we left a cash tip and guess what?  She did.......not.  We now have to contact our bank since they charged us twice at the original cost and another additional charge that included the unauthorized added gratuity - a total of approximately $120 for two sandwiches.   I will never recommend nor go there again!

LpWuFzsbhlscARm2uRkomQ.text: Not real happy with the changes in the new deli. But I'll rate on the food, food is good can't complain. We always get a few favorites and share them. Matzo ball soup is good, broth could be richer. Knish is always good. Bagel & lox are piled high with lox. Service is fast and food was at our table in a timely manner. Almost forgot, have to get an egg cream when here. We actually found another deli off the strip that we enjoy much more.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JI8b0dQGkQ4esRCCz38AJA.text: Very good breakfast and lots of food for the price! Actually, it was too much food. Because honestly, breakfast isn't one of the meals I want to get a take-out dish for. It hurt me to leave the unfinished eggs, homefries, and toast at my table.  The price is more than I wanted to pay for breakfast but I sucked it up since I was in Vegas.  *sigh*

d8YInZEExEY0oB5sWS9xqA.text: Came here for a quick bite after just getting into town. Guess this was the wrong place to do that, but my husband was craving corned beef, so it is what it is. The service was awful. Super unfriendly, the guy never once cracked a smile.  This restaurant accomplished one of my top 3 pet peeves. If you are a restaurant known for your gigantic portions, yet you charge a fee to split, you are BAD PEOPLE! Earned an extra star for the corned beef. It was, as advertised, huge and pretty tasty. But definitely not the best I've had and not worth the money or the bad service.

qcz7bpokZ4miMo1nuZM8FA.text: The sando here is ridic! Crazy amounts of meat and impossible to eat as a real sandwich. I stick with the pastrami and corned beef they are so tasty you dont worry about anything else. But it includes pickles in a bag that were horrible. They should outsource them it was so bad. I was really in need of another flavor and the pickle let me down lol. If ur in a spot this place is a good choice to get a sando.

_vQ1hWJGcD_I6Lhf3ssL_Q.text: Huge portions, but for $3 you can share a meal. I highly recommend doing this. Breakfast was good, but I'm not a fan of eggs and most of their breakfast items included eggs. Be prepared to stand in line as this is a popular spot! Coffee was good and strong. The corned beef hash was the best I've had. The bacon could've been crisper.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I ate half of my corned beef, what you see is what I could not finish. I recommend sharing!

bn3vL1ML7_X_WX0SWbSBmA.text: We ordered on the take-out side and the service was prompt. Pastrami on Rye was massive, easily splittable.  While the meat had an amazing flavor, it was a bit dry that evening.  Be forewarned, you're about to drop $20 on this sandwich but like I mentioned before, the portions are monstrous. The only thing I disliked were the pickles that came with the order. Don't get me wrong, I enjoy pickles & relishes of all shapes, sizes and tastes, but whatever brine these puppies were basking in was pretty foul.  Passed them around for the friends to try and the opinion was the same: No thanks. Tried a bite of some matzo ball soup, quite good. Big fat ball swimming in tasty broth. The turkey and cheese sandwich was also not too bad.  A decent place to grind when you're in The Mirage.

Jh_i__sPL4sbgnCJvGB9UA.text: Slow! Slow! Slow! And i wouldnt trust their paging system---was to be paged in 20-25min expected wait time... and after 3 other couples that were in line behind me were seated i spoke up... was given some another 20min wait BS!! After I balked i was seated within 5minz... Service to be waited on was still slow... But when out meal arrived it was fresh., well prepared , flavorful and HUGE! Probably would only go back here for togo ordes...

qxk9ELHv6AB5l5ZbPH7dew.text: We got the strawberry cheesecake here...I have had it before, and as good as it was this time, it wasn't nearly as good as times in the past. I feel like if a piece of cake costs 13$ it should be pretty incredible...maybe I built it up too much in my head...  I miss the Carnegie in NYC

1Z1ex_OeCyc6j-Tyr_mQBQ.text: Smh city out here.   They literally cheapened the whole menu at carnegie... this is not the pastrami sandwich I remember.  Its dry now.

su9cyhNS89pOJV-qyvr0NQ.text: Deeeeeelicioous! Not sure what all the negative reviews are about. You're there to eat food, not to chat with your waitress.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Don&#39;t forget to have your daily helping of beef liver!!

pfP5aoj7VEuw7sFGCa1FNQ.text: alright, perry's in chicago on franklin makes a bigger sammy, but if you are buffet'd out (is that even a word?), stop on into Carnegie and split a sandwich the first time you eat there.   The portions are perfect for the glutton in all of us but unless you plan on going right to bed don't try it.   3 stars only because I gave four stars to a place the other day and it was filtered.   If you are reading my review, consider it more a 4/ 4.5er than the 3. thanks

geReO_lU6RfhBxHn-Mpv3A.text: Located in Mirage casino  This is a place where I could say you pay for what you get.  A sandwich that costs around 20.  Although they do have other items on the menu that cost less, but since your here might as well get what they are known for.    They are known for their mountain high sandwiches.  I mean what i said "mountain high sandwiches".  You get tons and tons of meat it's crazy.   It's really hard to finish so I suggest sharing one.   I ordered the Woody Allen which is piled high with pastrami and corn beef. I would say it's good but after awhile it is a little too much. They have a variety of other sandwiches but you can order in moderation and not get the really big sandwiches.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Woody Allen

fiJpb3ytVnd4kX-MHT8c4w.text: Very nice service provided here today. My mom and I shared the noodle soup, which always hits the spot (hint: try it with rice as well). We also had the chicken salad sandwich and baked beans side. The restaurant has been around for 10 years and still does great business.

2HFifvviYglhH4k5eXWRDw.text: Talk about an overpriced breakfast. $40 for 2 seriously bland servings of eggs and coffee. About the only thing going for this place is convenience if you're already staying at the mirage and can't be bothered crossing the road to Denny's for the same experience at half the price

R1LaNKOk4ZeqXNQ4U_CDsA.text: I work right up the street from the original one New York City. Sunday night is my hot pastrami night enjoyed the sandwich here just the same.. Same price too

-BJWe20gv8LCntu0U0ZSHA.text: Expensive for a sandwich, but then again the sandwich could feed 4 people. Late night option at the Mirage that is ok when you are hungry...

cw0RV_Lp4OIQaoHEpfj0fw.text: I learned one thing about myself at this restaurant -- I do not care for Pastrami at the least.  HUGE stacked sandwich that only contains pastrami...I am not stoked to eat this. I ordered a side of fries which turned out to be a very big helping--the fries were perfect. I was more in love with my side of french fries than the sandwich :(

txRnd5kGG1JcuOJq31uG6A.text: If you're not up for something fancy, and would just be happy with something simple -- this is your place. Love the ambiance of an old time deli and New York attitude.   I personally recommend the corn beef. Piled high topped with cheese. YUM!

IEmaCzIligP-aY77mSqftg.text: Returned after 4 years.  Place has gone downhill since.  They've drastically cut the size of their sandwiches.  Guess that's everywhere.  The pictures here are of sandwiches 4-8 years ago. Now they're ordinary sized sandwiches.   Big big disappointment.

XQ5ggsw9-xHPd4j5Dfvr-A.text: Not what I was expecting.    When I get drunk I can eat....and I mean eat.  Now when you mix my high metabolism with a day of vegas walking and drinking I could probably start my own Man Vs. Food show....the drunk version.  I stumbled into this place on my poor wife's shoulder the night we got there.  I say poor wife because I have a good 90 pounds on her.  The whole experience was fuzzy....but my wife did mention I was speaking Spanish with the guy taking orders...When I start ordering food in Spanish and talking conversations, I know i'm hammered.  Apart from the long wait, we ordered the woody. A very large, bland, dry sandwich consisting of roast beer and pastrami.  Between the both of us we ate HALF.  Not because it was so big or anything, but because we couldn't bare to eat the other half.  In fact! Housekeeping didn't even pick it up for 2 days.  Apparently they knew something about that sandwich we didn't.   Seriously over priced sandwich that's weak sauce...

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Woody...looks a lot better than it was :(
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. menu

ozYeNFrpWQjpq5P62nQ8bg.text: This used to be my go to deli for a great sandwich.  Whoever changed it into a fast food establishment should be fired.  There is no interaction with the waitress, and if you want dessert after your meal you need to go back and stand in line.  The portions that made this place great are gone along with the flavor.   I had to send my French fries back because the ones they brought were cold and greasy.  I am sad to say that I probably will never return.  Rip the old Carnegie deli.  Shame on whoever changed it

w0i_HQKFWzhozs4WiIW9eQ.text: This place is completely over-priced ($25 for a Reuben sandwich!!) and it was not even worth it. The quality of the food was not that great.

M9nwuJPPi3RWdupfU698rg.text: Not sure if I fully understand what the allure of this place is.  My rueben was actually quite good, and I definitely ate wayyy too much of it.  Decent corned beefed piled high, loaded with melted swiss and flavorful sourkraut, all atop an afterthought of rye bread.    However, everyone elses dish had me shaking my head.  The others in my party had the Woody Allen, the cheeseburger, and a turkey club.  The Woody Allen was little more than what appeared to be two pounds of meat with a couple slices of bread tacked on the ends.  That would be ok if the meat was some of the greatest stuff on earth, but it was far from it.  Dry, dry, dry.  THe corned beef, which was acceptable on the rueben, without the addition of heat is not nearly as good.  When your sandwich consists of a grotesque amount of meat and nothing else, at least make sure the meat is good.  The turkey club was piled high with DRY turkey, what appeared to be 80 slices of bacon, lettuce, and tomato.  That was it.  Same as the Woody, if you're sandwich is just going to be a showcase for a pound of deli meat, at least make sure the meat is worth showcasing.  The burger was plain and unforgettable, if at least a normal portion at a 1/4 pound patty.  For four "sandwiches", two drinks, and one order of cheesecake our bill was $120 without tip.  Can't say I'd ever really feel the need to go back.

vcWTdAmvMYxK6VthGxMUxA.text: First time back since the change. Although they don't have the as many sandwiches as before, the Woody Allen I ordered was still huge. May not have been as large as before, but still too much too eat in one sitting. At least you can split it now if you like without the surcharge. Luckily I had a condo, so I was able to take home the leftovers. I also ordered a side of coleslaw & it was perfect. Nice balance & not too creamy. Wasn't a fan of the pickles though. Two different styles. Didn't enjoy either one. Cashier was super friendly as well.

X_MLSuHywpZHHdNDxBjnfw.text: Tucked inside of the Mirage Hotel is one of the best New York delis ever!! I have always wanted to try Carnegie but yet to make it out to the east coast! Minh and I needed some food in our bellies for a night of drinking. The take-out line was kind of long as we waited to place our order. After looking over the menu and waiting our turn, it was time to order. Now this is not just your typical deli where your sandwiches are on the smaller side. This deli packs on the meat, which means these babies are freaking huge, more than enough to share!   We ordered the: Turkey Sandwich- Turkey, tomato piled high .You put the condiments on when you get the sandwich.  Found a comfortable spot outside of the restaurant (well actually it was the outer lobby and it was on the ground but heck I was sneaking in a couple of sip of my drink that I had)!!  Our friends joined us a moment later with their food as well.  People watching is a must here (it was NYE so the place was hopping).   After putting a little bit of mayo on my bread, I realized that my mouth could not possibly go around this huge sandwich. Darn, I had to disassemble it and eat it. The turkey was tender and not dry the mayo made it that much better.   I was half way finished when I just couldn't possibly fit anymore into my small tummy. Handing it on over to the boyfriend was the best idea ever! As he was more than happy to finish the last couple of bites of my sammich.  The prices are a little high here but just think about it, you get a lot of food for your money plus you can always use your "M" life card and get points!!!!

GEps74ybnVLcm_Xtnvp4Xw.text: Ok, so they nickel and dime you for everything. Want a tomato or grilled onions? That'll be an extra $1 for each. Adding turkey to a $13 BLT causes it to become a $25 club sandwich.   However, my grilled cheese with tomato and grilled onion was very good with plenty of tomato and onion. So, I don't really mind the extra charges. Also, the portion of fries was huge! Only one order for 6 hungry, drunk girls who know how to eat!    What more can you want from an open all night restaurant in the mirage? I'd go back for another grilled cheese!

LAOwtsg_-oxhFkFvsPCqPA.text: Came here with a bunch of buddies and couldn't believe the prices, even for a deli. That being said, we saw somebody at a table next to us who ordered a sandwich and we realized that you can still over eat by splitting a sandwich. My buddy and I split the woody Allen (pastrami and corned beef) and it was good. Pastrami and corned beef had good flavor and texture. We got a side of slaw and that was nice and crunchy too.   the sandwiches are more of a novelty item than a typical lunch sandwich so I don't know if I will be coming back but I enjoyed it.

hcAgtExvhwUQLXiEJC-_pg.text: Came here looking for some late night grub. We stayed at the Mirage and this restaurant was located conveniently downstairs.   I would definitely recommend getting breakfast instead of a sandwich here. Everything is just WAY WAY WAY overpriced and not worth it! At least with breakfast you can get more bang for your buck!  Breakfast is served all day I believe but the breakfast menu is only available at the register when ordering. So if I were you, totally disregard the hanging menu and save yourself and your wallet the agony.   One thing was the service! I dont know how much you would tip for TO GO, but apparently $2 isnt generous enough? I'm sorry I didnt know you had service all the way up in our suites?! When ringing me up for my food, the rude dude at the register made a comment along the lines of "$2 only?!" as if in disbelief! I asked around my friends what they tipped and some tipped $1 and some none at all?! Excuse me?! I'm sorry but it most places TO GO doesnt require tips because the only service Im getting is you passing the food to me!  How about I just give you a pat on the back for doing your job?

qeK8E7qUYe-pql02UU6S6g.text: The NY tradition of great Deli stays alive in Vegas!! Huge sandwiches made from quality ingredients. The corned beef & pastrami are perfect. Get the combo, but share it with someone! Too much for 1 person. I also suggest the potato pancake....crispy on the outside, soft in the inside with just enough grease to help you over last night! Not the cheapest place but again if you share the sandwich, it keeps the cost in line!!

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Time to soak up the alcohol!!
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corned beef &amp; pastrami combo
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Egg salad on white toast

fEpT1o-PFnhBjLL1I0alfA.text: Expensive, and not quite sure it's worth it, but just judging the food itself, it's pretty good. A little disappointed that the waitress only filled our drinks once throughout the entire lunch we were there, but the sandwiches were pretty good. I ordered the Woody Allen, which was a humongous 1.5 pound sandwich of pastrami and corned beef. Under normal circumstances, I would not try to eat the entire thing in one sitting. However, a man in a cowboy hat sitting in the table next to me looked over and commented, "There's no way you can finish that." And of course my stupid pride kicked in and I tortured myself to prove him wrong. I felt extremely sick and on the verge of exploding taking pained bites out.   The corned beef was dry and somewhat flavorless, but the pastrami was moist, full of flavor, and fatty. I wished I had ordered a full pastrami sandwich instead because the pastrami was so good. I had to drown the corned beef in ketchup and mustard to add some moistness to the meat.   $25 for a sandwich is a hard sell, and I probably will not do it again, but I will be happy to have their pastrami again next time.

ych6oFflIKwsxYdyAH0cDg.text: 2 plates of corn beef hash, added egg to each plus two ice teas.  $52 + tip.  Ouch.    Not a $52 meal even in Vegas.   Just average to below average tasting.   We had good service.  Our ice tea glasses were never empty.   4 more days in Vegas and not planning on eating here again.

jmkx3NTE7Anfv76EbcGGrQ.text: Ok...I love a great sandwich. Ive had my eye on this place for awhile. Today I indulged my craving and was not disappointed at all. There was a line of course, def worth the wait. You order at the counter,  your given a number,  then you find a place to sit down. The portions are ridiculous. 2/3 lbs of meat with your bread. Got the Hot Pastrami,  The Brisket, and the Potato knish. I was too stuffed for dessert, but I'll be back to conquer that. Def recommend

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu- and breakfast is all day
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Potato knish- OMG this was fabulous
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brisket on white with au jus and a pickle

R0PwqZ40MXiKYiIzhYDAuQ.text: Not the greatest service.   Was not a huge fan of the food especially not for the price. Vegas prices are on the rise so it is expected.  To eat:  French toast was not cooked completely and was raw on the inside. Coming from a European background I wanted to give their potato pancake a try don't do it! The pancake was very hard, and lacked overall flavor, it can be served with applesauce or sour cream I chose both but not worth the price.  Dirty dog: too much to even bite, the dog itself was great but the bread was dry.  The sandwiches here are what saved the day, you can truly feed two hungry people with these, they're really large but nothing special.  If I were you I would save your money and walk right across to California Pizza Kitchen for better food and service.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French Toast
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Cesar Salad
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Turkey Sandwich

Mt1N8XOgT62C_YKY11lbFg.text: We have been to this establishment in New York, and also in PA at the Sands casino, this restaurant is completely different then there other establishments,  1st here you wait on line, then you get to a cash register, where you place your order for food and drinks, and pay up front, they give you a number, then you have to fight for a table. ( good luck finding one at all, and if you do, they all dirty)  My husband and I decided to share to woody Allen sandwich before going to a show with a side of fries.  Yes, the sandwich is perfect to share, was pretty dry, not juicy like we have had in the past.  And they only give you one pickle per person, while at the other locations , you get a plate of all different flavors to taste.  We also ordered two waters with lemon, no lemons came with with waters.   So over all I would like to give 2.5 stars. For there service and price.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. There menu
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Woody Allen- 1 1/2 lbs of pastrami with corn beef on rye bread. With the one pickle you receive with your order.

QGfnMxjYR5jbRVS29hReYA.text: Not sure why the poor reviews. We stopped by this week and had a good meal for a reasonable price for the Vegas strip.  I had the Frankfurter which was huge. Easily two regular hot dogs. My wife had the corned beef sandwich which was loaded with meat. The meat was a little dry which I find is pretty typical for corned beef.  I also had the matzo ball soup which for $5.99 was very generous with two large matzo balls. It would have been enough all by itself as a light meal.  We saw a couple of the pastrami reubens go by which looked enormous. I don't see how anyone could finish one given the amount of meat and cheese included.  Service isn't great, but didn't mind ordering at the counter.  Four stars overall.

V_oa1CQevK4QHFHU6lIFNA.text: Never made it to the original one while living in NYC and decided to come for breakfast our last day in Vegas. $18.99 for corned beef hash is a bit steep but it's Vegas lol. It was delicious. Huge portions I only ate half of it. My friend had the pastrami sandwich, pastrami was yummy. My other friend had the Matzo ball soup it looked good but I didn't try it. They had black and white cookies and some amazing looking cakes but I couldn't haha

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pastrami sandwich
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Matzo ball soup

-DqIYhNdY7HoK7hMisUcGw.text: Was very excited to try the pastrami sandwich. Easily one of the worst sandwiches of my lifetime. Warm in some spots cold in others very dry no taste or flavor. I was starving hungry which made me madder then i should have been. On the plus the wait wasnt bad and the people working had great energy and very friendly. Still hard to beleive Carnegie Deli could screw up pastrami.

fNd4FRhfRHAQPEya3YAIBQ.text: Horrible service and food is ehhhh. Wait in line somewhere else. It will be worth it. You have to tip before your seated too. Weird....

DIMGhzLAG5BgnbnFbRmWjg.text: Carnegie Deli serves up some massive sandwiches at some rather high prices.  This 24 hour operation in the Mirage is ready to fill you up for breakfast straight through to late night.  Large portions are the name of the game here and the deli meat is brought in right from NYC.  The restaurant is located right on the casino floor so there is good people watching.  You order at the front counter and can dine in or take your food back to your room.  There is a large seating area with waiter service if you decide to stick around.  I have had the corned beef and the turkey club here and been very impressed both times.  The sandwiches run north of $20 each, but can feed 2 people.  The corned beef is pretty lean and has a great spice to it.  The turkey club was good, but dry with almost a pound of bacon on it!  The bread is sturdy and helps you get all that delicious meat into your mouth.  They are big and messy - a perfect end to your night in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Turkey club

Mg76pD3419eOeBNvW6BMog.text: ok we've been coming here for years and well its not keeping up with their reputation of a big pastrami sandwich. Please don't do this, we don't mind paying the $17 for this but it's not even half the size.  So disappointed

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pastrami Sandwich

OglbTzbPmT2gz871yaXPTg.text: Wish the food tasted like the pics or New York.  Pastrami a little dry...no flavor..same for the potato salad.  Happy we didn't order dessert.  Family at a nearby table took one bite of NY Cheesecake and left it. Service was average...I guess what you would expect of a Deli.  With so many amazing food choices in Vegas...it was disheartening to lose out and select a place that was sub par

u5Hguh65URoFA9tgWcQDnQ.text: Excellent selection of menu items.  Loved it enough to go twice in weekend.  Breakfast is yummy but lunch is their specialty.  Staff are so friendly and welcoming.  Both servers 5 stars!  Try the black/white cookie

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Woody allen

nnU07heYl5Ma3nAIpTIMGQ.text: These days you can find good eateries on the strip. Carnegie deli is one of them. If you're in the mood for good pastrami sandwich and some giant, creamy cheesecake, this place for you.   Their portion is huge so don't over order but share. You could probably share the cheesecake with two or more people. The pastrami sandwich was the best ever. It's served over light rye bread. The pastrami meat is bright pink, soft, and thinly sliced. It's not juicy, not chewy and not overly peppery but it's perfect to my taste.   This is not full service restaurant. You order your food at the counter and you get a number and they'll bring it out. The servers here are very personable and friendly. They do recommend you don't order too much and waste food. But make sure you leave some tips for them. They do work hard.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

AEpGcM2hEPbQNng-_pLNyA.text: I regret eating here.   With so many great choices in Vegas, I recommend you keep walking by this place.   No gripe with the service or staff.   It's just that the food is awful.   As a frequent visitor to the original Carnegie Deli in NYC, I was hoping to capture just an inkling of the magic that is that fabulous NY Jewish deli.   Instead, what I got was something that looked the part but had all the flavor of what you would find in the fridge at your local 7-11.   They did charge Carnegie Deli prices so you will be at least $20 lighter for a sandwich.

rwT-sIhe7yJrUX1q_UN9Yw.text: This is a sad post.   The food was yummy. The service is really horrible. Everyone seems to hate their jobs and they treat their guests like we are a burden. I didn't think we would get a real NY experience with the meal. I can now say I've tried their food. Nothing to jump up and down about.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ruben and eggs and sausage.

Jc3yRmy8DYkZWjfmzOpJgA.text: We just left Carnegie and would like to mention what an awesome job The waitress Jessica does. She wasn't our waitress this visit, however she still amazed us. She just zips around that place taking care of everything.  She obviously loves her work.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. And that&#39;s the way it&#39;s done
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The in side it big ..,

PAqJ6G72CGrzyVZ5oYnDWQ.text: Couldn't wait to get here to eat lunch from the airport.  Can't find really good NY pastrami where I live - so really wanted a great sandwich.  It is soooo good - can't miss with the pastrami.  Any of the bad ratings I see is for breakfast - duh - don't go to the best pastrami place for bacon and eggs!

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 1/2 a pastrami

ZF8jgePZukJ4DehHoU62Mg.text: For starters ..   Soda was $4.25  each . I was even charged for soda water.  In reality ( you are paying for syrup  , not bubbles or water). The lady who took our  order was semi rude.   We were going to order Cherry Cheese cake UNTILL we saw the server pull thr plate out amd touch EVERY piece with her fingers in the process ( NO gloves ).  The food was ok , nothing to write  home about .   The lady who cleaning the tables(Marilyn) sorry I spelt that wrong  was totally nice and polite.  And the only reason I am not posting a meaner post.
