The waitress finally came back and she told me my whole meal was comped, which was nice, considering there was no way I wanted to pay $9 for a grilled cheese that wasn't even good.  I saw some of the other sandwiches here, the famous huge ones, and I can't imagine how one would actually eat or want to eat such a thing. You'd have to dissect it and it really isn't a sandwich at that point. Just my opinion.  I avoided the place the rest of my stay. Just not my cup of tea and pricy for the quality.

Q3HVHVpOo0N5IC56a75Nvw.text: After playing poker at the Mirage for 4 hours (and winning a little money) I headed over to the Carnegie Deli to get some food. The hostess sat me and I waited, and waited, and waited and then waited some more.  Literally 15 minutes went by (I checked my watch when I sat down) and not only did nobody ever come to take my order but nobody even came by to say they would be right with me. Absolutely pathetic.   I saw 2 different servers working the floor that night. Not only were they both moving with the speed and enthusiasm or your typical DMV employee, but they never even bothered to look in my direction.  After the aforementioned 15 minutes I got up and went to another restaurant in the Mirage.  From looking at the menu, which I obviously had plenty of time to do, I can tell you that aside from the horrible service, this place is highly overpriced.  I will not be giving them a second chance.

JpVT6QvHGVShexz0jcBm7g.text: Was here a couple of years ago and it was great.   Went back last week while in LV.   Sorry I did that.   The sandwiches were dry and tasteless.   The sides were bland.   No comparison to a real NYC deli now.  My recommendation is skip it!!

P5o3NiwT7kInVAvNflVgsw.text: The menu was just like the one in the NYC. The sandwiches are all made fresh and are BIG. There is a share charge, but most people would not be able to eat a whole one by themselves. We got the corn beef on rye which was outstanding. They also have the brown mustard that was made for these sandwiches. We also a slice of the cheese cake, which is also made fresh and is just huge. The service was very good. Totally enjoyed this place from start to finish.

1S0lFjufQY6GycEtNleZjA.text: My buddies and I came here for one of my best friend's bachelor party lunch, and in his esteemed honor (he avoids veggies), we came out like True carnivores.  Being from the Silicon Valley, I don't really get to eat from Jewish Delis often, so went for the super combo.  Alan W.  Woody Allen   Yup.  Beasted this amalgamation of Hot Pastrami and Corned Beef in one sitting; this sandwich was "My Everest" as the wise sage Joey Tribbiani once put it.  Pretty tasty, slightly dry towards the end, but it was good enough for me to keep picking at it until I was confronted with the real thought of actually killing the whole thing.  A copious amount of their house deli mustard didn't hurt either.  I ended up just picking up the meat with my hands all primal caveman style, which I have to admit, made it more fun to eat.  Felt like bursting after and probably have an educated guess as to what carrying a 6 month old baby is like now.  I still have to put Katz's Hot Pastrami over this one though, but I liked what I had.  All of it.

pwQk0EBxu2KBUv34-x4tGA.text: So Disappointed =T sigh Ordered the Hot Pastrami sandwich came out a tiny bit warm. The meat was a lot stack up but it was a lot of left over pieces. All tiny bites put together. There was no one big piece. sigh. The meat was very dry and overly salted. I was so upset. Paying for a $16.99 sandwich and it was nothing like what it should have been. Also if your sharing it's an extra $3.00 bucks when dining in.  Get it to go and sit in the sports area for free when sharing lolz  Miss NYC Hot Pastrami from KATZ, still the best for me.

izDtZUkrb9wAg2enJnCjyw.text: Came here over the weekend. The food was OK but IMO $15-$20 is a little pricey for a deli sandwich, but they certainly do give you a very, very large portion. We also had an order of sausages that were way too oily (And I ain't afraid of grease in my food). The thing that left me with a bad taste in my mouth was the service which was possibly the worst experience I've ever had in my many trips to Las Vegas. First it took the waitress forever to get our drinks and to take our order, then when the sandwich came out it almost slipped off our plate and the waitress palmed it with her (probably dirty) bare hand to stop it. We should have asked for another sandwich because that's gross -- even the workers in Ghetto Banh Mi shops in Westminster use gloves to touch the sandwiches-- but we were hungry so we didn't want to wait. I had to ask for refills several times as they never really came by to check up on us and it took them forever to bring us our check. Yeah I understand that they were busy and probably one of their servers called out or something but it shouldn't take 15 minutes for them to bring us our check. We weren't the only ones waiting for our check, there was at least two other tables I saw in our immediate area waiting to pay. The worst part was there were three hosts standing right next to us just chitchatting, I know that it probably isn't part of their jobs to clean tables and print out checks, but they should be helping the servers rather than just doing nothing... it just gives a very bad perception to customers. While the food was okay I will not be coming back because of their lousy service. No I did not tip and BTW they also have a $3 sharing fee. REALLY????

Q7TxeSvA6XywWof6qveXxA.text: i love corned beef and pastrami sandwiches. i had my share of them at a lot of different places and thought i had some great ones. but this place has the best by a long long shot. we ate there twice during our recent visit to vegas. the first time we shared the woody allen, which is corned beef and pastrami. its a big sandwich and is more then enough for two. the second time she ordered a hamburger, which she said was one of the best ever. i got the corned beef with fries and the red peppers. i was happy with all of it. the peppers are great, its spicy, yet it has taste. its expensive but thats fine when its the best. when we go back to vegas this is a must visit again.

1fJKIOhintigWH0nqdxHZw.text: Outstanding deli food. Two of us shared a sandwich (corned beef, Turkey, Cole slaw and Russian dressing on pumpernickel) and neither of us could finish half. There is a $3.00 charge for sharing. The BLT must come with a pound of Bacon and the side of fries was enough for 4 people. Come hungry!

7wL03Z67-MfaFgjK3ZSCeA.text: This place is crazy!!!  The sandwiches are freaking MONSTERS!  You can probably split one between four people!  We went here twice.  My freinds got the liver and roast beef.  Came with a mountain of roast beef and a baseball size scoop of liver.  Holy moly!  We had the ruben, open face, piled high with meat and topped with a layer of melted cheese.  Oh so good!!!!

0pCEbAIA0dI31UbMBbgPLw.text: Well this review is not exactly for me, but for my husband. I had the roast beef sandwich, which was good, but a roast beef anywhere is good. He loved the pastrami sandwich. Huge was not the word. 1 pound of meat. Not only was it big, it was good also. Definitely big enough to share next time. There definitely will be a next time. Cheesecake was awesome also!

_VGdTZ1Q8BP0SwNpgUELlw.text: Total Shit Hole.  I dined here alone on my way to the airport.  I received the worst service ever!  Im not too sure what this bitches problem was.  i was seated by the hostess.  I sat there for at least 15 minutes before I went back up to her to let it be known I hadnt received service yet.  She was very apologetic.  So, here comes the Wicked Bitch of the West.  Comes over to my table and just stands there with her pen poised  (but doesnt say a word) - I order.  I tell her in addition to my scrambled eggs and toast I would also like an iced tea.  Her response "I dont get the drinks"  ok this is just WrOnG!  She sends some dude over to take my drink order - like she couldnt have just said hey get her an iced tea.  So, here comes the food.  She brings my food out at the same time as the table next to me.  She starts handing out the food to both tables at the same time.  this bothered me.  she passes my eggs to me in front of the mans face next to me. gross. Then she argues with me that I ordered Wheat Toast when I in fact ordered White.  Ya know what I'm not even gonna tell you the rest. This place sucks and thats that! Goose Egg Bitch!!!!!

3HzXLBU7sfvmkPVnF3K63w.text: I am a native New-Yorker so this is one of the few places in Las Vegas  you can get a genuine NYC Pastrami or Corned-beef sandwich with real kosher pickles.

GZQ0LZYsA1JzIVEi3DcitA.text: Ok seriously people, the sandwiches here are HUGE. I ended up ordering a burger and not only was it decent sized, it seriously was the best tasting burger I've had in my life up to this point. Everything from it being cooked the way I asked for to the freshness and flavor was great, our waiter was cool too.

XFo9rfZ8OLOKgJ3DWQKkwA.text: I stopped here after Yelp Night at Jet. Had to quell the hunger pangs that the lemon slices and cherries in my cocktails didn't satisfy.  However, I was totally unprepared for such huge portions of the most mediocre food ever. Expensive, too. I got the chicken noodle soup. There was no chicken in it. It was just the thing I needed after a long night of partying and "Goose"-ing it up on the dancefloor at Yelp Night at JET. But it was just a huge bowl of noodles and scalding chicken boullion to pour on top. Wow. I can't say I wasn't pleased, because I was. I guess I'm just thinking about America and obesity, the effects of increased portion sizes on how much we eat, food waste, and the economics of all of this. From the other dishes I witnessed servers bringing to other patrons, Carnegie Deli is totally pro-obesity, totally pro-food-waste, pro-huge-portion-size, pro-gratuitous-spending. Ridiculous.

lZMof3lNcGfJR-Xfz022Cg.text: Way toooooooo expensive.  The plates weren't exceptional or exceptionally large. The cheesecake was good though.

xaHqjoT-kteHjDP99PU-BA.text: I forgot the name of the sandwich I got, but it was bigger than my thigh.  It was basically a brick of pastrami and a brick of turkey between two pieces of wheat bread.  I barely ate half and I kind of felt sick after from eating so much goddamn meat.

sahxC1X7HhCKHWT2czCN3Q.text: Huge, huge, HUGE sandwiches that beg to be split. That is why they charge a $3 sharing fee. No problem. The service was a bit slow, so we never got refills on our beverages, but from what I could tell, our waiter had at least 12 tables in the cramped and bustling recreation of a NY institution. The pastrami was a little dry- I should have gone with my gut and gotten the open-faced melt with cheese, because the crusty mustard pot on the table scared me. By the time I ate here, I was done with casino atmosphere, noise, and prices. But this was worth the trek from Mandalay Bay to the Mirage, and splitting a sammy and plate of fries plus 2 iced teas was easy on the budget; a good lunch option on the Strip.

3GQLpKEfu09eGqo0SBdZgQ.text: The only thing I had at Carnegie was the cheesecake. And WOW! It was damn good. The truffle torte cheesecake. Yes, it's pricey, but it's meant for sharing. I guess friendly service isn't their specialty. The old guy behind the counter wouldn't crack a smile or even look up to acknowledge us... until he took our money.

9O0g44ngcDD8JRTYqjbHGw.text: all i can say is that this place holds a special place in the hearts of me and my girls!!! nothing like stumbling into Jewish deli at 5am on our way home from the clubs..   where else are you served a plate of pickles upon being sat and has gefilte fish on the menu?? we were way to entertained to care about the greasy food we were eating.   3 recommendations: go when your wasted, order the grilled cheese and fries, and ask for Maria!!!!   We loved you Maria ;)

IDIrAnvzNOwPA8cdW7Sncg.text: This place has the biggest sandwiches I've seen. I'm talking HUGE. Sandwiches here should just be called a ton of meal with a side of bread. One meal is good for two, maaaybe 3 people. The food itself is alright, nothing special. I suggest just ordering an omelette or some kind of breakfast, or the beefamania is pretty good too, can't go wrong with gravy!

R-NHppDfmOiyae5Q9WKeVQ.text: How disappointing.  You need to go to New York if you want to try the Carnegie.  There is no comparison.  I ate at the one at Mirage and couldn't believe how bad they had gotten.  When I went home with my wife's father who had never been to New York, I was reluctant to take him to the Carnegie.  However, the one in New York is still excellent.  Maybe I am being a little critical, because you won't get a sandwich this big anywhere else in town.

wtKc2GKdLIYxBeZO3P2W-w.text: This place is scary. Their portions are huge and the food looks scary. Look at my pictures, we ordered alien babies or something. I think its  ruben sandwich and an omelet. Yucky..and it tasted gross.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fJzFmaMb3MiAquSVxCyHfw.text: Great matzo ball soup!  The pastrami sandwich was HUGE and it was soooo yummy with their brown mustard.  I'm still dreaming about it.  My husband had a humungous liver sandwich.  I had a couple of bites of that and it was pretty good but not as good as my pastrami sandwich.  The only disappointment was the tasteless coffee.  I'd pick this over Cravings anyday.

YX10knDhCqK0ACeyg3qxbw.text: The food is generous. Most people ordered omlettes here. The bacon is excellent. The service staff were excellent.

OMj4JI-y7OTUIwmruOel2w.text: Went here for lunch during the week.  There was no line and the service was great.  We got a latke, the "Woody Allen", and salami sandwich.  It was all delicious and I would definitely return.

hKUX502R-CAEA12COW6njQ.text: Reason: Mom's first trip to Vegas in 30 years (whoa).  Bueno: The portions and the prices (depending on what you order). I really dig the breakfasts here!  No Bueno: Just about everything else. Oversized meals and sandwiches that aren't possible to eat without a fork and knife...which kind of defeats the purpose of sandwiches  =P  Flavor is ok, but it's nothing spectacular and the service is average at best.

wSdXGrDv3vMyytH49Up2KA.text: We came in for a quick bite before LOVE and I liked the food.  We saw that the portions were huge, so we split a sandwich and I ordered the chicken noodle soup.  The turkey sandwich was your normal turkey sandwich, but with a ton of turkey. I really liked the chicken noodle soup.    I really wanted the pastrami sandwich because it looked really, really good -next time.  We didnt' wait at all and the service was fast and she was on top of it.

WAG1gfI_JTUgNFA9Mc7Nug.text: The portions of meat in the sandwiches are seriously ridiculous. And to top it off... I thought the salami was disgusting. It did not taste right. And the portions were just off-putting.  The only highlight was an interesting tidbit from our server: The booth we sat in had a telephone. We were told that the owner of this place will sometimes call in and talk to the people seated at that booth to see how their experience is going... he lives on the East Coast or something. He did not call during our meal... but I thought it was intriguing to put a telephone in the booth to check on his customers himself....

kifxgXJpxR_fsjypTud3WA.text: OMG - Biggest Club Sandwich I have ever seen.  And not "good" big.  It was way too big.  There is no way to eat this sandwich by taking a bite out of it.  If you try, you have to eat 1 bite out of the lettuce section, then the turkey section, and so on.  What a waste of food.  The turkey burger was pretty good.  So were the fries.   We had a party of 10 and the service was pretty good.  I'll give them that.  I also loved the hologramed pickle jars on the walls. Pretty freakin cool.

Wd9KIkaXemAePNgiVEhiIw.text: Carnegie has the yummiest deli sandwiches. There is something about the meats that is simply amazing. I usually get the corned beef, but I have had the pastrami, too. My mouth is salivating as I type. It is that good.   I have a couple tips/warnings:   -The servings are huge. So either share or expect to bring food home.  -There is only one size for french fries. So if you're eating alone, you might want to skip it because you'll be wasting a lot.  -The place is cramp.  -The prices are expensive.   Weird side note - I always order iced coffee when I'm there. I usually like my coffee with cream and sugar, but the coffee plain here is super good. I can taste it right now. YUM!!!   If you do make it to dessert, I would suggest the strawberry cheesecake. The texture is different from any other cheesecake I have tasted. It is rich in flavor. The strawberries compliment the cheesecake as opposed to being overbearing.   If you don't mind being cramp and spending a little extra cash, then you got to try Carnegie. Try to stick to the meatier sandwiches, desserts, and iced coffee. Oh yeah, and maybe the Matzo Soup. I personally haven't had it, but I heard it was good.

muDrHojfUZ47wqr6KXgaWw.text: He said, " World Famous??? for what...plain bland food?...We went there for breakfast I think...although it was lunch I think...you lose track of time in Vegas by the way. So I had some eggs and sausage and once again..they looked like they were slapped on there like Chris Brown slapped Rhiana...so we ate there because we didn't want to get full..but next time we will look for some place else..."  She said,"Yeah i only got a bagel with butter and a fruit cup, thats because i didnt find anything on the menu that great. There really wasnt much for breakfeast expect for eggs and omlets. Next time i want good breakfast ill do a buffet at caesars or harrahs."

xYx1oUjslVVlV1fcOAFFKA.text: I had alway's heard about this place on the Food Network but for some reason I never knew there was one in Las Vegas.  I only found it because my fiancee and I were going to watch Beatles Love at the Mirage and that's when I saw it.    We were seated right away and after a lengthy look at the menu my fiancee decided on the chicken soup with noodles and I finally decided on getting the Woody Allen.  The waiter warned me that it was a very big sandwich and just wanted to make sure I knew what I was getting myself into.   The soup was brought out and in the bowl was some noodles and the chicken soup in a little pitcher.  They pour the soup onto the noodles in front of you.  She loved the soup but I thought it was kind of bland.  The sandwich finally arrived and OMG this thing is freaking huge.  If you love corned beef and pastrami you will love this sandwich.  One thing's for sure, they give you plenty of meat.  Spread on some of their homemade mustard and take an occasional bite of their homemade pickles and everything just seems to meld with each other.    I only ate half the sandwich and I took the rest home.  The waiter was nice enough to give me a little container to take some of the homemade mustard home so I packed the meat, mustard and a few pickles and used my own bread at home to make another sandwich and it was just as good.  Definitely have to go back there the next time I'm in Vegas again.  Their desserts looked really good too.

pHb761IY7m1Z_xQ7QgbSbA.text: I just can't get pastrami or corned beef this good around home.  I just wanted to eat a plate of the pastrami!  Yes, the portions are huge, yes, the bread is tiny in comparison.  This place is better than the original, more space, friendly service and no lines!

H_q9WOtoChjETxwrLpeulA.text: What a difference!  Waited forever to get seated then for the next 10 minutes we were ignored.. the kicker.. the place was empty!  Decided to give up on sit down and ordered to go.. disappointed in the treatment at the to go counter not to mention the food tasted stale.  So sad since I was sooo looking forward to eating there again. Shame...

bD0HeHOcnME8Inne3LvYmw.text: Mmm hmm (clears throat), channeling Zero Mostel. There are way too many people posting reviews who don't know anything about Jewish delis. Big sandwiches are part of the tradition; if you don't like it, eat at the boring California Pizza Kitchen next door. I'm sure their serving size is more appropriate to your needs. I admittedly have not been to New York to visit Katz's or Second Avenue Deli. However, I have been to Langer's, Brent's and Canter's in LA, and when it's on, this is the best pastrami sandwich I have ever tasted. Juicy, peppery, pastrami steamed just right! Fan-freaking-tastic. The smell in this restaurant makes me swoon in pastrami lust.  But this is not a one-note deli. If you like stuffed cabbage, please try theirs. This is the best stuffed cabbage I have ever tasted (I know, I know I said the same thing with the pastrami!) Delectable sweet and sour sauce with raisins. The ratio of sweet to sour is perfect. Amazing! I haven't even gotten to the knishes. Again, when they're on, these are the best I've sunk my teeth into. The right mix of garlic and onions inside for an incredibly perfect pastrami compliment. Also, if you like kishke, try theirs. No, it's not homemade like Brent's, but it is prepared well, with a rich, spicy flavor. The scrumptious gravy is the icing on the kishke. Try their brown gravy with the knish as well. Woah. I am drooling just thinking about it!

lvDUMDN2M_ZPUch-J084HQ.text: Don't go alone and don't think you will finish a sandwich all by yourself.  I would have given it 5 stars but it is SO SLOW to seat.  Great food and if you split it it's a great price.

H4rWyv988zBNlenST1xUKg.text: Foo is just as good as the one in Manhattan.. you can eat for 4 days.. at least thats what I did.. Corned beef sandwich with russian dressing on the side..   order extra dressing, extra bread.. you are good to go.. I do in in manhattan too..   the atmosphere in vegas is fun.. but its vegas.. go to NY for a treat.

fRQayJ3SZd7iZBFqB05sQQ.text: Came in on a Friday afternoon for lunch,  around 3 PM.  Talk about a late lunch!  We just flew in and was starving!    I've been to the Carnegie in NY so I had high expectations.  It was only one of my buddies that had arrived, so we ordered 2 pastrami sandwiches and a side of fries.   But, out came only ONE pastrami sandwich!!!  Since it was huge, and the plate of fries was huge as well,  we decided to share it.  It filled us up for the time being,  but I can't believe they messed up our order.  I guess that's okay because we had a big steak dinner reservation planned for Cut later that night.   The sandwich was good, filled with massive amounts of pastrami.    I would rate Carnegie 2nd to Katz deli in NY.  Overall good stuff.

rfMlFSKTqtsq7F8iy_MNqg.text: It's big and pricey.....I much rather go to the Bagel Cafe....but the cheesecake is good :-)

Sff5UN-sLzfSreUIS3Na5g.text: If you are a soup fan, the minestrone soup was incredible.  Unfortunately it was a so-so experience from there on out.  After the minestrone soup (I would go back just for the soup) and hearing reviews about the sandwiches, I had high expectations of the pastrami.  The sandwich was not bad, but not great either.  At a $15 price tag and due to the reputation, I expected better.  I would not go out of my way to eat here.  If you are a sandwich fan, make your way to Earl of Sandwich at PH.  The quality is better and the price lower.

m4IinGm-Rj33WF4oMPMvKQ.text: Yum. I love this place and it's staff. I always come here when I'm in Vegas. The sandwiches and other plates are huge. You can easily share one item between two people. Even their soup, one order is 3 or so bowls.

N784K0HE2x9GfRw03ntWWQ.text: A dessert review only...the cheesecake is expensive ($11 a piece) but wow, what a great piece of cheesecake! Got the cherry cheesecake and the slice was huge. They have a ton of desserts that look amazing.

tuaGFqTvR1uj-Xpbu3Xpjg.text: Well I have never been to a real jewish deli so I have nothing to compare this place too but being the fat man that I am, I do always appreciate an establishment that has large portions.   Went here for lunch on a weekday and it was packed so we waited about 15 minutes.  The tables are pretty small and I was rubbin elbows with the folks next to me but I was hungry so it wasn't a big deal.   I ordered the Woody Allen sandwich and If I remember correctly it has 1 pound of pastrami and 1 pound of corned beef.   Got a few pickles and some fries on the side, that was good as well.   Now back to the sandwich. It was f-ing huge. I can count on one hand how many plates of food that were stuck in front of me that I didn't lick clean and this was one of those times. This behemoth of a sandwich I was unable to finish. I ate the first 1/2 pretty quickly but only got about 1/2 way through the 2nd 1/2. With a quarter of the sandwich left I stood defeated and with that much greasy meat I can assure you I was not feeling so great afterwards.   My suggestion if you want to get your moneys worth here is to order the woody allen, eat till your full, get a togo bag with the rest of the meat then buy a loaf of rye bread and some mustard. You'll have enough meat left to make 5-10 sandwiches.   All in all I thought the meal was good and I'm always up for a good challenge which is what happened here as I left the restaurant defeated!

CZfqWrZQK5hqP355_RevMQ.text: We got into Vegas late and we wanted something quick. We saw Carnegie's and decided to bite. I got the pastrami sandwich my wife got the chicken soup. We got back to the room, unwrapped everything and wow.. We ended up splitting it because the sandwich had, i swear, 4lbs of meat on it!  In short, Carnegie in the Mirage is the bomb.. Headed there for breakfast now!

vN_l61Lv0_iwBt70Mu90QA.text: If you want good deli In vegas , this is the Place . Monster sandwiches, as said before you need to share one of there or be prepared to be wheeled out of there.  Was next door at Caesers , on the 1st Football sunday , made a quick dash over to the Carnegie , for a few corned Beef sandwiches , for me & the Boys . Awesome .

naKD4HsohYsG0Vq2o8boVA.text: GET THE RUBEEEEEN with a side of thousand island dressing. It's ah. Maze. Ing. The only reason I gave 4-stars is for the service.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VSZjPhqI-av--DU6kKPSjA.text: My family really enjoyed eating here.  The pastrami sandwich was delicious and would recommend it to anyone. Saw someone else eating the Reuben and that looked really good too. That's what I plan to get during my next visit!  The kids had a turkey sandwich which they loved it. These sandwiches were large, stacked high, and can feed two people. We also had the strawberry cheesecake and loved it too! Our server was friendly and did a fabulous job!

ISlRptbM854tHb2h5fy_kg.text: This place was cool to grab food from while watching the game.. I got the Reuben which not not cheap however to be expected on the strip.. I'd definitely say it was worth the dough.. open face pastrami piled high w 1/2 pound of meat, Swiss, and sauerkraut.. been a while since I had a Reuben I wanted to written a review about.. this time spot has lots of options from breakfast all day, lunch, appetizers, soups, and salad! Stop by when putting in your bet or on your way thru the Mirage.. well worth it..

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Desserts
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. More desserts
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Selections

4BXcCofuWozdipx_UwXAOQ.text: Carnegie is definitely one of my go to eats whenever I come to Vegas! Although it is pricey, the portions are plenty and you will leave satisfied and full!

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

sby9AoHMuwwvPSgLj7i7vg.text: If you're looking for their classic overstuffed sandwich head this way! They also serve a good breakfast if you don't want to wait in line at the Pantry (Mirage).   You order at their window and are given a number to sit down. Food is delivered to your table with wait staff available if you need them.

0kcPrOZ5N91xcyBbzaJVbQ.text: What can I about this place. Three adults and two teenagers wanted to have a sandwiches for lunch Ordered two sandwiches and two order of fry, one of older grandkid said only two why not five sandwiches, his dad said if you could eat half of sandwich it will be amazing.  He was skeptic until he saw the size of Rubin and pastrami  -corned beef sandwiches. He couldn't believe the size.  Btw he only ate little less than half and didn't touch fry.  I ate quarter of Rubin raised my white flag nomas nomas.

sA9nyg58caf5YsVuZaUYnA.text: When the original Manhattan, NY Carnegie Deli closed Sept 2016, its Las Vegas location was renovated and its ownership taken over by the Mirage casino.  It became a shadow of its former self with a vastly limited menu.  Instead of a homey sit-down restaurant, with meal service by waiters, it now operates more like a McDonalds quick food restaurant.  Its one saving grace is that its overstuffed pastrami sandwiches are as good as before, with melt-in-your-mouth pastrami, unlike the rubbery stuff served at Canter's Deli.

rnHW2Bnbi7URgvfyMLdGtQ.text: I go here every pretty frequently. Today when I went I noticed the significant drop in service, most of the empty tables were dirty and I found a hair in my food! Sadly it's now the last time I'll be here. Used to be my favorite spot.

-Z2siECajXKmy3EoRYOQ2Q.text: HATE  The rude female African American server named Mandolin who yelled at us for sitting down at a table saying our food was supposed to be to go even though the cashier didn't tell us the restaurant was technically closed. We went at 10:35pm cause Yelp says it closes at 11:00pm so it was not even our fault. The cashier also complained to me that I didn't fill out the tip portion even though I did leave a tip with my total. They need to communicate better with customers and show more professionalism.  DISLIKE  Nothing.  LIKE  The carrot cake we ordered. The local discount.  LOVE  Nothing.

qn1wo0IlQ6YeDol7m7kgMg.text: The one and only made famous from new york.  Typical deli with huge servings of meat on your sandwich.   Kind of dry,   needed mayo and mustard to make it less dry.   Service was a little slow.   We had to flag down the manager and he then promptly assisted us and brought out our meals.  Potato salad was tasty.  My husband had the pastrami and he enjoyed his sandwich.   We didn't receive nor were we offered pickles.   I was disappointed.  Had a voucher for free slice of cheesecake.   Normally it's $12 a slice.  Sandwiches are $15.  Expensive and not worth the price

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberry cheesecake slice $12
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half turkey with potato salad

6LTrOynmYQt4uwDNnGWm7Q.text: Why do you charge extra for noodles in chicken NOODLE soup?!? If it was without the noodles it's just broth! Campbell soup doesn't sell chicken soup minus the noodles... oh wait... they do and it's called broth. Misleading and my one major hangup this trip. Third world problem.... but get it right!

WHowZmzvgEJ3p_DMWh_lBg.text: Ate at Carnigie in NY. Had to try this one. We split Ruben. Also egg sandwich and had desert. All were awesome. I so loved the cheesecake.

R7qAPgkwpixnxQgWDx8nMA.text: Expect "resort prices" for their menu, in other words, about $5 or more than what you normally pay.  That's the price you pay for convenience.  Ordered their combo meal which includes your choice of a sandwich, drink, mac salad or cole slaw or a bag of chips.  I ordered the pastrami sandwich and it was generously full of meat, very lean and moist.  A big bonus, you get two whole pickles!  Only would recommend if you can use your comps here.

nMcDg8K8Y_5laFdoofFLLA.text: Before going to see the Beatles Love show at the Mirage, we decided to grab a bite to eat at the casino and make it a night of "playing tourist".  After seeing what was available, we decided to try out the Carnegie Deli, which I hear is famous in New York City. (funny this wouldn't be in the NYNY casino, but whatever.)  We had heard good things about the pastrami here, and having been warned about the size of the portions, we actually ordered the pastrami and salami sandwich (23.99) with an order of fries and decided to "share" the sandwich. They charge you 3.00 to share, which was okay by me, since I wanted to try it out and wasn't nearly THAT hungry! As other reviewers are stating, the sandwiches are freaking ginormous! I mean huge! I couldn't finish that thing in one sitting at my hungriest! I mean that was some Man Vs. Food sh*t right there!  But just because the portions are huge doesn't mean quality is sacrificed! The salami was great, don't get me wrong, but the pastrami was deeeeeeeeelicious! Mmm.mmm...MMM! Not only that, but even the fries (5.99) were tasty and it was a huge heaping plate full!  I read some of the reviews about bad service, so I was braced for less than stellar service, but that just wasn't the case for us last night. Our waitress was sweet, friendly, and attentive, despite that fact that it was a full house with a long line waiting.   My only complaint woul have to be the prices. I mean it was really good and you are on the strip....but damn, 24.00 for a sandwich is a bit much no matter how yummy it may be...  But, it was still a pleasant experience and when family visits (Momma loves the Mirage) I can see myself coming back here to try more of the menu. The prices just keep it from being a regular thing.  4 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Tg6NT7fHjzM9cAdIOWKxIg.text: We came for a quick bite before the Beatles Cirque show and weren't disappointed.  The pastrami was great and the wait service gals were sweet, attentive and treated us like family.  We've been to several deli's in NYC including Katz's and I must say the meats here at Carnegie are really good, only a tad dry because it isn't fresh out of the steamer.  But for a quick smoked meat fix, Carnegie hits all the high notes.    I'd stay away from the huge bowl of chicken soup and rice.  That was a big mistake and waste.  The potato salad was creamy, rich and tasty, the cole slaw forgettable, but the sandwiches spot on!

OJZUxPZEpiWXg26sHw6bnw.text: Not impressed. Bread was stale. Super expensive for some stale bread and with some meat on it. My sister got the $10 French toast and that was the best of what we got. Service wasn't that great. We had to ask for water. Only some of us got water. Would not recommend...

ds-P7b2s4unY3RBY1ednYw.text: Ate here for breakfast on 12/28/2016, our last day in Vegas on our four day trip. We decided to split the Ham Omelette and a Cinnamon Roll. Food was ok, nothing overly tantalizing to my taste buds or anything like that though. Omelette was a little on the watery side and even though the Cinnamon Roll was yummy it was very cold in the middle, I should of thought to have them heat it up but if we ever eat here again I'll remember that.  Only one snaffu during our experience, they originally brought me cinnamon toast first and I showed the waitress Maria that I had in fact ordered the Cinnamon Roll. After a few minutes I was wondering if I was ever going to get my Cinnamon Roll but then I realized for as busy as they were they were VERY understaffed.  Basically you order you food and pay at the front counter then find yourself a seat. Since they were obviously understaffed there were quite a few tables empty but not yet cleared, saw a patron clear off and wipe down here own table as there weren't any available to sit at. I think if they had busers it would make this place much better.  Overall wasn't a horrible experience and our waitress Maria, was friendly, attentive and kept the coffee flowing which is always a plus in my book. If we stay at the Mirage again on our next Vegas trip I'd give this place another shot, hopefully they give the servers some much needed help.

3bs4owW6MlsdWZGYpTAYvA.text: What a waste!!! We use to talk up this place to everyone We run into... Locals and especially visitors... But we just  Realized they have turned this place to a fast food joint...  The portions are smaller but the pricing has gone seems slightly higher !!!  And the best cheesecake is not so... Very dry and not sweet at all!!! Another place that's change for the worse!!! Won't back!!!  Would like the service and respect for these local prices??? Hopefully they change it back to the way it use to be!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The line where the Togo area use to be located !!!!

dgUk1hQyRqaOGExemm_JTw.text: I heard of this place before and kind of wandered into here. It was breakfast so naturally I ordered the New England lobster roll lol. My friend got the pastrami hash! Both was amazing! I loved it a lot. Really big portions, can not finish it and make sure you share type of portions lol.  They really know what they are doing and I can't wait to visit them when I go to New York. Definitely coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pastrami and hash! Delicious!
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New England lobster roll! So good!

nyXykSB0-g3xb0DM_x3Gkw.text: The service was fast & friendly.    The portions are ridiculous.  The food was fantastic.    It was a great break from our day in Vegas. :D

NqkTtUf-l1e2XTGacCh5vg.text: The quality was pretty up there, and so was the price. Yes, Pastrami at $18 plus tax seemed a bit high and I couldn't justify until I used MyVegas 2 for 1 rewards here. The sandwich was big enough for almost two. The Pastrami comes with grain mustard and a pickle. I do have to say, the pickle here is terrific, almost the best I've had.   As for the Pastrami, it's quite good. It's traditional on Rye and cut thin and stacked. It does get busy here so I was able to get it to go. I haven't had the chance to try other items on the menu, but I will definitely look into it the next time I'm here.

Om7G722wKxp0XGSPAMgQjg.text: The portions are huge and priced well if you share. I haven't been to the original but I've heard that it's not close to the original.   The food was decent. Felt a bit drier than I had expected. I added a good amount of mustard to my pastrami sandwich. The meat had good flavor just not enough fat to protein balance. Needed to keep some of its juice.   The cheesecake was delicious! That was the real deal and I am so glad I split one. Yum!

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French fries
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pastrami
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheesecake

IMlQFKxOznWNVhjlYtKzQg.text: We went to the Mirage to watch The Beatles. Since we found out we still had an hour and a half before the show starts, we decided to grab a small snack that we can share prior watching the show.  Then we saw Carnegie. My husband was ecstatic since it was one of his favorite deli places to get a good pastrami sandwich.   So, we ordered the pastrami sandwich, a slice of their NY Cheesecake and a slice of their rich chocolate cake.   The pastrami was so huge that we were able to cut it in 4 and shared amongst the 4 of us. As for the flavor, it's ok. I think I've tasted better pastrami sandwiches in NewJersey.   Likewise, we enjoyed the taste of the desserts. The chocolate cake was very sweet and rich.. enough to satisfy one's sweet tooth. The cheesecake was ok.  I gave this a 3star since we weren't even offered any water..just because we didn't order any drinks to go with our snacks, we also didn't get any complimentary water. The waiters were too busy to even care when we tried getting their attention to get some water.  But if you do want pastrami sandwich, this is an ok place to get it.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Their dessert display
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. NY Cheesecake
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Carnegie sign

Flex9ECuFu3o1SdW8jW77g.text: Came here for breakfast on our last day staying at the Mirage and was NOT impressed.   First of all, there were only 4 people in front of us and it took 20min to finally get to the cashier. It should not take that long to order. Second of all, the cashier was not friendly at ALL. She seemed like she hated her job. We paid for an OVERPRICED $13 sandwich to share with a $20 bill, and the cashier gave us a receipt and called "NEXT" for the next customer. Ummmm excuuuuse you, where's our $7 in change? That ain't no tip for your sh*tty service! She just laughed and apologized as if she didn't know any better. *rolls my eyes*  Two stars for the mediocre food and the waiter for being somewhat nice (shocker). If Mirage offered more breakfast joints like have a food court, we wouldn't have gone here.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Inside
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Haven&#39;t tried the cheesecakes

uOcaArVP9roekj3pJgJBdA.text: It's been a while since I've been to Carnegie. Since my mom wanted to use her 2 for 1 coupon there, I figured it would make for a good quick lunch. I decided to go simple and went with their famous pastrami. Hot Pastrami -- bit.ly/2Xsi8cp A very satisfying big portion of pastrami in this sandwich. And the pastrami was hot and juicy. I actually liked this better than the Open Faced Reuben I had from them before which had way too much going on with the layers of cheese and kraut on top. A solid pastrami sandwich, however it's still not quite up there with Katz's in NYC. Carnegie is still a great 24 hour spot that you can go any time of day. The food is a little on the pricier side for sandwiches, but they make up for that with their huge portions.

OtuhA3tpbV7ch6EYICuHvA.text: Carnegie gets 4 stars for the food and late night hrs.  We arrived around 9:30 pm and there was a short line of people in front of us, waiting to place their orders.  They seemed short-staffed as the person taking the orders at the register was also bagging Togo orders.    After placing our orders and paying, they gave us a number to place on our table. And, shortly after picking a table to sit at, a waiter came by and dropped off our drinks.  A few minutes later, he also brought out our orders.  The customer service was spotty but we were pleasantly surprised at how much we enjoyed everything: a grilled frankfurter, a bagel with cream cheese and lox, a slice of strawberry cheesecake, and a potato knish.  The portions were generous and the flavors were on-point.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bagel with Cream Cheese and Lox
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled Frankfurter
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Potato Knish

nnmhMbonYhc5TTxbsK7dFg.text: My experience at Carnegie was fantastic! I went  2x in one night: pre-show for a pastrami sandwich and then post-show for dessert and coffee.   Both times, the cashiers were great - very nice - and explained how the dining room worked (you order at the counter, a server brings your food and checks up on you during your meal).  I got the same server both times and he was cool - engaged in conversation and made sure that my party had everything that we needed including refills for our drinks.   The food came out quickly - which is perfect for when you are on the property to see a show or just don't want to sit for a meal for a very long time.   The pastrami sandwich was large and delicious. It comes plain (just bread and meat). You can ask for add-ons and the condiments are on the table. You can also order a reubens if that's what you prefer. The meat was tender and flavorful, not salty, and not too lean (I love a little bit of fatty pastrami).  They also have matzo ball soup (which I will need to try), knish, salads, corned beef, brisket, roast beef, turkey, chicken liver, and other yummy eats that you would expect from a good New York style deli...OH and both the pastrami and corned beef are shipped in from New York!   For dessert, I ordered the chocolate cake and the cherry cheesecake. Both slices were also very large and  were not overpoweringly sweet. Very good with coffee - and their coffee was good. Nothing fancy - just a good cup of drip!   I'll definitely be back to try some of the other items on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cherry Cheesecake
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pastrami sandwich fit for a queen!
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pastrami Sandwich

If-tkvnxT0AiFao-p-m5aQ.text: I didn't enjoy this experience on several  levels. The cashier was abrupt, not necessarily rude, just very brash. My sons wanted to try their desserts- they looked amazing in the case. We ordered 3 items to go. One strawberry cheesecake, one plain cheesecake, one chocolate cake. We ordered nothing else, our total was $34.xx. I knew the price was steep, but they wanted to try it and I obliged.   Shortly after eating it, we were bloated. This made our last day horrible.

ZwOU3hNpGjVpQPdupcvCNQ.text: Had a 2 for 1 deal on myvegas.  Normally you will spend a little over $20 for a sandwich, but with the 2fer deal it was great.  I ordered the pastrami on rye and hubby got the beef brisket.  Portions are huge!!  Stacks of meat in the sandwich.  I could barely finish half the sandwich.  Pastrami was tasty and the bread nice and fresh.  Hubby said the beef brisket was flavorful.  His came french drip style with au jus.  He got his sandwich with sliced sourdough.  He should've gotten the roll because his was hard to hold together when he dipped it.  There was so much meat!!  Awesome little sandwich shop inside the Mirage.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef brisket
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pastrami on rye

-uxpiuTfHZimxlk3D8sUUg.text: Stopped in here for cheesecake which is what this place is famous for and now I know why. The cheesecake is absolutely phenomenal and plenty big enough for 2-3 people to share! They offer just about any kind you could possibly want.   We opted for the cherry cheesecake which was served perfectly cold and stacked high! The cherries up top were just the perfect amount. We didn't have to wait in line or anything. You order at the counter and they give you a number and they bring it out to you.  While the cheesecake was kind of high around $13 a slice it was very good and its worth a splurge every now and then!

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cherry cheesecake $13.98 June 2019
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GLSIfZt0x4zhwMQlEdDvxw.text: Oh this needs more than 3 stars - good food, good service, ok prices! I needed a dinner after traveling all day and enjoying an evening reception with below par food.  As I was finding my way through the maze of the casino and other stuff to the guest elevators in the Mirage, I saw a sign directing me to the Carnegie Deli.  Good news, breakfast is served all day!  I got scrambled eggs with potatoes, hold the toast and took it up to my room.  Little did I know how much food I was getting for a fairly reasonable price.  It was dinner that night and breakfast the next day.  A good choice!

7F_5HLWbnFxnaMmwWC67JQ.text: Knocked down a star because I feel like it was definitely overpriced for what we got, but it was convenient being right in our hotel and the food was pretty good so ok here we go. I got the bagel with cream cheese and the home fries (yum delicious home fries!) and my husband got the bacon and egg breakfast sandwich and everything was pretty tasty. Our meal for just those items and two drinks was $40! Safe to say we only came here once while staying at the Mirage but if you're ok spending $40 for a bagel and a sandwich then give it a try!

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

mcj9AWSvD66pHo3trd3IQA.text: This place is a nice place to get humongous, tasty sandwiches located at The Mirage hotel.  We came around 2 PM on a Friday to grab a couple sandwiches. There was no wait-time at the register, and there were plenty of seating. You order at the register and then get seated.  The Reuban with corned beef was delicious. It's an open-faced sandwich with lots of meat and flavor. It was well seasoned and it'll definitely fill you up.  The Brisket Sandwich was definitely my preferred sandwich! It comes with an Au Jus that you should definitely use because it's beautifully salty and flavorful. The sandwich is a little on the dry side, but I think it's intended to be dipped in the Au Jus. I would recommend this sandwich.  The Potato Pancakes are tasty and come with sour cream and apple sauce, which seems like a weird combination; it actually works out pretty well. The pancakes are a savory dish sort of like latkas, so they're a bit salty. The cream balances out the salt and crispness, and the apple sauce adds some sugar into the mix.  Service is pretty good here. They're fast on refilling drinks and checking up on us. They're also fairly nice.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Potato pancakes (sour cream and apple sauce on side)
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Reuban with corned beef
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The brisket with au jus

f0pZweupNmtCJmx05CogqQ.text: We came here for the first time, my husband got the woody Allen and I got the half sandwich combo with a roast beef sandwich, potato salad and a drink and then of course I got the strawberry cheesecake.  Food had tons of meat and tons of flavor, great quick service, and the cheesecake hand down the best I've ever had and everything left you full for hours.  The cheesecake wasn't to sweet, the crust was my favorite part, and the strawberries on top were fresh and paired very well with the cheesecake and this comes from someone who doesn't like cheesecake much but I loved this one so much I would vene eat it without the strawberries it's that good.    We will for sure be coming back here the next time in vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

yBXj_srwT8xgUBIprlGeCQ.text: This is a classic New York deli brought all the way out west for us to enjoy. You order up at the counter diner style and they bring your food out to your table. It's pretty much full set I e from there.   The Pork Belly Reuben Sliders they have right now are small bites perfect for a quick lunch. They come three to a plate. They taste fantastic. On my first day I had these with a side of cheese blintzes and I was satisfied. The cheese blintze are a bit dry so your best bet is to use either sour cream or apple sauce to make them perfect for you. I used both.   The second day I went in for the Deli famous Reuben with Pastrami. OMG it was huge and full of flavor. I had it for lunch and dinner today. And I was stuffed both times. I still haven't finished the strawberry cheesecake I ordered with it. That'll have to be breakfast. But I can tell you by the few bites I was able to fit in that it is the best cheesecake you'll get around here. I can't wait to finish it.  So if you haven't been to the original Carnegie Deli in New York, you can come here and rest assured you'll feel like your in New York. Enjoy folks.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Giant slice of a great cheesecake topped with strawberries.
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Reuben with Pastrami. It&#39;s a delicious meal for two!
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheese Blintzes

pTWXcFvur4nNO-GYPIiwig.text: Got the Reuben, it's huge, but pretty dry and not a ton of flavor. The staff was nice enough and the wait time wasn't too bad though. I doubt I would eat here a second time though.

s2J3SQThYYB1zQgDd4ks5g.text: I haven't tasted many Matzo Ball Soups, but every time I've had a bowl, I just love it. Two big Matzo Balls, some soft veggies in it, and a tasty hot broth, make this the perfect comfort dish that is incredibly nourishing--especially if you've maybe had a few adult beverages the night prior ;) this dish with cold coconut water, equals the perfect meal! YUM! Plus, for $5.99, how can you go wrong? That's what the 4 stars are for. If you're feeling meaty and want something more to fill your tummy, order their Hot Pastrami Sandwich, mmm lots of deli mustard, and an extra of their homemade pickles, yes please! It's a HUGE sandwich that is is piled high with pastrami, sharesies! (:  It's a pretty basic pastrami--it's still good and will hit the spot, but I've had better; plus it's pricey! $18, yikes. 3 stars for you. The Reuben Sandwich also sounds amazing. Next time for sure! Great friendly service and a cool relaxing place--despite the fact you're in a busy hotel on the strip (The Mirage.) It's a nice walk to get to this spot and I'll be visiting again real soon. Xoxo enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hot Pastrami, Matzo Ball Soup. Yum!

VLpn8b7_sNrmOTQvQx81Qg.text: Wanted to grab breakfast on the day I was flying out of Vegas, figured I'd give this place a shot as I was staying at the Mirage. Stood in line about 5 mins, ordered, and easily found a seat. Ordered the bacon and eggs, which come with toast and country potatoes and a coffee. Food was good, filling, and for a reasonable non-vegas price. Spent a little under $20 for breakfast.  Waiter was spot on, kept checking on me, was polite, and friendly. Cup of joe was fresh.  ONLY downside, is that when you order a cup of coffee, they give you your mug at the cashiers, so you have to carry this very hot drink around the place until you find a seat. There's families with kids, older people, and drunk/hungover bodies. This is just waiting for a BIG accident to happen. Maybe just have the waiters take the cup to the table? Just a thought.   Def will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon &amp; Eggs. Simple and tasty.

-5j8roJz4sBgdVpps6wpQA.text: Had to come here since the Original one in New York closed down! Went before lunch but still had to stand in line for at least 20 minutes! Order and pay at the counter than take a seat anywhere in the restaurant so you think the line would move faster!! Maybe people don't decide what to order until they get to the register??  Oh well, we ordered the following:  1. Homemade Chicken Broth with Golden Noodles: Hot & Delicious! Not too salty and the noodles are thin & soft! Some celery and carrots that are soft and tender! Absolute Comfort Food!  2. Hot Pastrami Sandwich: 2/3 pounds of slender and lean meat!! Served with 2 dill pickles. No sour pickles! Big enough sandwich to share! Perfect with the Chicken Soup!  Worth the wait!

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hot Pastrami 2/3 pounds of meat!
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy Chicken Soup with Noodles

u1p_VYHzGNlWa6q-vWL-hA.text: Almost as good as their now closed NYC location!  I had a half Hot Pastrami sandwich and it was HUGE. And SO GOOD.   My wife got the Giant Hotdog and holy cow - it was a giant.   Later that night, we stopped back for a slice of Cheesecake with Cherry Topping. Really good. Not the best I've ever had (Juniors in NYC) - but really good.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3o9Hl_ZX2e-HWSg_7UCZ-A.text: Wonderful spot for something different from the flashy glamour of Vegas. Girlfriends and I were feeling particularly rough from the day clubs and wanted something a little more of the comfort food persuasion. We found this and it was great- friendly, helpful waiter, almost all of us got soup. Matzo and noodle in chicken broth for me. The broth was DELICIOUS. Huge portion, and as far as I could see on everyone else's plates in the restaurant, ALL huge portions. Thumbs up!

ljV_2cGEVWdPVJaHpkXTpw.text: Food is sort of the same, as they reduced the menu, got rid of most of the wait staff, no pickles anymore, etc. Total makeover and not for the better. Service is awful. The only good thing is that all these changes have driven away all the customers and no longer have to wait to get in. Ugh. This place was always packed; why did they mess with success. Another blunder by MGM/Mirage.  They just lost another star. I had a Diet Coke and got one for the road, but didn't check until I was well past the casino. Turned out to be a real Coke, too far to go back and get a replacement. Incompetent waitstaff is not going to bring the customers back.

KURFeK5Crx3k4zC2irUNyQ.text: As good as the one in new York.  $20 for a snadwich that you can eat for three meals at least!  Best deli around. Inside the mirage hotel

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The woody Allen

u4J5x75N5_ykSDIeaGg2nw.text: It eating a gargantuan sandwich is your thing, this is your place!  The pastrami is first rate and the bread is ... well who cares about bread anyway ... it's just there to keep your fingers clean of meat juices.

SOoukbgRlE9uZXgMe7_qoA.text: what's the point of celebrating a sandwich the size of your head when it doesn't even taste good? My boyfriend and I shared the corned beef with swiss cheese sandwich and it was d-r-y. like, the callouses on the bottom of my feet dry. ick.  we also got the matzo ball soup, which was $7. while the balls were HUGE, the soup tasted like campbells a.k.a. soup from a can. SO SALTY.  There is a $3 fee if you decide to share your sandwich (lame) and for some odd reason, the wait time during lunch is always really long. I did appreciate though, that they text you when your table is ready. that way you can put your name on the list then go gamble away all your money.

olyk6qQQV-IXRPE3LGPcRQ.text: Best biggest reuben on the planet.always worth the 23 dollars.pounds of pastrami ..the pickles are great..only a four tho because the rye bread is stale sometimes....

YQGctubClhWd1W2yMoum6w.text: Well, it's definitely not a place that would first come to mind when I think "breakfast". However, since we stayed at the Mirage, it was convienent for us. I must say I was pleasantly surprised. The food was definitely better than I expected. We both got the grilled bacon and eggs (scrambled eggs) with whole wheat toast and the home fries. Everything was good, not overcooked nor undercooked. It was your average breakfast fare, simple and reliably good. This was not what surprised me though. It was very busy when we went (11 AM-ish) but our food came out in not even 10 minutes! I'd definitely come here again for tasty breakfast classics that will come out within a matter of minutes. After all, when you're hungry, time seems to drag on forever, but not here!

dwG_oisVU8aVtpp1ta-zOA.text: After spending a long weekend working a convention at the Mirage and eating at the Carnegie MANY times I'm still ready to go back.  In terms of affordable eats in the casino, you're kind of screwed. There's not a food court to speak of so you're not going to get a burger or slice of pizza. But if you're prepared for it, hit the deli. You'll be looking at about $16 for a sandwich, but for the money you'll either be stuffed for the night or you'll have food for two days. Couple that with sides that are great; potato pancakes I would push an elderly woman down a well for..  It's not cheap but holy fuck is it worth it..

umCAYfcHX3B0Y4N1RxMhDA.text: Great food. Nice family friendly deli inside the mirage. I ordered the corn beef and to my delight a massive sandwich of epic proportion was brought to my table. I added a liberal amount of Carnegie deli mustard. The only word that can describe this sandwich is delicious. The service here was also great. My waitress, Michaelyn gave me an awesome smile, and above average service. I recommend anyone with a hungry tummy stop here and enjoy.

EDMRawlmQxXUZYs6htzGsw.text: When you just want a boatload of meat - well - this is the place.  I like to get the pastrami and corn beef sandwich with an extra slice of bread.  This last time we got it to go - and ate it up in our room because we wanted to go into a coma after eating all that!!!  LOL!   They did an excellent job of packing up the to-go order - making sure they included utensils, hot mustard, wrapped up the extra bread separately and pickles.  Had also the chicken salad (hey, we needed some veggies) and that was also very good.

m82HicAVULgEUp0MhXDMwQ.text: When I 1st came here, I couldn't believe how gigantic the sandwiches were. The "Reuben Sandwich" and the "Woody Allen" were so big that there was no way you could finish it in one sitting. Eating the Reuben at Carnegie was like a 12 round boxing match; you needed stamina, endurance, and the will the go on. Times have changed.   Today, I finally got to meet one of my Dad's old military friends. They became friends in the early 1970s, but lost contact after they were discharged from the marine corp. The old man mentioned to me that he grew up in New York and that he is Jewish. I immediately told him about "Carnegie" and he was elated at the idea of eating one of those gigantic sandwiches. I googled the "Carnegie Reuben" and "Woody Allen" to show him the pictures and next thing I know he had sent me to the Mirage to buy him some good Kosher Deli. I really wanted to please the old man because my Dad had been telling me stories about him since I was a kid...but, unfortunately Carnegie didn't live up the hype.  It appears that Carnegie is cutting corners now. The Sandwich was only about 1/2 the size of what it used to be. Back in the old days, you weren't able to fit the sandwich in your mouth due to it's practical-joke oversized gimmick. We both finished our sandwiches in less than 5 minutes. He looked at me like I was some kind of idiot and told me: " you don't know what real kosher deli  is". It was a drag letting the old man down.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The take out Reuben. 2 years ago, it was twice the size, now it&#39;s barely bigger than a 5 inch banana.

lWp5gp8KEJT2aGCOEv6iaA.text: Deli on point. My hubs and I split the open faced Reuben (with pastrami) and had our own motza ball soup. Make sure to split with someone ($19.95 for a HUGE sandwich) unless you want to be looking like it's an episode of man vs food at your table. We love a good deli and this hit the spot. Only reason I gave 3 out of 5 is because the prices are a little steep and the motza soup tastes too much like chicken noodle rather than a cabbage soup taste I'm used to.

OET4nzJga9crJl7BtZBj7g.text: Not nearly as good as it was before they changed the format and menu.  Not even close to throw NYC home location.

qYDPu2PNMENy5tmFQjXOYg.text: I came here the other night because my sister was visiting from Seattle. While walking to Forum Shops, she saw the sign for Carnegie and wanted to try it since she heard it was a really famous place in New York. She ordered the cheesecake and I ordered a pastrami sandwich. The cheesecake was expensive. It was around $10. They gave  us a discount since I'm a local. We also ordered the pastrami sandwich. There is just sooooo much meat for the small pieces of bread. I should have bought bread to make two additional sandwiches.  All the reviews said that the sandwiches were so big. I shared with my sister, and I was still hungry. Maybe I was just super hungry that day?  The cheesecake was huge, but tastewise, it was just okay.

2A5BtgEJimjF7pijIpDt3A.text: ***************HIT OR MISS*****************  A group of us stopped to eat here since one person in a group recommended it.  If you have never been here it is inside the Mirage Hotel (the hotel itself is very nice).    They give huge portions certainly one sandwich can feed two people and unless you are starving I suggest sharing.    We ordered the borscht, "creamy" tomato soup and chicken liver with onions.  Others in the group order the Reuben covered in cheese (not sure what's it's called if it has a name)....if you're lactose intolerant stay away from that one!!  The borscht was pretty good, though they forgot to give me the sour cream.  The chicken liver & onions were very good, though we prefer beef liver.  They were nicely cooked on the outside and the onions sweet and caramelized...ummm delishhh!!  On the other hand the "creamy" tomato was more like boiled tomatoes thrown in a blender and a handful of sugar added.  DO NOT recommend this dish.  It did not have a creamy consistency, look or more important taste.   The cheese covered Reuben was ok, nothing spectacular just large portions, and they rave about the "deli fries" which were ordinary French fries nothing specially to write home about.   Now the cheesecake with strawberries OMG!! ah-mazing!!  The service....ehh so so.  I realize that with large groups it's more complicated but a seasoned server should have it down packed and at this point forgetting items or giving us the wrong ones is just not acceptable.  And the only reason why I know our server was season was because a friend recognized her from many times before and she herself said she'd been a food server for decades.    Now as far as the server's assistant (the drink person) she was completely unacceptable.  When we asked about a menu item her solve all answer was "I don't know ask your server!"...humm I'm sorry but don't you work here too?? Or do you eat at the place down the street???  Not to mention that she did not make an effort to find an answer apparently anything other than drinks is above her pay grade!!  Also, the prices are a bit steep, for a sandwich I rather spend that money on a good hamburger somewhere else.   Overall, it's kind of a hit or miss, really depends on what your order.  So, all I can say is take your chance maybe you'll get lucky.  As far as we are concerned I don't think we will be eating here again, at least not anytime soon.

XHTeVoWLIQS48r-KQVzj5Q.text: My review probably isnt fair since im not a big meat eater... But the turkey sandwich sucked

3RbHnOMO_DZVQWOz1OqM8w.text: There's a lot of meat here.   I was never a big fan of deli food but this place is open 24 hours a day. I got the open faced ruben sandwich, which was really a big mound of meat covered in cheese with two slices of bread on the bottom. It was quite good, but It was also extremely expensive. Something like 25 dollars or a bit less? And this doesn't come with any sides, just a big mound of meat.  Pickles come before the meal.

E95Jr1oYFqwylEC7jHfZog.text: First note: "This place is very, very expensive".  For a turkey sandwich and a slice of cake, you're looking to spend around $35 dollars.  While I do appreciate the fact that they are open very late and are a somewhat cheaper alternative to room service, I'd like to point out the fact that their food is extremely over-priced.  During my last outing to Las Vegas, I decided to try this place out.  I got a turkey sandwich ($27 with cheese, lettuce, tomato and onions) and a slice of cake.  When I asked for mustard and mayo on the sandwich, I was immediately told that it would be on the side.  Now, I know this may make me seem like an a**hole, but when I'm dropping close to 30 bucks for a sandwich, the least that you can do is spread the mustard and mayo on the bloody thing for me, not give me a bunch of packs.  The sandwich itself was waaaaay too large.  I understand how alluring the 12 inch high sandwich could be, but in reality a sandwich that tall is just too big to eat.  After being unable to bite into the sandwich, I found myself in my room having to break it down into sections and unfortunately I only had 2 pieces of bread for about 2lbs of turkey.  My suggestion would be to simply make the sandwiches smaller and charge a lesser price.  I know that some people would like the idea of splitting one, but the problem is that you only get 2 small slices of bread and a couple of pounds of meat.

3JzJ6-oQY5DUbmqcnkTjfQ.text: We were in line for Jet nightclub when our party (who was partying inside already) came spilling out early to say they were hungry.  Just as well, it saved us a $50 cover charge and now we were going to eat.  Not wanting to go far, we stumbled over to the Carnegie Delicatessen with our large party.  As we waited in line, everyone went through the dramatics of the night.  It was our turn when the host started to close off the line.  I was confused for a moment, thinking he wasn't going to let us in.  He proceeded to motion for us to follow and he had a table waiting for us already!  Sweet...except that he had only counted ten as two other people had joined us in the line late.  It's okay, we were able to have our additional party of two nearby.  Yummy pickles were placed in front of us and I wish I had more.  The menu was huge and I didn't even know where to look.  The BF wanted "The Woody Allen", a gigantic sandwich with loads of pastrami and corned beef ($15.95).  The waitress warned us that it was a big sandwich, as high as our water glass.  We were fine with it as we were sharing.  Indeed, it was a big one, as you can see for yourself from the photo above.  Everyone asked if I was going to get that all in my mouth...uh, hello...I'm a lady...in a dress!  Yeah, I'm busting out with a fork and knife thank you!  You definitely need to smear that mustard all up on your meat to give it a zing.  I didn't really care for the bread though.  The BF finished his half and my leftovers went home.  (They were a bit dry the next day, but if you add some olive oil and stick it in the toaster oven, it's damn good again!)    Our waitress was a doll and so was one of the busgirls.  When a table cleared up closer to our table of ten, I asked if we could move the table over so our other party of two could join us.  The waitress said of course, but then as she walked away, the mean old busboy started taking the chairs away!  I told him we were actually going to use that table and he said, "No! We're closed!"  Uh, we hadn't even received our food yet, so I KNOW it wasn't a problem for them, he was just a complete asshole!  The busgirl ended up overriding him and gave us the table (yay for her!) and so our party of 12 was together again.  Things are a la carte here, so no fries with your burger or sandwiches.  But with them being so big, I guess you don't really need them.  They also have breakfast served all day and specialties like "hot tongue" and "chopped liver" to entice your palette.  My friend got an "Order of Bacon" ($5.50), and I do mean an order, it's definitely not a side!   Five stars for the host trying to be efficient by counting heads for our party without asking us how many we were and one star for the jerk of an ass old man busboy who hates his job.    3.5 stars overall.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#34;The Woody Allen&#34;

4UyCxMes3i76W3IpPiR4xQ.text: This place has gone downhill from years ago. In the past it was a really awesome Kosher style delicatessen. The menu was fantastic. Now when I went back to Vegas in December it's cafeteria style, and the menu is watered down. Whoever had the audacity to change a winning formula should have their brain examined. No longer will I consider the Carnegie delicatessen a must visit destination.

fcc8GzmhtXNTnPExzrP5Lg.text: It may be expensive for sandwiches, but the food quality was excellent.  Service was fast and efficient.  Huge sandwiches that could feed a small family.  Check out the pictures to see what I mean.

admwl7fyPevGCPQeSNAnOg.text: Carnegie's is located at the Mirage, near the Sportsbook.   The front of the menu reads: "Home of the best pastrami and corned beef in town and blitntzes too!"  This may be, but at $17.99 a sandwich it's a hard to swallow the price even for Vegas.  What to do in this dilemma? SHARE a sandwich, ask for water, and take your order to go.    Me and my boyfriend shared the corned beef sandwich since we're both not fans of pastrami. Trust when I say, it'll be more than enough: the sandwiches are HUGE. Since the prices on sodas and bottled drinks, including bottled water, were also ridic we ordered regular water. The water cups were given in a normal sized drinking cup with a lid as opposed to the mini sized water cups I abhor. We avoided dining in since the place was packed and opted to take our order to and sit at Sportsbook. I was very pleased that we only ended up paying for the sandwich.  Overall the corned beef was good.  They're very generous with the meat, I had to take apart my half of the sandwich and remove some of the meat just to get the sandwich in my mouth. The sandwich was spot on: the corned beef was very flavorful and tender combined with the tangy mustard we asked for on the side.   Would I have it again? Yes, but only if I share it with someone!

F2kFnY8p4rMl9UBiSRWPaw.text: My wife and I stopped in for a quick bite. We ordered a pastrami sandwich and a side of cole slaw to share. Our food arrived promptly and we were pleased to see that the sandwich was indeed big enough for us to share. Not that I can't eat one of these sandwiches myself. But we just wanted a small meal. Now here's the important part .... the pastrami was delicious. Considering how lousy most pastrami has become since the good old days, this pastrami reminded me of old time New York deli pastrami. Sure, it's not cheap at $17 a sandwich, but this is Vegas. And 7 bucks for a small dish of cole slaw? Not worth it ... even at Vegas hotel prices. Nonetheless, we enjoyed the pastrami and will be back.

VbUtniKrviRF9Vxng0VmmA.text: Best Pastrami I've ever had!!!! Of course, being in Vegas the prices were steep  but you get a ton of food! If ever near the restaurant again my husband and I would order The Woody Allen and fries and split it. He got the Woody on his on and I got the Pastrami Sandwich and we split a plate of fries. The food came out promptly which was nice. My husbands towering meat mountain was a sight to see. We actually sat at a window table and people would literally stop to gawk at it and some even came up to comment. The pastrami was SO tasty, as well as the corned beef (I sampled his!). Tender and extremely flavorful. The rye bread was soft and tasted the way it should. I dinged them because it could have used a slice of cheese or something to accompany the meat. Ask for mayo too, the mustard on the table is quite fabulous but add a squirt of mayo and it's golden. Their water was terrible as well, unfiltered doo doo, spend a few extra bucks and get a fountain drink or just avoid a drink.

1nm016FFoFSUlOPC8OXrgw.text: All I had was half a sandwich Pastrami and Corn Beef, I'm not a fan of either, but my friend picked it and to my surprise I enjoyed it.  We couldn't finish the whole sandwich so i took it home and had it for breakfast, it was still good the next day.  I want to go back to try something else.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pastrami and Corn Beef

AzG6PvTdNyrecHu08n9RvQ.text: I have been patronizing this deli for years in Las Vegas and had always loved the corned beef hash but was sorely disappointed in the food and the service on a recent visit.  In the past the corned beef hash had  been excellent with big chunks of corned beef and onion fried crispy and served overflowing a huge plate  Earlier this week, the corned beef hash was a small portion, had a peculiar aftertaste,  was minced to the consistency of dog food and was greasy and served lukewarm, almost like it was not ever on the griddle.  I also ordered rye toast and a cinnamon roll to go.  While the rye toast was good, the cinnamon roll was stale and I had to ask the server multiple times to bring them, even though I had already ordered and paid in advance.  I also observed at least three other diners in the vicinity of my table who left half of their sandwiches completely  untouched, so I am surmising the sandwiches were less than satisfactory.  It is not surprising that it was easy to get a table at lunch time.

0sJ496B095--6mIthESWgw.text: Here at Carnegie Deli is one of the best sandwiches I've ever had - the corned beef reuben.  I've made it a point to eat this sandwich on almost every trip to Vegas.  Mounds of hot corned beef covered by melted cheese and sauerkraut.  A huge bowl of thousand island served on the side, which makes dipping perfect.  Ambitiously, I always order the full sandwich - and realistically I can only finish about 3/4 of it.  This thing is huge.   The deli is tucked inside the Mirage Hotel, this place is well worth the wait when their is a line - and even better if you can grab a table before or after peak mealtimes.  I've never been to NY, so I can't speak to Carnegie's authenticity but eating at their Vegas location is always a treat for me.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corned Beef Reuben sandwich - delicious!

ZBX-EnGM7_r-nEvAzzj_6w.text: I would have given them zero stars if I could. What a disaster. We live near the strip and have taken out food many, many times without a long wait. Unfortunately, they now have take-out orders and dine in customers line-up together and place orders at the same cashier. While my wife ordered at CPK across the hallway, I waited in a line of 15 people to get to the counter to order. By the time she had her food, I had moved 4 people closer to the counter. As I left in disgust, I noticed that there were more people in line than in the restaurant, which was almost empty. Obviously, the idea of eliminating waitstaff by transferring ordering to the cashier is a failure (I was not the only one to leave without ordering). I will never go back and based on their new business model I doubt they will remain in business long.

QL_C2lXbn4FniRvJ0F87mw.text: This deli is something that I would recommend you check out if you have enough time in Vegas. The food comes in EPIC proportions and the quality is good, but the prices are way too high and the staff is not very polite. Don't expect a great service experience

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hot pastrami

202DEZ4BPHCQo9CnniRQuQ.text: Fell in love with this place in New York Manhattan. This one here in Las Vegas can be skipped. Its terrible. The service is the worst, slow, hard to understand, and the sandwich here are just the same. If you love NY, stay out of this one in Vegas. Worst Meat I've ever looked at. Maybe the sound of the Casino ruin it, or the smell of Smoke? Vegas has a lot of great places to eat, scratch this one off

soYpJpsusGUp6e22Wvyu3g.text: 5 stars!!! all the way!!!   This place is every bit worth the price and the wait.   The food is outstanding and the there is so much you will be full for days.   The tables are close like in NY I'm not crazy about that but I'm there to eat not worry about who is sitting next to me.     Check it out its amazing!

n9kt2ogF3q6SdrR20RZ34g.text: First off, I hardly write reviews mainly cause 1.)
