If you're going to go here I recommend the Hot Pastrami sandwich. BF had this sandwich and it was delicious!!!! Why did I get the chicken sandwich???? ugh... Anyways.. back to the Pastrami Sandwich. BF loved adding the spicy brown mustard on it for an extra kick. I preferred just a touch a salt and pepper. It comes on this thin rye bread with actual seeds in it (which I liked). Great that it was thin so you can really taste the pastrami. Sandwich is huge and cost $16.99.  Hope you can try it. I may try the Woody Allen next time, see what the hype is about. I like pastrami and corn beef so I'm hoping I don't go wrong.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pastrami sandwich
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken salad sandwich

3IhVHNbXjg9j3_xWaQXdUw.text: Huge sandwiches piled high with delicious meats. Fries came out in a huge mound and steaming hot fresh from the fryer.   Each sandwich is pretty expensive on its own, but for a small fee you can split it. We ordered the Pastrami on Rye and it was easily enough for me and my husband to share, and we both left feeling stuffed. All this after driving to the airport straight from work, a long flight, shuttle ride, check in, drop off luggage and 20 minute walk....so needless to say we were HUNGRY! It was a satisfying choice for our first casual meal in Vegas.  About $12-$14 per person if you share! And it's open until 2am, so its great late at night also.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Patrami sandwich. Those fries are ONE order!

Fvi_X69-9Rf5jDnT8IrhJg.text: Items Selected:  Carrot Cake French Toast Cheese Blintzes with Big Apple Sauce Coffee  Located inside The Mirage, 24-hour New York staple Carnegie Deli had long been one of those restaurants I figured I would 'eventually' patronize - the menu featuring a few items of interest but the Las Vegas Boulevard upcharge seemingly unjustified by 'deli food,' no matter how good - an early morning breakfast finally sparked by a group of friends staying at the hotel and the result a good time with surprisingly good food despite prices I'd still label exorbitant.  Bringing the signature 7th street delicatessen to a surprisingly small space just off the gaming floor where a few trios and quartets sat basking in the glow of the prior night's escapades behind enormous sandwiches and cauldrons of matzo ball soup it was to friendly service and overhead Sinatra that we arrived and seated immediately orders followed in an equally expedited manner, a total of perhaps nine items ordered but my focus on three plus a half-dozen refills to my cup of coffee.  Speaking first to my favorite 'appetizer,' the $8.50 slice of carrot cake proved competent and not overly sweet, but perhaps as a result of our early morning visit and a cake from last night the crumb delivered slightly dry and under-spiced - the impressive cream cheese icing thankfully buoying the dish, though none of it nearly as impressive as the $13.95 fried cheese blintzes whose light eggy tones and balanced parts savory meets sweet proved excellent on their own, yet far better with house-made applesauce taken bite-for-bite.  Eschewing  meats or omelets, though all looked good, it was in a Jewish deli's Challah that I placed my trust for a 'main course' and with three thick slices soaked in batter, fried golden in butter, and drowned in maple syrup I really could not have asked for more, the stack a veritable bargain at $10.95.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carrot Cake
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carrot Cake
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carrot Cake

zoUS4DjQI0dYkJmn0hFFFQ.text: I had to calm down a bit after my dinner last night. I ordered the chef paul's special. I then said,  "I would like to add the cheesecake." I paid my bill and when I was looking I noticed that he charged me $10.99 for it.  I went back L,  waited for him to go is with his current customer. I talked to him and then he blamed me because he said I didn't ask to be charged the 5.50 cheesecake.  I pointed out the sign said "add cheese cake for 5.50".  He was a complete here about it. He wanted to rip us off. He said then said fine, said he would have to get a manner. Pushed my receipt to the side and called for the next customer.  I'm standing there confused but he then spent 10 mins with the next person.  At this point,  I'm PISSED. He then hands me the new receipt and calls for the next person. He said not a word to me.  I looked at him asked for my old receipt and said that's it. No explanation.  He basically just charged me again for all of know.  I marched to the manager at CPK and give him my piece of mind. I know it wasn't his fault but the situation was ridiculous.  The manager comped the cheesecake but I was ready to just walk out.  I should have because the food wasn't great.  The sandwich was huge but the meat was dry. Nothing really special. The cheese cake was a thin sliver and was only OK.  The food is forgettable. The waiter was nice. The cashier (Mihai) was HORRIBLE.  I will not be going back.  Save yourself and go elsewhere.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9JRHym5pYpXibpMPeDYMJQ.text: The food here was really good! We had breakfast, an omelet and a breakfast sandwich. The only downfall were the potatoes that came as a side. They were very bland. Would definitely have eaten here again!

szl2PFdIktiqw_HHbgcHmA.text: The Carnegie Deli can be loads of fun.  One last hurrah before leaving Vegas on a Sunday.  Food portions are massive.  I've yet to see anyone finish one of their mega sandwiches.  Corned Beef and Pastrami are pretty good.  Canter's in Los Angeles is better but one would have to be in L.A. for Canter's.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Brisket Ball.  What a monster!

mvoWzHTNXbibZvg-6eOhVQ.text: A bit disappointed, my pastrami sandwich was cool/luke-warm. Admittedly, I went there at 10:45pm after a concert, so not prime time. Used to love coming here, so makes me cautious going forward. I'd probably come prime time, and if that happened, I'd send it back next time.

6ExfAN2TY2Kay1xuNWQX0w.text: Nothing quite like paying $22 for a completely tasteless corned beef sandwich. I don't care if it was flown in from New York that morning, this was just not good. I had the take out, so I really can't comment on the service, etc...but it definitely took a while coming out and it was not worth the wait. Would absolutely not return, especially with a less expensive CPK and a burger joint just down the hall within the same building.

ADr7k9qJsm5yvbVu5xr58A.text: Pastrami Breakfast sandwich. YES PLEASE.  While truthfully speaking, most of this night was a haze and blur of tequila and beer, so I can't quite remember much but I do remember seeing the bright deli counter and little to no line of Carnegie, and my drunken stomach telling me it needed carbs and protein.   My buddy and I somehow made it to the counter, placed our orders, 2 pastrami breakfast sandwiches, and patiently waited what felt like hours (only 15 minutes) while our order was being made. TICK TOCK TICK TOCK, my watch goes by as my vision blurs more and more. FINALLY my sandwich is made and we hurriedly rush back to our room across the street and devour our sanwiches and pass out.  What I see in the morning is two torn and empty sandwich wrappers and dirty napkins everywhere. Apparently, I liked the sandwich a lot.

jj_-oPVYpXvgDdCAiD-wjw.text: Very good food not a disappointment. Could be a little bit more better service but I guess they were busy that thing. Try the cheesecake is very delicious

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Very good tasty food. Carnegie deli never fails. It was good and delicious and hot.

IaYuSEOlCcQrCkeZyh72NA.text: Hate that they have made what was a full service restaurant with a complete expansive menu into a fast food setup with a limited and what now feels like a super overpriced menu. Very disappointing. Now you might as well grab yur food to go as what little service there is sucks.

P3Ad1T4YGrY32cvB6uyUZA.text: OMG ! LOOK AT THE SIZE OF THIS ... yelp.com/user_local_phot...... can you even guess what this is ?? Well if you can't tell what it is.. its the infamous.. AH, THERE'S THE REUBEN #13 on the menu and under the heading CARNEGIE GARGANTUAN COMBOS It is an open face sandwich piled high with pastrami, corned beef or turkey topped with melted swiss cheese and sauerkraut. This REUBEN is so humungo that you can't even see the bread under the layers of meat. Amazing ! Good for maybe 3 people ? But i was greedy and ate half myself and took the rest togo. Here is another delish meal... the Tuna Melt.. yelp.com/user_local_phot...... not as gigantic as the Reuben but equally good. Simple. Yet tasting. melting cheese over tuna open faced as well. Yummo. Artery clogging meals but good your in vegas.. who care ... :)

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuna Melt
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rueben

_KQlnqklAVFTkS2g2LFE0A.text: No question these sandwiches are big. I had the combo which is a half sandwich, choice of coleslaw, potato salad or matzo ball soup and a drink for $13.95. The pastrami was good but I was not impressed with the potato salad. The wife had the soup which was very good! My daughter and son in law split the huge Reuben sandwich with eight slices of Swiss cheese on it.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Reuben sandwich with eight slices of Swiss cheese

RxjviynqESDZ8jLpl7iwEA.text: Lived up to the Hype.. had the $24.00 pastrami and corn beef sandwich along with a side of $2.99 french fries. Eating fly the mile high pile of meat goodness and I was totally good for the night.

AmADGmQgLgoQ53J7Lh93wg.text: We had gone to the one in New York and could not pass this one up while we were here in Vegas. The Hot Pastrami on Rye is the best ever.

jGJq8ZBGBj-NognRxXKDPw.text: We come here every time we are in Vegas and love it!! You have to try the cheesecake!! Yum!

j-a37coRV4L2qZw2kDOAZA.text: Just as I expected, great food. Sure the price was high$25.00 for the sandwich we shared but it was plenty for us.

-BuhrZbQSurc6NLDE6ZE8g.text: This place is inconsistent in service, and incredibly consistent in their great food.  The service is great until a certain hour in the morning where, for some reason, I'll see many of waiters walk by and not even offer a water.  I've walked out of this place 2 times due to lack of any kind of service what soever.    When the service is on though, they're REALLY amazing.  It's a shame this hasn't been figured out yet, because this on/off great/bad service thing has been going on here for years.  Get Jeff's Special with Pastrami.  The knishes are delicious!

hBpbxvmq9nUPpXxUaqmt9g.text: I'm sorry if I'm outta line, I'm going to stay neutral and go with three stars...  The meat on these sandwiches are stacked so high, it's a waste of food; none of us could fit our mouth around the sandwiches without disassembling them first.  The meat was super dry the day we were there.  I ordered a turkey club because that's always my safe order.  Next time I'm just going to eat a sandwich, I may as well forgo paying $32 for a sandwich, chips, and a drink at Carnegie and hit up Denny's! I know it's Vegas, and you overpay for everything, but I would have rather paid $30 for a box of mac and cheese than that... Sorry; I don't get it.

qAWlHUNVLl-RtGYVA07SIg.text: As soon I found out we would be staying at the Mirage, I had my heart set on hitting up the Carnegie Deli.  Right after we arrived, I walked up to the to go counter and ordered the Woody Allen. This sandwhich was HUGE! After carrying it back to my room, I felt like I had just done some high intensity reps at the gym.  Don't let the $20 price tag scare you. It was worth every penny.  Service was a little slow and rude but hey it's a New York-style deli. What else would you expect?

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. man, that&#39;s a lot of meat.

u-v-TewIDVCkOBaQnrrCSg.text: We had an early flight, so upon waiting for check-in at the Mirage, we stopped here for some breakfast.  If you like Pastrami, definitely give this place a try...their sandwich is like a mile high...SERIOUSLY!!! They'll also give you extra bread to break down the meat...and their homemade dill pickles are the perfect complement to the pastrami.  The prices were a little all over the place.  I ordered a hot open-faced roast beef sandwich, which was like $20!!! while the mile-high pastrami, as well as many other sandwich faves, ran about $14.   My fiance ordered a cheeseburger, and that looked kinda crappy...while the corned beef and the pastrami omelettes were pretty tasty (try adding mushrooms and cheese...yum).  Their dessert display was eye-catching...the cheescakes were GINORMOUS!!! Way more than a foot in diameter, all flushed with strawberries...yummy.  If you're living the Vegas life, and dont have the patience to sit and eat, they also do take out.  A couple of times, I just woke-up, went downstairs, ordered an omelette, and took it back upstairs to share with my fiance.  They're pretty fast too...I placed my order, went next door to Starbucks, and when I came back, it was pretty much read-to-go!  Definitely a  good place to try for breakfast or lunch!

BT3G4ODXaTTnxr6HHoolYQ.text: We went on a sunday morning, and this place wuz jamm packed!!! No time 2 sit and eat... We ordered the pastrami sandwich, (that mustve been like over $20) dang!!! It wuz huge!!! Not a good idea trying 2 eat that in the car. Mounds of sliced pastrami wuz awesome!!! I'm a sucker wen it comes 2 desserts so i had 2 get the mini plain cheesecake (think that wuz almost $10!) we saw this place on the food channel and we're glad we got 2 try this place.

jMsHq2fnKR8ajONgpAXGCQ.text: If you've been to Carnegie Deli in NYC, then there will be no surprises for you.  The food is consistent, the portions are huge, and the decor is exactly the same.  The prices are a lot higher though, and they charge you a fee for sharing. Really?  We had dessert too, and it was pretty bad.  The chocolate mousse pie was really dense and heavy, so not the the consistency of mousse one would expect.

8ELXVT_lkcdbeLGu31glpg.text: I hate delis.... but Carnegie deli had the MOST amazing pastrami sandwich in the world. Like WHAT THE HECK? How do you even make a pastrami sandwich like that? It's a little pricey, but if you're in Vegas you HAVE to order this sandwich. I wouldn't get ANYTHING else on the menu! Especially that pastrami sandwich with egg or whatever that crap is.   The original pastrami sandwich is again the ONLY thing you should be ordering from this place. That and extra pickles! This place was just SOOOO delicious because of that one sandwich. Again! Don't order ANYTHING else! I recommend eating half the sandwich and then taking the other half to go so that you can eat it after your drunk!  And to all you dumbies who didn't give this place 4-5 stars... YOU ARE RETARDED! You didn't order what this place is famous for! That's why I can't emphasize enough just get the original pastrami sandwich. DON'T BE A CHEAPO and think you can order a sandwich with pastrami and something else just because it's a couple bucks cheaper. You're already in Vegas! Splurge a little and get the real deal!

kX6ggmEMB5GkplR9vaYb-w.text: I actually did not enjoy anything about the food that we got from here.  The fact that regardless of the place, regardless of the 14 oz of meant, $14.95 for a roast beef sandwich is BEYOND ridiculous.  And what does it come with? Meat and bread.  BUT WAIT! Thats not all!  For only $1.50 extra, you can get a slice of cheese.  And for $1 extra, you can have lettuce and tomato.  ...wtf?  I LOVE roast beef sandwiches. Absolutely love them. I was not aware it was possible to make a bad roast beef sandwich.  This was definitely the WORST sandwich I have ever had, in any variety.  First of all, the roast beef did not taste like anything. It was bizarre. It tasted like water.  And the issue with Vegas is the concept of less is more is OUT THE WINDOW.  We had to completely de-construct the sandwich before we could even take a bite. There was nearly a pound of roast beef ROLLED into a huge roll and slapped on these squirrely pieces of bread.   Not to mention there was a half a pound of iceberg lettuce and white onion. What DELI doesnt offer red onion??  It was such a disappointment. Especially since the bf had really wanted a pastrami sandwich, which is also never bad, which I vetoed because I had a queasy belly and wanted something with a little less flavor. NOT SOMETHING WITH NO FLAVOR.  It was just an absolute failure. Depression and a failure. ):

rBg5j5mSEVTU9CZI3sT9lA.text: Real Dill Pickles. REAL. They are amazing. Like, truly.  The sandwiches are like a foot tall. I guess that is why they are $25.  The food is average, in general. Although ... I feel like their french fries could single-handedly solve world peace.   The service is not so good. I felt like an imposition the entire time I was there. Maybe it was because I looked like hell from the night before. But it's not like they shouldn't be used to that. It is Vegas, after all.

l4hBlv4_C6rb_6ExESxpuw.text: Seriously, meh, not impressed.  Justin E. wanted to check this place out because he'd been to the one in New York. I was pessimistic, but any opportunity to yelp something new, right?   The service was relatively good.  Waiters were attentive and came around often enough, but the food was simply subpar - especially for the price.  I wasn't feeling too hungry at the time, so I ordered a BLT.  I thought it would be a safe bet seeing how much meat was loaded on the sandwiches around me. Bad move! There was just as much meat in my sandwich...to the point where I had no idea how I was going to eat it... and at the halfway point... I couldn't bare to eat anymore... chances are, my heart would have stopped with another bite.  Overall, meh. It's a fine novelty, I will admit, but why it's at the Mirage and not New York, New York, I don't understand.  I would recommend sharing a sandwich with another person because someone with an average appetite is not likely to finish even half of their meal.  It helps the environment to not waste food and it also helps with saving money (who knows, the money you save may turn into a win at the roulette table. ;] ).

tYoJSZAEpONq9ZvCHTeb6g.text: I would give a zero star review if I could. The hostess and waiter were rude and looked like they thoroughly hated life. My husband ordered a BLT, which was mediocre at best. I ordered the chicken noodle soup, which their menu hailed as deliciously famous. It had no chicken, the noodles were like that out of a Campbell's can, and it was a disgusting neon yellow color. Food should not be neon yellow unless it's been dyed. I refused to even try it. Overpriced, disgusting food and I wish we never went.

pewRJgYg3yzYWx-2MrfVzA.text: We always stop here for at least one lunch whenever we are in Vegas.  For me, the Reuben itself is worth the trip to this establishment.  There is normally a wait to get in, but it has never been longer then 20 minutes.   The sandwiches are huge and I never leave hungry.  This last time we also had the Matza Ball soup, which was excellent.  For a NYC deli experience in Vegas, this is the place to visit.  You wont leave disappointed.

c5CUhPbCLO8EYgcfgrIE7A.text: As I mentioned in a previous review, Carnegie Deli is my all-time favorite for hot pastrami.  I've had the others and in New York City, Carnegie reigns supreme...in my book, it is the holy grail of hot pastrami, almost a religious experience every time I dine there.  I love the hot pastrami on rye there (the only thing to order other than cheesecake) so much that I have been known to cab it there to have some while en route to a really fancy and expensive business dinner.  Yes, I love it that much.  Can you say revered?  I have been wanting to try the Vegas outlet of Carnegie Deli in the Mirage ever since it opened, but for the last three trips, I somehow just never made it there.  This time I was determined and was there for lunch within an hour of my arrival.  I ordered the hot pastrami (with pickles and mustard on the side) and it was everything I had hoped for.    The sandwich was crazy tall and huge...you could barely get your mouth around it as it was so big.  The pastrami was so incredibly flavorful and juicy, just like at the Carnegie in New York City.  The sandwich was $15.95, but I was in total heaven.  It is exactly like that at the original location, the only difference being that it seemed just a touch spicier at the Vegas location which was just fine with me.  The service was great too.    Struck up a conversation with an elderly couple next to me who did not know what to order and they ended up having the same thing and loved it.  The people at the other table noticed that they ordered it and started telling us how much they loved the hot pastrami here.  It was a recurring theme throughout the meal and it was as though we were all on a pilgrimage for hot pastrami sandwiches.    Believe it or not, I ate the whole thing and was full for hours.  I actually had to postpone dinner and even then made it a super light one because of my sandwich at Carnegie.  When I finished eating, I remember saying to myself that I could die happy right now. That is one heckuva sandwich!

ji6saxvoj-JWZ8GVYiTUZA.text: Serious sandwiches for serious eaters. Large and super tasty sandwiches. Every bite is full of flavor. All the cheese/sauce/topping will compensate for the overload on the meat.

aC_lkdCs5Poa-wpQfSaa-w.text: OK, maybe not so many stars because every time we ate here it was after we have been clubbing and between the hours of where most people are sound in their beds. But it is Open 24 hrs and the food is good but the service was HORRIBLE! Mind you, we had a lot to drink and maybe our server didn't think we would notice, but even when I'm tipsy I expect decent service.  First, he took more than 15 minutes to greet us, then another 10 to take our orders which came out I feel 45 minutes later. I ordered fries with my sandwich, which I didn't receive, and 3 people didn't get their side of rice with their meals either. To make up for it we asked to speak to the manager who was nice and offered us a free cheesecake which we refused to take we just wanted our server to know HE SUCKED!  Anyways, I ordered the egg sandwich ($9.95) which did not come with any sides but it was HUGE! They are not skimpy on any of the food portions and the eggs were fluffy and fresh! My bf ordered the woody Allen ($19.99) and it was HUGE! This thing was probably a good 6 inches high of pastrami and corned beef meat between two white slices of bread. And my bf can eat; he had to take the other half to go. One night her ordered the corned beef hash ($19.99) and LOVED it, another big portion of food as well. You can get an egg on top any way you like.  This place is pretty pricey ($7 orange juice!) but when it's the only thing open at 4am you have to make it work.  We went here 3 times during our stay in Vegas so it must be that good.

MZFBs3g0xX1NMCmUmNMy_A.text: A lot of food for a lot of dough. Ordered hot pastrami sandwich, it was huge, couldn't finish it. The sandwich itself was pretty basic just a whole lot of meat between two slices of bread. Pastrami itself was barely warm, no sauce of any kind just bland pastrami. I should have ordered Ruben, would probably have more flavor.

9PgR6Jb-vcwmDX_CFMJj4w.text: We went here on our way back to our Condo, wanted a quick snack before bed (considering it was already a late night). We look around, see this small cafeteria like deli, thought, that place MUST be reasonable. We sit down and order a "simple" pastrami sandwich, cheeseburger. Then we asked if it came with fries, she said separate - she wasn't kidding a small plate for 10.99 -- yikes!  Pastrami was a pound of meat between two slices of bread, cheeseburger - very bland, and the fries look the same as Jack In The Boxe's curly fries.  Not impressed -- what was the kicker is the $45 bill for those three items.  I would not recommend this for a quick snack, I could have taken a cab and ate for that price.

-3yC-DvoKdvG-kxW-Ka1vA.text: Utter crap.  Now I don't mind shelling out the bucks when the food's good and the service is rockin', but Carnegie Deli had neither going on that night.  The waitress declined to state that adding cheese to a sandwich was an extra $1.50 and lettuce & tomato was an extra $1.00.  She also somehow heard "turkey sandwich" when I unmistakeably said corned beef.  The restaurant was *not busy* and there were tons of waiters working, but we never got our pickles even though other tables around us did, so I finally had to ask for them.  I don't know what was going on that night, but a bunch of the waiters appeared to be getting into an argument right by our table.  And then I got to watch my corned beef sandwich go cold on the service counter for 10 whole minutes until the waitress finally brought it over.  Because I'd added cheese and lettuce and was splitting with a friend, my tepid sandwich ended up costing over $20.  BEFORE TIP.  I hope this restaurant burns down!!!!  Also, I had a bite of my friend's cheesecake.  It was thick and heavy as a brick and the crust tasted like chalk.  How much more clear can I be than to say DON'T EAT HERE!

1nbX03Kkxm_-kJamiw8xeg.text: I've eaten at both the original deli in NY and this one.  You gotta know your not ordering an ordinary sandwich.  In NY he told us if you can finish it we didn't make it right.  Actually you should probably split one sandwich between two people.  The quality of the meat is excellent.  This is the only place i eat pastrami because this is an authentic deli.  The dining area is very basic and not really comfortable but the meaty sandwiches are delicious.

gx3wKvoDtnW-sX0Hwk97Xw.text: Hoped to have a light bite to eat before the LOVE show, big mistake to eat at Carnegie's. The sandwich we decided to share was so big we had to put it on it's side. It stood 1 1/2 feet high. Filled with turkey,corned beef, swiss cheese and cole slaw. It was a triple decker on pumpernickel. Of course we ordered a side of fries and extra slaw.   Left there stuffed, and ready to sit through a Cirque show. All the food in Vegas is giant sized it seems, or we just have a tendency to eat big in Vegas.   We found the service to be good.

v8FKE-boM7nrYJzPZEY5RA.text: What if i was to tell you that there was this jewish deli that had pastrami so good that it turned whoever ate it jewish.   K it doesnt turn anyone jewish but the pastrami was the best pastrami i have ever eaten. The "Woody Allen" is what we got and what they are most famous for. It is a giant pastrami sandwich probably a good 10inches tall or more. 2 people have to eat because each side is a meal in itself. The pastrami was wet but not too wet, and had just the right amount of saltiness. We put tobasco and honey mustard on it and knocked the tower down and just went thru it with a fork. It's so good i crave it now actually.   We also ordered potato salad, which paired well with the pastrami'ness.   This place is now the basis of comparison of my pastrami travels and will probably hold number 1. IF YOU ARE IN VEGAS YOU MUST GET THIS. Read the other review on this place....  it is an explosion of awesomeness in your mouth.

S74saKEINBd-4vqm8hV0fg.text: Carnegie's Famous Burger - decent burger. Nothing special, but not bad.   Chicken soup with noodles - overpriced and tasted like Campbell's Chicken Noodle Soup, noodles just aren't as soggy.   Maybe I should've ordered their pastrami or corned beef...

jRNc_2-szMRFSORjGhc_Fw.text: Don't come here expecting the same quality of food as NYC, although the portion sizes and sharing fees look familiar. The sandwiches here are good, but extremely expensive at $25 for most options. The service is hit or miss, great one time and mediocre another. I wouldn't mind coming back as the food is good, but the prices will likely keep me away.

og-F6X-E0yoWM1SP-3gn8g.text: Sandwich was excellent but service was horrid!  There were only 5 other tables and 4 wait staff.  We waited 20 minutes for our food and then never received our dessert.  We had to hunt down our waitress to have the dessert taken off our bill.  We will NOT be back.

RKm7lVkXYCGJQFa9-kGdnQ.text: Worst place to eat super expensive for a lackluster sandwich. The people who take your order and the people who deliver your food have no idea what they are doing.   Order was taken wrong and the lady bringing me my wine didn't even know if it was red or white. Talked with the manager and was given a free entree for next time but will not be back even if they paid me to eat here.

j6n5o39xveAcXjvGDcSQbg.text: WOW, I'm blown away by the foolish decision by the Management to remodel this place and turn it from my favorite restaurant in Vegas (literally, the reason I drive to Vegas every year) into a FAST FOOD joint.  SO SAD/TRAGIC!  I get it, the lines got pretty long to get a table in the good old days, but now you have to line up at the counter to order, something I personally HATE to do!!!  If I want to eat at an Einstein Bros bagel, I'll go there.  But I want an awesome sit-down deli experience like Carnegie used to be for so many years!!!  Hopefully, Management will come to their senses and realize that not all of us like being herded and treated like cattle. Sitting down and looking over a menu and being able to ask questions and interact with a waiter/waitress makes all the difference in the world to some people, myself included.  I now doubt that I will ever return to Vegas, not worth the 5 hour drive to stand in line and order at a counter!  My favorite deli is gone...

SFZlSVpnB_i80Cfp3F2T3A.text: The pastrami and core beef sandwich ! Love it !!!  but the size little bit smaller for the last time I was here . The service is very good ! Love love it !!!

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pastrami and core beef call the Rueben!!!!

0NT9UCN5UidYJ-CNGVoPdA.text: I mean... this is a novelty-type place.  You should know what to expect.  You see the pictures, you go to get a sandwich twice the size of your head and you marvel over it.  It is pricey for what it is, but it's an actual casino restaurant - albeit casual - not Little John's at Excalibur.    The wait was pretty terrible.  40 minutes on a non-holiday weekday.    The corned beef sandwich was yummy, but I got the BLT - which was OK.  The pastrami sandwich that was as big as your head was yummy but NOT spectacular.  The matzo ball soup was a little bland, the potato pancakes were bland, the burgers were just OK and the service was average - rather slow.  We went in a big group, so we got to try quite a few things.  I'm glad I tried it because of the hype, but I probably wouldn't come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pastrami sandwich - the reason we came was two of the guys wanted to try it.  That amount of meat actually grossed me out.
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The biggest BLT I&#39;ve ever seen.

yqSgTv2WeT0sumTMRC7zXQ.text: *Thumbs up* It was a free because I used my comp points from gambling. The egg and pastrami breakfast sandwich was a huge portion, and the quality of both the scrambled eggs and pastrami was good.  *Thumbs down* The egg to meat ratio was about 3 to 1. If I had paid for the sandwich, it would've been around $13. Highway frickin' robbery for a breakfast sandwich.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pastrami and corned beef egg sandwich.

q960wQPcmM-1Uo2PlKfvwA.text: So the food itself definitely deserves 5 stars. It is amazing and a perfect cure to the Vegas hangover. If your stomach is needing some love after a long night out on the town, I highly recommend the Matzah ball soup with an order of latkes. I have yet to have a meal from here I didn't enjoy.   Despite the fact that I eat here religiously every time I'm in Vegas, I didn't give it 5 stars because it seems as though they still can't work out all the kinks. The line issue has gotten better, now that they take your order at the counter and bring you your food (instead of a server coming and then having to place the order with the kitchen, etc), but it's still pretty slow. We waited for nearly 30 minutes after ordering our food, which is pretty long when you're that hungry and have already been waiting in line to order.   Also, on my way out of town I tried to place an order to go over the phone, which they don't accept apparently. So I showed up, stood in line, and finally 30 minutes later got my food. I realized they were busy so it wasn't a huge deal, but once I got to the car and ready to head out of town, they only gave me half of my order. I was pretty bummed because I was looking forward to enjoying some delicious latkes during my departure from my beloved city. They are so close to mastering the service piece at this restaurant. Regardless, I will remain loyal and recommend to all... just be prepared the wait and don't go when you're HANGRY.

iGgkoPaSBBStBKDcqmG9Gg.text: This place is horrible dont even try you will waste your money!  We ordered pastrami for breakfast which was almost $20 and it was soooo oily, overcooked and killed the pastrami by chopping it into pieces. It didnt come with eggs and slice of bread!  We asked for a slice bread and the waitress said we didnt order it with bread. The one egg was already an additional cost. Yikes. What kind of breakfast is that? The waitress was rude and no class. I was hoping that since it was the Mirage one would have good service but none of that. Coffee was additional too. Carnegie deli is a rip off.

YKQYI5z09rfgEY0Vw8c75w.text: I was with a group of four people. We had just arrived to Las Vegas from Vancouver, Canada and decided to go for a bite. We all decided on Carnegie because of its reviews on yelp and because we saw all these pictures of celebrities hanging on the walls. It will cost you around $15 for JUST a sandwich. Or $15 for half a sandwich with a drink and side. I got the half combo, roast beef sandwich on sourdough. When it came it was huge. But it came completely dry, just meat and bun. (I asked for no lettuce or tomato but thought some kind of sauce came on it). All in all, I still ate the sandwich and it wasn't horrible I just wish that it would have included more bang for your buck. I probably won't return for two reasons. One is I feel like you should get more food for $15, and the second is that the women who we paid was very rude and distracted.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-6NfQcYu2ArgC7Bf21NhVw.text: My last hoorah in Vegas...just before heading home, we had to have lunch at Carnegie Deli at the mirage. Unfortunately because it was located at the back of the casino, the restaurant was pretty smokey.   Our wait, at 11am on a Sunday morning was about 15 minutes. We came for a huge corned beef and pastrami appetite, but most of the food coming out of the kitchen was breakfast.  My husband and I shared a stuffed derma, (2 large pieces on the dish). One of the best I've tasted...nice and crispy along the casing. We shared a matzoh ball soup. I remember Carnegie serving a softball sized matzoh ball years ago, now it's served with 2 smaller ones. Good chicken stock and very tasty and fluffy matzoh balls. We then shared a Woody Allen (corned beef and pastrami). Huge! Delicious! even better when paired with mustard and pickles.  My husband ordered an egg cream, and he said it was excellent...  Service was horrible, at least our server was. I had to ask for pickles, silverware, our drinks (waited about 10 minutes after ordering).  Tables are really tiny and you can hear every conversation intimately, as the tables are pushed really close together in this tiny place....just like in NYC.  If traveling by car, this should be your last stop, because the sandwiches have about 2 lbs. of meat in them, you'll want to grab a doggie bag to bring home with you.  The two of us ate for just under $50....which by Vegas standards is pretty cheap!

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xKQfUAttfO3TuFrDowJsBA.text: This review is a long time coming... We are looking at going back to Vegas in a few months, but will not be visiting Carnegie Deli ever. Love the one in NYC, but not Vegas.   Last time I ate here was in March 2014, the worst. I had the salad platter - three different types of salads: cole slaw, shrimp and chicken. I noticed that they don't offer the shrimp anymore, probably a good choice. I'm pretty sure that's what did me in. It tasted a little funny at the time. I should have known.  About 40 minutes after eating here, the cramps started. By the time I made it back to my room, my entire body was rejecting lunch. It was one of the most horrific experiences I have ever had. I have had food poisoning before, but nothing even close to this...I was stuck in my room for 14 hours straight with all the symptoms. In retrospect, I should have gone to the ER, but it was difficult to think straight with everything I was experiencing.   I would highly recommend avoiding this place.

DVvyHv4Ol-l4MmOQ3iqIng.text: What can I say??  It was truly love at first bite.  Ever since I took my first bite of the pastrami sandwich here, I've been a fan and have made it a point to dine here if I'm in Vegas.  Located on the casino level of The Mirage, the restaurant is open 24 hours (very convenient!) and serves breakfast, lunch, and dinner.    I come here for just thing:  The pastrami sandwich.  Well, mind you there are other things to try on the menu....sandwiches named after celebrities, a variety of sides, or perhaps their monstrous Mount Everest sized slices of cheescake.  Alas, usually there's no room left in my stomach for dessert (as much as I want to try the cheescake!) after attempting to devour my sandwich.  Priced a somewhat reasonable $15.95, the pastrami sandwich is....what can I say....simply delicious and a meat lovers dream.  Make sure to enjoy your meal with the pickles and mustard (now in squeeze bottles!) available.  Your taste buds will be thanking you....trust me.  SERVICE:  The service is great!  Everyone from the hostess, server, and bus boys are friendly, attentive, out-going, and polite.  Great customer service overall.  Bottom Line:  Craving a taste of New York?  When in Vegas, Carnegie Deli is where it's at!

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pastrami Sandwich

b19sWQUp37KMDzaZTVrEmQ.text: I will also share what other viewers are also saying.  The service was very poor.  I went with a friend, we ordered our food.  She got her hot sandwich and french fries, will I sat and waited for my cold sandwich to be delivered.  I continued to sit while wait staff walked past my sandwich sitting on the counter waiting to be delivered.  Finally a waitress stopped by and asked if I had gotten my order yet and I told her no, she went and got the sandwich.  Since I have never been to this establishment, I did not realize that there was no mayo or mustard on the sandwiches.  So again, waiting for attention from the staff, finally ask a waitress for some Mayo.  She says okay and then starts to clean 3 tables before going to get some Mayo.  There was one waitress at the end of our visit that was really friendly and helpful, the rest were just completely useless.  Is this not a service industry?  Why are so many customers complaining?  Customers are paying a lot of money for a SANDWICH, at least we can be served with a smile and a little kindness?

QZIdTihd0hr8k5jvJ4WVsQ.text: The Turkey is processed.  That says it all.  The NY Carnegie would close before Seving anything other than fresh, "off the bone" turkey.  Stay away!,!

x1RTkw8SDTQc4O783KQfUw.text: This location in The Mirage Hotel and Casino is based off the famous Carnegie Deli in NYC. The sandwiches and desserts do not lose any of their size here though. Nope... still huge.   Ordering is quite simple. Just place your order at the counter and take a buzzer before grabbing a seat. I have no idea what the buzzer was for since a server brought our meals to the table and took our little device before it even went off.   The sandwiches are most definitely large enough to split. My husband and I had a buy one get one offer through our MyVegas rewards, so we each bravely got our own sandwich. We knew we wouldn't have any room for sides or desserts so we didn't bother with anything else. Beware... though the portions are big, they are pricey. Our two sandwiches and two drinks cost $44. However, after using our BOGO offer and a casino comp, our total came down to just $0.00. That's my kind of bill. ;)   I had turkey on sourdough with all the regular garden toppings and my husband had a plain turkey and bacon on wheat. Each had a full pound of meat. It was good, but tasted just like any other turkey sandwich I'd ever had in my life... there was just more of it. My husband bet me that I couldn't finish half of it and I proved him wrong by cleaning my entire plate. I'm a tiny girl with an appetite, so Carnegie definitely delivered when it came to satisfying my hunger. Now, can you complete the challenge?

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Turkey Club on Sourdough
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Turkey &amp; Bacon on Wheat

Qeh-U5EUPFdcKdIXnsYcNA.text: "That is an absurd amount of cheese."  And cheese was not the primary ingredient.  You see, the Reuben is served open face and the plentiful melted cheese hides all of the other ingredients, including the two slices of bread in there somewhere.     Ignore the haters, the Carnegie Deli is a great place to get a huge sandwich and it's really not that expensive.    You see, the second you step into Las Vegas you should expect to spend at least $20 on a meal and considering these sandwiches EASILY FEED TWO and mostly go for $12-17 except for a few larger for $20, I actually consider this a decent value.    The burger place across the hall will happily sell you a meal for one for about 20d.    Carnegie also manages a few accomplishments.   Strangely this might be the only rye bread I like.   The service is easily friendlier and faster than the ACTUAL Carnegie Deli in NYC and there was no line on my visit to boot.    I love the ridiculousness of the massive sandwiches of the Carnegie Deli, a regular stop whenever I'm in New York.  Now I might say the same for my trips to Vegas.

-KOy1bj5seV2ywk97h7HMQ.text: Very disappointing that this favorite spot in Vegas changed its service and food and menu offerings.   No longer a sit-down restaurant, they moved to an order-first format. Doesn't solve any problems , and creates a lesser tip income for their servers.   They took the potato knish off the menu. Bad move. And the chicken soup was really sub-par, with not so good matzoh balls.   Well, they lost a customer, unless they change back.   I'll have to go to New York.

hyUVl2R6t22ygnVQQ_vuNg.text: 2 months ago, this rating would be five stars.  I have been coming here for years, twice a year like clockwork. Not only did Mirage change this Carnegie Deli from a sit down restaurant to a pay-first-and-sit-only-after-ordering-and-paying Sizzler style place, they took great food items off the menu and they CHEAPENED the quality of the food that is left remaining on the menu.  No more knishes on the menu...and that's just a start...  They cheapened the matzo ball soup...no longer golden and no longer perfectly seasoned...it's watered down...they try to hide the lower quality with a few bits onions and a speck of carrot here and there.  I can't say that it's swill, but I wouldn't order it again...and I used to order it every time every visit.  The matzo ball itself? Well, it's adequate...a bit lumpy, a bit cold ... Nothing to be proud of...hence no reason to order.   The portions were still large, the quality of the pastrami okay...not as good as I remember, but unless you are a New Yorker, you won't notice.  It's a step above Denny's pastrami, I'll grant them that.  And that's what they are counting on...save a little here and there, cheapen the food...and they hope you won't notice.  The really stupid part about the change from sit down restaurant to this flush them through approach is that the ordering from a waitress wasn't what took  the longest time, it's the food prep...so the wait in line, order, pay, then sit down system doesn't solve any throughput problem.  The genius who made this change needs to go back to business school and take queuing theory...or at least read the book, The Goal.   It takes the same amount of time from start to finish just with cheaper food, fewer choices and angry patrons.  Way to go, Mirage.  Carnegie Deli in NYC should take note of the damage Mirage is inflicting on the Carnegie Deli brand.    I hope they change it back to a sit down restaurant with higher quality food...If they don't bring back the complete menu, so be it, but the quality of food needs to improve back to its former levels.   Otherwise this visit will be the last time I will stay at the Mirage hotel and the last time I eat at this Carnegie Deli...yes, that bad.    Go somewhere else anywhere else, you'll have a better experience.

owonAxRnAOKHiEI7XRNubA.text: I've never been to the original Carnegie in NYC, so I can't compare this location to that one. I will however tell you that the Brisket is amazingly juicy and with flavor that will melt your tastebuds. The bread was just the right consistency to really enjoy everything about this sandwich.

6QT8ZuwAIG3sPdRwowMkwQ.text: Had two meals here and both were A-OK.  While nowhere near the quality of the NYC Carnegie's or any other 'real' deli, it was serviceable however and showed off the ridiculously huge, albeit pricey, portions that the deli is famous for delivering.  We had lunch here one day and they were receptive to my off menu order of a combo pastrami and turkey sandwich.  It was crazy big, to the point that our table neighbors ooohd and aaahd as it landed.  I ate almost half of it and wound up getting the other half to go and giving it to a homeless man on the street.  My son got a bacon and egg bagel sandwich which was equally ginormous and he did a nice job eating most of the thing.  We also had breakfast on our last day in town and again, it was pricey, with huge portions and tasty.  If I was only rating breakfast, I would have given this review 4 stars I think.  Service was a little inattentive and gruff but got the job done overall given how busy the place was for both meals.

wmhztaqSEghroID9q88qkg.text: Carnegie Deli is located in the Mirage Hotel/Casino on the Las Vegas Strip. This is a casual New York Simulated Style Restaurant where you order at the counter and seat yourself. The Real Original Carnegie Deli is Closed but they do source the Meats and Cheesecakes from Carnegie Warehouse in New York.   *******I DO WARN YOU******** The sandwiches are VERY OVER STUFFED  (like 2 pounds of meat that feed 4 hungry people) and all the portions are EXTRA LARGE.  This restaurant is different than it was several years back. They used to serve you bowls of pickles and they no longer do that........and they used to give you the extra bread for your extra sandwiches....Now you have to ask for the bread.  We shared a Woody Allen Sandwich (Corned Beef and Pastrami) and a Potato Knish. The sandwich is ENORMOUS. Sadly the bread is very non-authenic as it's squishy like white bread with a few caraway seeds. Both meats are better than what my local supermarket sells but....Both meats are sort of dry and not succulent. They also aren't real flavorful like really good corn beef and especially good pastrami is...I also would prefer is the pastrami didn't have so much added smoke flavoring. They also only give you one pickle to share.  We also tried a potato knish. Again not the best tasting most flavorful knish but it's very large and is ok.  The sandwich is too much for two people. You need at least 4 HUNGRY people to eat the sandwich.  Ask for the extra bread for your leftovers.  Pretty cheap eats for the Vegas Strip. $25.00 buys at least 4 meals.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 1/2 Woody Allan Sandwich (Corned Beef &amp; Pastrami)
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Potato Knish
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Some Autographs

Tf-mZbGTG1Iv82fNeN7-9w.text: Very disappointed  the pastrami Ruben has no taste dried out.  The restaurant was clean and service ok. But food was not worth it.

F3Ny-xdr7zpZvgnGimfG7A.text: Let me start by saying my heart was hurt when the original in NYC closed so I couldn't wait to eat here again when I saw there was one open in Vegas. The prices are a little cheaper than in NYC but the food and the quality of the food is the same. The staff was super sweet especially the manager who I asked about the original one and he told me all about this new store. He was very nice, and super sweet guy, great smile.  I'll definitely eat here when I want another sandwich. Such a great meal. Oh I got the combo which is a half sandwich with Cole slaw and iced tea for $15.99. SO GOOD!

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheesecakes
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cole slaw- amazing!

h1nrVBea_YV_woSlmuKYJg.text: We tried Carnegie deli while visiting the Mirage. The prices are on the higher side, but it is Vegas , so we didn't expect anything less. The sandwiches are huge, so I would plan to split a sandwich, or have leftovers. The problem with the sandwiches being so big, is it is all meat. We ordered the Rueben, and it had a tiny piece of bread under a huge pile of corned beef, with a little sauerkraut and cheese on the top. I would rather have them reduce the price, and get less meat.  The service was good, you order at the counter, and the server brings your food over and refills the drinks. This place was okay, but with all the other choices in Vegas I'm not sure we would return.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Ruben
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Rueben
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fries

-BTB-zzEC62abAUEoE2EdQ.text: Carnegie deli in Vegas... coming from New York I couldn't believe this was my first stop. I used to go to the Carnegie in Manhattan like once or twice a week. So as I still had my bags in my hand I decided to get a sandwich in hopes that it's half as good as the one in NY. Boy I was in shock, Vegas Carnegie might be even better. My Reuben was perfect; tons and tons of corned beef, cheese melted to perfection and creamy thousand island. I'm almost upset over how good it was because now I have to go back, and I wanted to try all different things. See you soon Carnegie!

gFYtzlh51EGLbWVNpLPdDg.text: We have been hear probably 10 times since we starting coming to Vegas 11 years ago. Each year it slides a little downhill. We come because my friend lights the Blt. It is used to be huge, so much so that he could barely eat it or wrap his mouth around it. That is not the case any longer bit is still large but not what it used to be. I got the tuna salad sandwich and was disappointed. It was huge but who needs a pound of tuna on two thin slices of wheat toast?  And really, $13 for tuna sandwich?  With no sides included in price?  Come on...  It had no flavor and was very dry. We always enjoy the French fries but those orders have shrunk a little also.   The biggest reason that I gave them only 3 stars is the change in the last few years to you ordering on your own and not having a waitress/waiter take your order. Why?  Because first, if I want another beer I can't get it and second because I have to tip the person anyways but feel like I did the work.   Last thing, I always want to try the cheesecake but $13 for a slice is outrageous.   I will likely go back and get ripped off for sandwiches again just because it is convenient and my friend likes the Blt.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuna salad
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BLT

mLTWWYQMAuZ6VsS-bmPC8g.text: Best cheeseburger you can find on the strip, lil pricey but its definitely worth it. The fries are pretty good too.

im1vSMtLAtoUAErChKQnTg.text: Pro Tip - Locals get a 20% discount  The Woody Allen is a pile of pastrami on top of a pile of corned beef.  The pastrami and corned beef play well in this sandwich.  They are the carnivore's version of peanut butter and jelly.  Slather your bread with some deli mustard and mayo.  I found that it was a little dry without the mayo.  The housemade pickles are always a nice great.    Their New York cheesecake is very delicious.  The cheesecake is so fluffy and moist, unlike others that have a dense cheesecake.  One of the best I've ever had.    The Woody Allen will set you back around $25 and Cheesecake around $11.

2KPqM4Lx_WNNwELtmHgGRQ.text: redeemed a BOGOF Sandwich coupon from Myvegasslots game on Facebook.  THE REUBEN - very tender and black pepper flavored pastrami - overloaded with cheese and sauerkraut  TURKEY CLUB SANDWICH - 3 layers of bread - huge portion of turkey - a bit hard to eat since the sandwich itself is at a larger size than one's mouth - no condiments inside so you can customize to your own taste  CHEESECAKE: - large slice - crust is NOT made of graham crackers - creamy and tasty and a nice finish to your high calorie lunch/dinner  SERVICE: No issues redeeming the voucher. Friendly staff.   ENVIRONMENT: casual diner inside The Mirage.    Overall decent place to eat in The Mirage. The price is expensive for 1 sandwich but since the portions are so HUGE it becomes pretty reasonable.

2hrAtyEILZWOqH4eMV7cYQ.text: Came here by myself to cross off a bucket list item since the original location in New York is closed down. I've ordered the Woody Allen and it definitely did not disappoint!  It's basically mounds of pastrami MEAT stacked on your choice sliced of bread!  It also came with a sliced pickle which was crispy!   Service was excellent and attentive so definitely no complaints here.  Place was nice and clean and got inside the restaurant before the lunch crowd showed up.   The price of the sandwich was a bit pricey but well worth it since it was 2/12 meals for me!  Definitely would come here again if I was in town or I've got the day to myself again!

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Look no further fella, you&#39;ve found it!
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. All that meat....aka &#34;The Woody Allen&#34;

DY9ciCe93LP6Pg6TEUj7bw.text: The amount of meat stacked is "gross" and The greasiness is obnoxious.... and we wonder whey America has an obesity problem.  I did appreciate the taste the first 3-4 bites but after that... not sure how someone can finish their sandwich.  Do America a favor - reduce your portions and price

l32TLmI1WNzV-gZyDJQm3w.text: If you do not have a big appetite and love pastrami, get the Woody Allen. You can share it or bring it home (the leftovers) to enjoy at another time. If you have a big appetite and love pastrami, get the Woody Allen.   I walked by here a few years ago and knew I wanted to stop by. There was no doubt that I would order pastrami but after getting my daughter's feedback, I knew I made the right decision by offering 1 Woody Allen for us to share (economical, too!), a side of sausages for Gavin, and a plate of fries for us to share.   Sodium overload.   The order took less than 10 minutes to arrive at our table. I did not even get a chance to oogle over their line of desserts. So as you can see from the picture, the thing is as big as my skull. The spicy brown mustard wasn't spicy but it added an element to the pastrami to dissipate the saltiness. The bread wasn't toasted which is how it is usually served, and I love the pickles. The pastrami was tender but the sandwich was dry overall. Maybe layers of the brown mustard would have been a better outcome for me. The fries were delicious.   The guy that took my order and rung me was up wasn't friendly but our server was fast and thorough. Thank you for refilling our waters hella fast.   Glad I tried it. I'll stick to The Refuge in San Carlos.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Side of sausages for the little man.
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fries.
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Woody Allen.

LReI7Yr3471kVAElsf4y6w.text: Terrible service  Our order was wrong and it took a long time to get it back to us.  Do not waste your money here. After we got the food was cold and tasteless.  I am sorry I left a tip. Maybe they can use it for cooking lessons.  Totally over rated

1q1VebvlLEFSXfaZ10c6Ww.text: I came here on 6/17. I ordered the soup with noodles. No Masza. Upon arrival to my hotel, it was only broth and those nasty balls. So disappointed because my receipt clearly states my order. The person making it was clearly distracted

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My receipt shows exactly what I ordered
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Just these flavorless balls. I wanted none of this

Fv1DWBMeo1k73ut5z1uCAg.text: Strawberry Cheesecake is amazing! Must try perfect balance of cream cheese and sugar. Strawberries are the bonus!

TDsIj91s_obeiwkRM6kRxQ.text: I discovered this place while walking through Mirage one day. My boyfriend and I were hungry and we saw the huge sandwiches and decided to give this place a try. Let me start by saying the sandwiches are HUGE!   Every time I come I get the famous Reuben. It is huge and so worth the money. This one sandwich ended up feeding two people for two meals. I highly recommend the Reuben if you were only to get one thing here.  I have also tried the chicken noodle soup and it was surprisingly good. The noodles were a little squishy, the way I personally like it, and the soup was quite tasty.   The second time I ate here my family opted for the brisket sandwich, Reuben, the burger, and fries. The Brisket Sandwich was fantastic! I normally find Brisket to be dry, but the meat on the sandwich was moist and tasted amazing. I will definitely order it again the next time I visit.   The wait staff is fantastic, and the overall vibe of the restaurant is casual. I will be back for more of their fantastic sandwiches!

pvq-vgFUaNRQQS2MqJw_Yw.text: Portions at this place are huge. Order one entree and share unless you're a huge eater.  We come here every time we're in LV. This time things weren't as good as in the past.  Had the turkey club which was HUGE but the turkey and bacon seemed...flavorless. I'd prefer less meat in a smaller sandwich with better quality. The sandwich was so tall that you had to take it apart to eat it. 24.00 but a meal for 2.  Also ordered the potato pancake side. Had this before and it was different this time. Before more of a latke. This time more of a giant hash brown.  Egg plate with ham was great. Another huge portion. Would definitely order that again for a fairly priced breakfast. Coffee was also good and servers were nice.  I'd go back but stick with an egg plate.

FWdYh2WWzTYdaVTY3j9iHA.text: I'm glad there are some breakfast options for those who don't want pastrami. I shared an egg and ham sandwich and it was perfect after a night of drinking. I also got a potato knish with applesauce, and it was comforting as well, though the mashed potatoes had a flavor I was unfamiliar with. Friends got pastrami and a rueben and it was just a huge amount of food. They seemed happy with it though. During a previous trip, I tried the chopped liver sandwich and matzo ball soup and really enjoyed both. Plenty of dining space inside. Perhaps it was a quieter time and tables were close together, but we got some dirty looks from (older) folks because we were probably being too loud and rowdy. Oh well, it's Vegas.

gj9oLRnpN2RIJxUCnuOZfA.text: Went there again recently and it's getting worse each time. Sandwiches have gotten smaller and the bread isn't as fresh as it should be. They also started removing the name of Carnegie from most things.

-HPrs3UDlpkxBKa5F928kA.text: Service is good and friendly.  Ordered a turkey sandwich. Pretty standard deli/processed meat. Not really a sandwich. More like a hunk of meat between very mediocre bread. Pickle excellent. Very good cole slaw - not too much mayonnaise.

Hdc_SM75VbyXW9Lo3tvvcQ.text: Good but not New York quality. The pastrami was tasty but you really miss the type rye bread and cole slaw that the NYC one offered.  Also, no pickles at the table.  Same big servings, though.

QecDa7b37a5_wB7MJW4SOw.text: Two words: Woody Allen!  This was the biggest pastrami i have ever had and reasonably priced.

e9Ai4VckS3uAyu6HWhvzJA.text: My sandwich the traditional Reuben on rye was outstanding the only thing I could say is bring your friend with you it's huge oversized gorgeous delicious dripping with flavor I will say it is very expensive for your average person coming in to check out at Famous Deli it's a little bit outrageous cost-wise but if you get the sandwich and you split it with somebody then maybe not so much the service was outstanding very kind people and the food was so good I wouldn't change a thing

mV6CD6L1rcsBJgMkYKlJUA.text: Wow; I thought I've had a Rueben sandwich before but I guess not. This place makes the best Rueben I've ever had. The service is kind of lame and rude, the wait made me think they forgot, and their prices are outrageous but this sandwich was nothing to mess around with. They served the Rueben open style, which just means there's no top bun. You can eat it with a fork and knife or just with your hands. The cheese is a nice bitter swiss, the bread is buttery and crunchy on the edges, the cornbeef is out of this world. If it wasn't for this awesome sandwich, and probably their other great food I'd say this place was a 2 or 3 stars but maybe that just tells you how good it was. Overall, this place is definitely a 4/5; now I need to figure out how to make this at home.

HVrVmUK5mRfYXWLMzZlHUQ.text: Was thrilled to eat at the Carnegie Deli at the Mirage. One I know the food is great, good deli is getting harder to find and I was in need of some Jewish penicillin as my Mother would say Matzo ball soup.   Since my last visit to this location you do not have table service rather you order at the counter than you pay for your order than you find a table and they bring it to you. Ok we order pay and sit and wait. We were on a Thursday late afternoon and the place was empty except one other guest.   My Matzo ball soup arrived first. It was heavenly and just hit the spot. I had a Dr. Brown's soda with it and it came in a glass bottle that was a first usually it is always in a can. Than I got a ginormous Black and White cookie for later. My husband and friends all ordered sandwiches. Even though they are good eaters and missed breakfast they couldn't even make a dent. Problem is you can't take it home to FL what a waste to leave it.

Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dr Brown

VsyYhOL348jPmkedTDBk_A.text: Not quite the same as it used to be, but still good to visit.  This place is a classic.  Ordered the Woody Allen, a pound and a half of pure goodness from which I promptly tossed the bread and dug into the meat.  You can choose two meats for this one, so I was able to enjoy both the Corned Beef and the Pastrami - both very good (Pastrami was better IMO, if we're keeping score).    The prices are a bit high, but then it's Las Vegas.  The sides were a bit small...  If I hadn't ordered 1.5lbs of meat, I would have been more disappointed with the small side, but it was okay.  Service at the ordering station was great...  Dining room service was just so-so.

JF-aYCqK0KAdmpB-s9KrDA.text: Came here for breakfast because the line at Pantry was too long.    Price - I expected to pay a lot, but I had a mushroom omelette, side of bacon, and a coffee; $29, before tip.  That's ridiculous.  There was nothing special about the breakfast.  It wasn't bad, but it wasn't anything I'd come back for.  Food service was quick.  Waitress was sort of attentive.  Coffee was not refilled without asking.  Only two creamers on the table, no more offered, none replaced with refill.  The restaurant was maybe 1/3 full but I found myself getting up to find creamers, sugar and hot sauce from other tables.  Bacon was thin and greasy. Nothing special.  I was hoping for thick cut flavorful bacon.  So, the message is, if you need breakfast you can get it here and the service is pretty quick.  It's obscenely overpriced and isn't anything to write home about, but it's eggs and coffee and sometimes that's all that matters.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mushroom omelette.  Coffee.  Side of bacon.  $29

fUSxjmhLIHoRxbPEgwNZNA.text: Lunchtime...thinking about the best pastrami sandwich I've ever had...better than To Go's and Canters  Carnegie Deli @The Mirage

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

x_M2yejzPx46mDWI_p5W_Q.text: Extremely dissapointing and way overpriced.  17.99 for a mediocre pastrami sandwhich which was way smaller than expected.  This place is just a novelty of the original on new york... but if this is what the new york one us like thats too bad because togos has a better and larger pastrami for way less.  Poor new yorkers are getting screwed....lol  I have to say though the waitress was great but the way this place is set up you pay at the counter you get a number then the waitress brings it and refills drinks etc.... if you dont have cash there is no way to tip these hard working ladies.

mF-3TwkX1aKFe_mGGNDkVA.text: They lost their alcohol license.  They have 2 pastrami sandwiches-- one 2/3 lb for $18 and one 1/2 lb special for $25... go figure... It was delicious, but confusing.

UYmi1KOJ6y1VozZv_d0aIQ.text: Not sure what happened to this place. When I last visited it was $14 for a GIANT reuben sandwich and the place was packed.  Now it's empty and counter service with same sandwich for $25 (30) after tax!!!  Sad!

aH_c-pKD4eN1c-gSNWFRaQ.text: Addie's wrong. This is great old deli and appropriately priced for NYC or LV. Best pastrami bar none. The chicken soup may even cure the Black Plague. Live coming here. Pleas bring back the half sours.

zk4IGznTlb1lAL2OIBanGA.text: Not worth the price.  Greenberg Deli At New York New York spoiled.  Yelp says that my review is a little too short, so I added this last sentence.

sk0__UMDKseaOQYeRI8P8w.text: Having visited the original in NYC, I was excited to find that they opened up shop in the Mirage. To my dismay, I found the prices to be New York-like without the same taste or quality. Serving size was similar, so bring a friend or too. The corned beef was a bit dry and and lacked much flavor but salt.

RWSHwXqOhf8pVpfwF8WcFA.text: Patrick was awesome, food portions are ginormous and delicious. When I come back to visit the 702 I will be sure to stop by for another meal.

g_i5Fq-x1w3Yvkr3hn1u8w.text: While recently in Vegas my husband and I ate a late lunch at Carnegie, which was inside the Mirage Hotel.  Having dined here in the past we knew the enormity of the sandwiches.  My husband ordered the Woody Allen which was piled to the sky with Pastrami as well as Corned Beef.  Let's just say it's enough to share.  I ordered the chicken soup with rice which hit the spot perfectly and tasted home made.  I accompanied my soup with a potato pancake, absolutely delicious and left me wanting more.  A black and white cookie hit the spot for dessert. Yum!  We can't wait to return!!

B4p88c1f6mEXIM0YLQafbQ.text: Stopped in for a light dinner before going to see a show at the Mirage.  I wasn't that hungry, but saw that they had pastrami on the menu.  OMG, the sandwich was huge.  That explained the large bill.  Worth it.  Delicious sandwich.   If you come here, come hungry or bring a friend to share with.

JxdSbGABfsd9mevFiSZqXg.text: Im one of those guys that made it in Manhattan. As a young man I pounded that pavement and made every dollar doing honest hard work. I enjoyed Carnegie Deli pastrami countless times. After moving away to Central Florida I miss my beloved pastrami on rye. Nobody here makes it even close.   So now im in Vegas and they ha e a satellite location in the Casino. I ordered the sandwich and root beer, then took a seat. My friendly server brought me a sandwich which looked and tasted just like home.  Eureka!!!!!!!! We've struck pastrami gold!

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beauty

t6nkz2X8o048SOtXw-UHeA.text: Let me start by saying this review should have an asterisk(we only ate desserts). We stopped here before a show because their desserts looked so amazing! My wife tried a blueberry muffin, and i ordered the Carrot cake. Both were so good! We should have split the carrot cake. The slice was gigantic! A bit expensive, but not outside of the typical Vegas up charges.  I can not speak on how their normal food tastes, but i can certainly speak to how it looked. AMAZING! Massive deli sandwiches that are typical to new york delis. My wife and I agreed that we would return simply to share one of their sandwiches.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing!

R3bb0FzgY9H_s-rpv9O2zg.text: Staying in the hotel, so i wanted to try this place from my last trip out here. I got a hot pastrami with yellow mustard.  It was really good. Not the best I've ever had, but it hit the spot. It's Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-Nvg9piBRwPbemfdQJaBtw.text: So all my friends that have been to Vegas had told me that this place was a MUST.  So of course I am going to listen and try it out LOL.  So we went there for lunch.  At first I was a bit intimidated by the size of the sandwiches that I saw being served, but then the foodie side of me sucked it up and was ready for the challenge.  I ordered the Ruben and my wife ordered the club sandwich we shared an order of fries and got 2 soft drinks.  The bill came out to $58.00 usd.  Yes that's right $58.00.  I was a bit thrown off on how expensive it was for sandwiches.  When the sandwiches were served the thought of what I just paid vanished from my mind.  The sandwiches were incredible.  HUGE, TASTY and did I mention HUGEEEE.  LOL.  If your are in Vegas and love deli sandwiches and don't mind breaking the bank a weee bit then this is where you need to be.  Although I want to give this 5 stars I do have to be fair.  5 stars for the food but 4 stars for the price.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ruben WOW
