Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pickles on steroids

USGdlzIhfpQSQdjf87WPTQ.text: Ordered roast beef sandwich, paid, sat at dirty table to wait for it to be cleaned. Waiter looked at receipt and went back to do something. 10 minutes later another waiter comes and says they are out of roast beef. Really?!?! Terrible service and setup at this place now. Need to go back to ordering at the table.

RWaMJBLLPsQ-GU6Gxjr5iQ.text: What a gift to have pastrami hash from an iconic New York deli for breakfast while hanging poolside at the mirage!  (We ordered it takeout and then brought it to the pool). This hash was amazing - a huge pile of delicious, salty,  juicy meat with a smattering of onions and potatoes. Unfortunately my eggs were overcooked- I ordered them overeasy (with dreams of swirling the yolk through the meat.. you know what I'm sayin! ) and they were basically cooked all the way through- which could be a product of the fact that the dish was in a closed container for a few minutes before I ate it. Maybe they could recommend customers "break" open the yolk immediately if that want that ooey gooey goodness!

sbBYQJJ0YU_yO4YjU42Eeg.text: Like all NY delis and especially in Las Vegas, the prices were ridiculous. Not a value and no reason to select this venue. The sandwiches are stacked high, but you cant eat them without a fork, so its not really a sandwich, is it? Pickles were barely 'pickled' and tasted like straight up vinegar. Pass on that even if they are free! I had 3 poached eggs, ham steak and toast. They give you ONE piece of bread. Wow. For $13, I would love to have the standard 2 pieces of toast. A good $7 breakfast at twice the price. Girls had the Rueben, it was good - but again an awkward little ball of meat and bread.  Not spectacular.

ZrW4mc7Bq2UQWbnpCLbQSQ.text: Kinda disappointed by this place. I had been raving about this place before my Vegas trip and was highly stoked when I finally got to try it my last night in Vegas. I should've eaten at the restaurant rather than taking it to my room at Caesars. By the time I got back, my sandwich had become a hot mess.  I had the Woody Allen, half pastrami, half corned beef. The meats were ok, but it was nothing out of this world. I had been expecting a plethora of juicy and cured flavors, especially since I'm a big pastrami enthusiast. The experience wasn't really helped by the really high prices. The service was ok, mostly because I think the manager was present and the workers wanted to look like they were busy. All in all, I would probably give this place one last shot the next time I'm in town, because I think it has potential. I'll make sure to dine-in instead.   PS Dear lady who cut in line in front of me, You're lucky I'm a well-mannered guy and that I don't like to cause a stir. But I sincerely hope you lost all of your life savings and social security money at the slots!

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My Woody Allen got real messy by the time I got back to my hotel room :(

nYeVyokzd_JLOXtB_gbQLQ.text: Now this place has a nice cheesecake. My lady and I just left a 5 star steak house on the strip and we wanted to kill time and maybe grab some dessert. So we stopped by With Love from Carnegie because we saw the cheesecakes in the casing. Let me tell you, the chocolate mousse cheesecake is off the chain. And the food they waiters are bringing out look so delicious. Even my lady said we must come back to get a full course and im totally down. 5 stars from me.

LZwK1IY6pejapAOpSEP7GA.text: the cheesecake is literally the f#%+ng best in town! i cant stop yelling, that's how good it is. hello, who's this?

fxxCaPfNmFq7aOtHOgn5VA.text: I bought three pastrami sandwiches to go and they were half the size of the ones in the picture.

mC67cA77TELKz6mm7HKt_w.text: Ordered a simple BEC in a roll.  $20 later I got an omelet on a tasteless roll .. so for two breakfast "sandwiches and two coffees it was $47.  Totally not worth it.  Walk outside the casino for better breakfast!

4bWabyB3e47iFLOr6VMM-g.text: The wait staff wont hold a conversation when serving your meal but who cares the food is awesome if you like new york deli style locations then you will love this place....

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Open face reuben so big me &amp; my wife had to eat it,

faYKrAY57Ot5jvN6z3SdOg.text: OMG amazing. There used to be a Stage Deli Express in the Forum Shops at Caesar's Palace and when it closed I was so terribly sad.  They were also a mini Carnegie Deli with the Cheesecake delivered from Carnegie Deli, New York. I found out while playing poker this trip to Las Vegas that Carnegie Deli in the Mirage Hotel and Casino existed and immediately had to try it and specifically the cheesecake.  We had the pastrami reuben to share and got a piece of our own cheesecake and we were not disappointed.  My love has returned to Las Vegas.  The food was amazing and the cheesecake exactly the same and just as wonderful as I remembered.  They only have a limited menu compared to the Carnegie Deli in New York, but it has enough choices for just about anyone who loves a good deli.

3SoYcrqVt8bAt0wyMKo6ew.text: Carnegie Deli was recommended by a few people to try while I was in New York.  Unfortunately, my schedule was packed and I couldn't make it.  Since we found out there was a Carnegie located in the Mirage Hotel, it was a perfect time to give their famous hot pastrami sandwich a try.  The chicken noodle soup ($6.99) and the chicken soup with matzo balls ($7.99) are a must order!  The noodles were small and tender.  Both soups come with a chicken soup which is flavorful and extremely comforting.  Definitely perfect for the morning after a long Vegas night.  The hot pastrami sandwich ($16.99) was a disappointment.  A large amount of pastrami is stacked between two pieces of bread (choice of rye, white, or pumpernickel) and served with a side of pickles and dijon mustard.  Though I ordered a HOT pastrami sandwich, it came out room temperature and the meat was dry.  I thought maybe I just got a dud, but my friends said the same thing after eating there a day later.   WHAT TO KNOW: *Dine in or take out (note: they're separate entrances) *Consider sharing, portions are HUGE *Breakfast served all day *Not sure on their exact hours. Their napkins say 7am-2am, but they were open around 4:30am

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hot pastrami on rye

MyF5-hAc95R6byp95Q1FrA.text: Nice friendly service with ok food but very generous portions. The price is simply out of range for the ordinary, for me its a try once. 3 stars only because the fiod was eatable and the portions are good. Not a fanatic on their pickles and dijon mustard.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Too much meat. Even for this girl.The Woody Allen

NUQfnL1PFS6S6BLPJ4q_EQ.text: Came here for the ONE and ONLY Pastrami sandwich!!!!  I enjoyed my lunch very much and the best part is, You can order a Half size of the sandwich!!!!  YES :D  There is no way I could eat a whole one...   I did have a few Yelp friends who had been here prior (Michael C, Clarence A, and Cherie T), so that was great to read their reviews/pictures first, I bookmarked it, and I am happy to say it was on my "top 10 To Eat" list in Vegas, luckily I was also staying at the Mirage which made it more convenient for me as well.  On my visit, I did look over the menu, but I still wanted the Pastrami, so I picked the half sandwich and soup combo for lunch.   Let me just say, I have never had Matzo ball soup in my life and it was soooooooo DELICIOUS,  I loved the broth!!!  I am very happy I ordered that because it complimented the sandwich perfectly.  I am a Pastrami lover, meat lover, and I thought the sandwich was great, simple, flavorful.  Rye bread, lots and lots of Pastrami, then I added on deli mustard.  My lunch also came with 2 pickles and an Iced tea for a total of $13.75.  That was such a great price!!!  You order at the register, they give you a #, go sit at any table, and your server will bring you your food/drink. I was very full and satisfied, my server was friendly, would love to come back again to Carnegie's deli :)   Had a great experience!  Next time, I'll get the Corned beef sandwich with Matzo ball soup ;)

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Don&#39;t forget the deli mustard ;)
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Don&#39;t forget the deli mustard ;)
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half sandwich/Soup Lunch $13.75

J0-tFV_A20dN4VBHmRSRnA.text: A return visit was made to Carnegie. We were served "yesterday's pastrami." It was dry The Jewish rye bread was a little tough. There was not enough moisture to affect the bread. Also slow to serve us drink refills.   My wife wished that we ate elsewhere after she tasted her pastrami  Of course, all these comments are made comparing Carnegie (Las Vegas) to what we eat in Manhattan and Brooklyn.

TOCasncXAsHHkcu2nXdPqQ.text: Well, this is a restaurant with a certain atmosphere. The service is super quick and the sandwiches - well, I know now that I am not a fan of corned beef and pastrami. My wife enjoyed it but, we sometimes differ.

y-puPlgk_E-PLeJ_DmgAOw.text: Fast paced sandwich shop in the middle of the mirage. It was a little pricey and the cashier was ok, but when someone else took my sandwich and caused me to wait the server on the floor made this ok experience an A+++! The fact that she seemed to genuinely care made all the difference to me, plus when I did get my sandwich it  was excellent.

a8q10xG-2fDbqIJqipBDjw.text: Best deli in town hands down, great service and staff always impresses. The open faced Corned Beef and Pastrami combo makes for a great dinner and a fantastic breakfast leftovers, plenty of items on the menu to indulge on.

DPkQdg1T3JpSwrB7sENF3g.text: So not only is it as overpriced as its time square parent - they're so understaffed half the tables aren't being bused in a timely manner. The rags they used to wipe down my table smells like death but at least they had a black and white cookie available.

PHQi_KQlo4cytAnaKqedyg.text: This update is in response to the message I received from Carnegie on my prior review.   The fact that it was very large is not what bothered us. The blt I had was actually quite normal sized, the turkey club was enormous.   But my problem was that the meat and bacon were both very bland and flavorless. For $60, I would expect the flavor to be good. I never in my life imagined spending that much on sandwiches and fries, but was willing to do so for the "famous Carnegie Deli." I could have spent that money on a quality dinner and not a deli sandwich.  I had to slather the sandwiches with mayo and mustard, which I generally don't like, in order to give some taste. The bacon didn't even taste cured, which I can't explain because I'm sure it was...   If it was large AND flavorful this would be a 5 star review for sure. Quality over quantity. For that cost, get better meat. :-/  Read my entire review before picking out one small note in it and acting like it was a preference thing. It wasn't.

nF7jZ3fezV7NiGR-RxJOTQ.text: While I definitely agree with the reviews that say the matzo ball sucks, I still enjoy the large portions and generally good sandwiches here.  I usually go here after work (11pm or so) when there's no line or anything so its fine.

MAuV6rJAYWOxwg6KnxgG5g.text: This place is famous for its monstrous sized salami sandwiches. We tried it before and was only able to finish less than a quarter of it.  Today, we tried Milton's smorgasbord for two. At $25.99, it included tuna, shrimp,chicken and egg salads. It is sufficient for two people. It comes as eight scoops of salads, each on top of a piece of bread. Two scoops for each kind. The bread is very sweet especially after it sucks in all the juice.   There is usually a line. Come in for lunch time is far better than the dinner wait line. Service is nice and kind.

he64Ef23Lcd9hUlbN3scEg.text: Their deserts are perfect.  The amount of meat in a sandwich is crazy.  So they are always busy so the service is slow.  Went for a quick bite at 11pm and they were still packed.  Worth the wait.

axj0hqPxdmmsE9p2gCJiJA.text: All I remember is waiting in line with my gf, drunk off Fat Tuesdays with our big ASS mugs. Probably the only ones drunk sitting down trying to get some food in our stomach hahaha! Anyways we split a sandwich, it was okay I guess. Only bonus was that we pretty much took a bunch of the meat and extra bread to our hotel so we had some good eats afterwards when we got back from a drunken night!

gOFrhDupumKT3_Zpu4LHXw.text: OMG, the sandwiches here are a mile high! How are you supposed to eat them? For the first time ever, I was eating a chicken salad sandwich with a fork and knife, haha. It's definitely enough to be shared by 2 people.  I also tried some of the breakfast, which was mediocre. The sausage was kind of burnt and too salty. The white toast however was scrumptious...I mean, it's just toasted bread...but I think that was my favorite part of the meal! Not sure if that's a good thing or not...

bBP5h6onYM6C1z5CPXxRvg.text: I ate 4 pickles. I'm not going to get into another trip down memory lane regarding Frank's Deli (RIP) but I did have some moments while I was here.   We decided to split a Reuben which came open faced, so we requested additional slices of rye.  The bread was so fresh, soft and delicious.  In the end, we formed 2 enormous sandwiches. I'm pretty surprised I didn't have a heart attack at the table. The amount of meat was insane and there were probably 4 slices of Swiss cheese melted on top. No one person could eat that whole thing, right?   Overall, the sandwich was good but the meat was fattier than I like. That didn't stop me from eating almost all of my half though. With 4 pickles.

tbUCwCGe0mZu50H4IH17zw.text: Dude this place is awesome...I didn't even know this place existed and I come to the Mirage all the time.  Carnegie's, brought over from the origional NY location to LV, copies the same style and menu and makes legit pastrami sandwiches.  $15 will get you a hot pastrami on rye and pickle....so good!  and It could last you for 2 meals.  I've been to Katz, and compared to that place, Carnegie's is up there...not exactly the same, but comparably as good.  Love the dijon mustard

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. hot pastramis...
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jeffrey&#39;s Tatallah...omfg?

lRHN_BSgkVF2tAA6LU_21A.text: This place is fantastic we had the the cormed beef and pastrami Ruben open faced not only is it big enough to share it was one of the best I ever had. Don't forget to order the potatoe pancakes they are great too. The prices per sandwich might seem to be high but there is plenty to share I am a big eater and I found half a sandwich was more then enough,

ubqDlh45BZ-VwSXH2ojjCA.text: Really  Big  Sammies!  The Carnegie Deli puts NYC to shame. After a short wait we were seated, shoulder-to-shoulder with the people at the next table. Monster-sized sandwiches were brought out in many varieties. Turkey, pastrami, ham... you name it they probably have it!  Despite this I opted for breakfast at 11 (PM of course, this is Vegas after all). It was a great choice - rich eggs and crispy bacon were the perfect cushion before an evening of fun!  Don't forget to try a pickle... you won't regret it!

4h66IiBh0AQVZseRWPYa8Q.text: I like Deli's....I really like Deli's when they're connected to where you're staying while in Vegas.  This, was one of those places.  It was open 24 hours so we could feast whenever our little hearts desired...and we desired A LOT, trust me.  Nothing like a good ol' Deli to make the good times roll through the night and day.  Try one of their famous OBESE sandwiches...you'll know it when you see the picture of it.  It's the size of my stomach, nobody could possibly fit that whole things into their mouths....oh wait....that just happened.

v8oi7aY7oIYvNGBp6G6Plg.text: We only went there for the cheesecake. I don't know if the recipe didn't travel well from Manhattan or what but I was really disappointed. It just wasn't very good. The crust wasn't up to standard...doughy but tough...how did they do that? The  cheesecake itself was OK. But the worst part...$25 for a couple of slices of cheesecake and beverages. I know I am in Las Vegas, but seriously...whiskey tango foxtrot! It's unfortunate when I can get better cheesecake at the Cheesecake Factory than Carnegie Deli. I still stop by when I'm in NYC, but I doubt I'll try this location again, anytime soon.

pfCbKGju-BFDL4_NLOC7qg.text: The pastrami isn't that great, and neither is the corned beef. The only good thing is that they pile it up high. Other than that, this place is nothing special. It's great if you're staying in the Mirage, or if you're hungry in the middle of the night, but I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here.

z2-45XzBe9ffz48hbiUpKg.text: This place makes me sick. Eat here if you're obese. When your food arrives you suddenly turn full! You're staring at at least 5 lbs of meat. Seriously that's gross. Why would you want to eat so much meat. That one sandwich could feed a family of 10. The cold cuts weren't even that great. I had way better pastrami at Safeway.   Maybe i ordered the wrong sandwich... but seriously did not enjoy my meal at all. One good thing about Carnegie is that they probably have the best fries I have ever eaten. Better than any fast food restaurant, better than the animal style fries from In n Out.

WWgQ-yPkzH5fEnfkraQ2-Q.text: Carnegie's is located in the Mirage across from California Pizza kitchen and the Sports Book. I've been a regular since it opened almost 10 years ago.  Come here for one thing - the sandwiches. They are HUGE and the best real deli corned beef and Pastrami around. In this case it's even a case of the location surpassing the original in NYC.   Would be 5 starts except the service can be spotty, especially late night.

oIoj2240gUro06j3RR7VDQ.text: Giagantic portions....much too much food......$50 for two sandwiches and a drink....much too much money

qZHC3sGgNXOOafYMgFE02Q.text: Five stars for a the outrageously yummy, and fairly priced, latkes. They were like, the best latkes I have ever had. The boyfriend had the hot pastrami sandwich. He somehow managed to eat the whole thing.   Our service was great, and honestly, where do all you price complainers eat? McDonalds? Because you are paying for a giant pile of real meat. The prices aren't that bad.  Also, our service was really great. But what really made our experience fun was just the people around us. It was a hilarious atmosphere after everyone got those gargantuan sandwiches and just looked at them, boggled.

KMQm77nG8xnw9M6P5_8YGg.text: If you are stuck in a High End resort hotel you would hope to get excellent service and food.  Well that is not the case at Carnegie.

WYbn4ZvV-H7_maD4NXts5w.text: I agree with Craig B. They reconfigured my favourite restaurant. It's now line up and pay. Only a few choices. The famous matzo ball soup is just synthetic soup mix. I called the manager and she confirmed that the chicken soup is just canned powdered soup mix made by adding water. CES the busiest time of the year. The restaurant is dead empty.. I understand why. Goodbye Carnegie.

UC2n4jlXguIXpgbCgham0Q.text: Long line and wait, crowded and loud but good deli sandwiches for sure. Just a bit too much in a sandwich for one or three! Lol. I would like option of half sandwich and soup or just half sandwiches so can try a few different ones. Maybe a sandwich sampler of minis would do the trick.

y0LvSUbFC6XxJgnZiwU5iA.text: I suppose this is a biased rating, as I'm not big on eating a mountain of meat, but geez!  There were maybe two things on the menu that didn't have meat and when the food came out, I was very glad I ordered the grilled vegetables (not that they tasted that great, but they didn't make my stomach explode.) The meat dishes were ridiculous, four to five servings on one sandwich.   The food was not very tasty, insanely expensive and extremely wasteful, as only two out of eight of our party could finish their food (and one of them wound up with a tummy ache.)  Now, if you enjoy eating until you sweat and lose the ability to move, this is the place for you, but it would be cheaper and yummier to just go to the In-and-Out.

YzIa1DquOHCsrp1A0ZaNKA.text: Pleasantly surprised Carnegie Deli served breakfast. We had the eggs w/bacon & home fries & sausage, + toast. Juice was good,  coffee so-so.  We ordered at the cashier, paid for the food,  sat ourselves down & than someone brings the drinks and food.   Total bill was $ 39,  which is expected of restaurant inside a hotel.

YfKUJ4LZgwf4vGUQCygC7w.text: Stopped in at the Carnegie deli to pick up a corned beef sandwich. We get one every time we are in Vegas. Last year when we came here we were a little disappointed in the corned beef. It seemed like the quality wasn't as lean as what we usually get. We thought maybe we had a bad batch and would give them a try next time we were in Vegas. This year we went with the corned beef again and it was excellent. The beef was very lean and the portion size is huge. There's enough for two people to easily share this sandwich. We definitely will stop in the next time we are in town.

n08UXk5FlQlyM3xxapLHXw.text: Four words:  "Ah, There's The Reuben!"   Seriously,  enough said... but, alas, it's Yelp, so you know I just have to have more to say.    This reuben sandwich here is at the top of my list of the "world's best sandwiches."  It truly is like heaven on earth... in your mouth.  And you don't have to die to eat it -- yay!    Also, this sandwich is REALLY BIG.  TREMENDOUSLY BIG.    I wouldn't call it a complaint, but I have been fortunate enough to eat at the original Carnegie Deli in NYC... and this location lacks the same vibe and ambiance of that location.  And I would have done whatever was necessary to include this in the New York New York hotel instead of the Mirage (duh!).  In summary, as long as they keep on making these sandwiches, then I will keep coming back!

NSQQGViT-pxFVFOyYAuv1Q.text: Came here twice during my stay at the Mirage. Bottom line, it was a pricey bunch of sandwiches, but worth it if you share. There's really no way I can eat a single sandwich piled with over two pounds of pastrami and corned beef, and for $22 (plus an extra $3 if you split it) it's expensive and it's not like you're going to carry around a doggy bag all day. I'd gladly pay half the price for half the food.  The BLT and the french fries were awesome. The BLT was stacked high with bacon, probably a whole pounds worth, with fresh tomatoes and crisp lettuce. It was a mess to eat, but very good. The dijon / mayo sauce they serve with the sandwich was also great and I wish I brought some home. Fries were exceptional - they were double fried so crispy on the outside and soft in the middle. Definitely a pleasant surprise to get such good french fries.  The brisket sandwich was just okay. I don't think I'd get it again. It just wasn't anything special compared to the other sandwiches I ate. Service was good, and fast. They serve kosher pickles with your order and they were great.  Sadly I did not get to try any of their desserts, which again were expensive but looked great. Next time!

i6TXNAcKFEJoMk9u5DLJFA.text: HOLY HUGE PORTIONS!  One sandwich can easily feed a kindergarten class... or 2 drunk adults! :)   High quality ingredients in a place that makes you feel like you are in the hustle and bustle of an old school NYC deli.

Dhd5uhw0pHDT4ACRN_Glxg.text: This is definitely a 5 star sandwich stop! The woody Allen and the Reuben are to die for! I don't take pictures of food but every sandwich you order is IG worthy ;)  Try it! You won't regret it!

ZNYMhv7ngb27dWQP0DzcTw.text: I used to rate this place 4 stars and I would look forward to eating here when staying in Vegas.  Over the years-  as noted by other reviewers-  I have noticed cost cutting measures that are now hurting this restaurant.  Unfortunately - the quality of the food has declined.  I visited twice this weekend.  The first visit I had corned beef and the second visit I had the pastrami.  In both cases the quality of the meat was below average and just dull.  Both times I also had the matzo ball soup.  The second time the soup fell short.  Overall I was not satisfied with the food and I felt a little sick after one meal.  For the money I now think there are better choices.  I hope the Mirage takes note and turns this place around.  It used to be a great place.  Also - bring back the bowl of pickles.

SAxNDctI35iE6kWL07UJFQ.text: Got the Lobster Roll. Bread was so soggy!! Had to pick out the lobster which was really lemony and cheap on the lobster. NOT WORTH $18.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster meat is dry and bread is really soggy.

hkSsMI7NID_tiaVryL7-eA.text: Oh hubba hubba.  I love Woody Allen.  I ain't no teenager, or female, but who gives a hoot - - you go the Carnegie Deli, you get the Woody Allen.   This was my best dining experience in the Mirage, and in Vegas overall, a deli sandwich piled high w/ corned beef and pastrami, with spicy mustard and 2 pickles.  Yeah, that simple.  First time I've ever had a sandwich where I needed more bread.  I got it to go, and while I waited I was staring at their awesome display of decadent desserts.  Oh geez, thank God I didn't have more time here, the pies and offerings looked so fabulous.   It's massive, it's tasty, it was authentic, and it was nothing less than spectacular.  You'd be selling yourself short if you didn't stop by here.  I spent a summer in NYC a while ago and this definitely brought me back.  So nostalgic.  My co-worker grew up on Queens Blvd, and he was smiling ear-to-ear after his Woody Allen experience.  And here I thought he won at the Craps table, but no, it's due to a sandwich.   It's 24/7 here too, what a bonus, now what more do you need?  Oh sure, a young hot waitress spreading on the spicy mustard on for ya.  Awww yeah.

_goP0PB8W_SwPUZByKeWQg.text: PRICEY!!!! Really now... calm down Carnegie.  Corned Beef sandwhich is HUGE and delicious, but I felt overpriced.  All sides are seperate and your bill will be expensive, for Mels-Drive-In style food.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Super bomb. Idk if its worth $20 but still super bomb

KDfLT_zgsAmx_ICdKn9ecQ.text: Ehh..  I got the pastrami with an egg on it, and while I was satisfied I highly doubt I'll go back. Gigantic portions don't make up for a lack of quality or flavor. My pastrami was a tad on the dry side and although I had enough to eat later on, I really wasn't excited to do so. The fries are good though!

-woMIKl-5ryZoI8tyXZpGg.text: I had the pastrami. The meat was delicious. Just the way i remember it in New York. Service was great. We had to go back on the tram to TI for a show. They got us out if there in 12 minutes. My only complaint was the bread. No self respecting New York baker would put their name on that. It was dry and crumbly. Only way I know to eat a pastrami is on rye. The server told me they have to work with the local bakers for bread. What a shame to put great meat on that sub par slice of bread. They would be better off to serve Oroweat Jewish Rye than the horrible stuff they put on my sandwich.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

juA9MA-URR7xaC_m_Z7B9w.text: We split the Woody Allen which was huge but don't think it was $24 huge. It is Vegas, however. Meat was delicious and the service was very good. Will definitely try the open faced Reuben next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Woody Allen split

kioZ7XOencdnu_tNCrJUTg.text: I have to say it was REALLY good.  It's in a casino, so be prepared to deal with everything that goes with going to a casino - worth it though. I ordered the Woody Allen (1/2 corned Beef, 1/2 pastrami) - you cannot finish that sandwich alone.  I seriously recommend sharing it unless you are a professional eater -  IT'S F**KIN HUGE!!!!!!!!  I really liked it,  will go back for sure.

-6gJ8xbVGhNm4JCN6VvqDg.text: Not as good as NY, but then again, I didn't order my standby, the Woody Allen.    This time around:  #1Leo's Delightin', $20.95 Triple decker turkey, corned beef, & tongue w/coleslaw & Russian dressing #14 Brisketball, $22.95 Brisket of beef & white meat turkey w/onion lettuce & tomato -Combo Matzo Ball & Noodle Soup, $8.25 Was NOT impressed, soup was not homemade, more like BOULLION.  The following are the meats I MUST stick w/to be satisfied: corned beef, roast beef, brisket & pastrami.  The turkey is similar to BUTTERBALL.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brisketball $22.95

zIm1Y6p2T3mQiPJOoermzA.text: After any drunken night, I crave soup because it's warm and seems to sooth my mind so I look at the menu and see homemade chicken broth soup and as I look down you can add matzoh balls, golden noodle, or both, so I was thinking....hmm maybe I should just ask the waiter if they have chicken noodle soup, you know the soup that comes with actual chicken, celery, and carrots, the waiter said yeah they have it, and of course, it wasn't. It was pretty much a plate of noodles, and a separate container of hot chicken broth that tasted like the soup you get from instant noodle packets...oh well.   My friends opted for their huge sandwiches (even a random customer asked if we wanted some lol) which run for about $20+, now picture you're holding a sandwich, now extend your fingers as far as you can, it's bigger than that, so obiously first instinct you think of, "ya I can probably share this" then you look back at the menu and realize they charge you $3 extra for sharing...lolwat. Oh yeah, extra bread is extra.  Other than that, service was good, and they have some pickles for you when you sit down.

Za7rYllOeAmr19VypxdMsw.text: Yo Yo Ma!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! quoting Cosmo Kramer, wow this place is good !!!! Simple ingredients leads to extraordinary food . Got the hot pastrami ($16.99) ( yelp.com/biz_photos/zU9w... ) Just literally meat and bread wow so tasty and massive! Each bite of this well prepared sandwich was excellent , also comes with some fries . Every other bite shot on some of there house mustard and bit into one of there delicious pickle's wow .( yelp.com/biz_photos/zU9w... ) Left this facsimile of a N.Y deli with my belly extended and a nap to follow.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Excellent pickles
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. hot pastrami
Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. hot pastrami

uedO3ScBYr-0-faatpDduQ.text: When you're highly intoxicated, or at least trying to recover from extreme intoxication, everything tastes good.  That wasn't the case with this place.  I ordered a steak with some of their popular corned beef on the side, and I just didn't like what I was eating.  A friend of mine said I ordered "the wrong thing" and should've stuck with a sandwich.  But what the heck, steak and corned beef?  Isn't that supposed to automatically be good?  Took a to-go box home, and I didn't even pick at it. I left it at the hotel.  That's $20 I could've easily used on 100 McNuggets.  Or a cheap escort.

YNmmsHJ_iToVM5pD_9cHVA.text: Food came out cold twice but Jessica was an awesome server and ensured our meal was hot. Food is still good portions just a tad bit smaller that last time I was here.

AGPbIBU9Ej2RPn4taEo5iw.text: SERVICE SUCKS. Came on a Sat night to order to-go and the cashier was rude as ever. If he didn't feel like working at that moment, he should've gone a break and not take it out on customers. Food was good, except the terrible service left a bad taste in my mouth. Ordered the Woody Allen (pastrami and corned beef), which was good. Don't expect a fancy sandwich with condiments. It's just purely meat and VERY thin slices of bread. Get some extra horse radish and enjoy the sandwich with their pickles. Hope you don't get the rude cashier!!

-u2153_BYCz9tBU-IEahYQ.text: I got a turkey on rye - huge sandwich, great meat, crisp lettuce, super fresh rye bread - check.   Got a side of potato salad - hands down the worst potato salad I have ever had, and that includes the yucky kind from the grocery store.  I can't believe they serve this in a bonafide deli and charge you $5 for it?  Half of the potatoes weren't cooked, the others were mush and the "dressing" was like watered down mayo.  The sandwich was pricey too, but it was at least a good quality and a large size that can easily be split.

7bdLqzWI_w9m7Tjrb-kI7Q.text: I love my delis and this is the best on The Strip.   Prices are high (most jewish-style delis are, because of food costs with regards to the meats-read "Save The Deli" by David Sax if you are a deli-lover), but as others have said, pay the $3 sharing fee.  We split a brisket sandwich (on rye, of course)  and an order of potato pancakes, and still it was too much food for 2. But oh-so-good! And I did eat all of the complimentary pickles.  $30 bucks with a couple of drinks and we were stuffed.

Tt8bNtQUzgMayPKKUop8EA.text: My wife and I ordered a hot pastrami sandwich to split. The restaurant only had four customers and there was four waitstaff. Service was slow and I noticed that a sandwich sat up on the counter for about 10 minutes it turned out that that was our sandwich. The sandwich was cold, the pastrami was grizzly,  the large pickles were like rubber, they had a different flavor than any pickle I've tasted.  After leaving we realized that we should have sent it back.

15hDON1Zxt8jQBBSoV7YWQ.text: Sandwiches are way to big.  Plus nothing but meat and bread, was sick of it only a few bites in.  I had the pastrami and my brother had the brisket.  He also said the brisket was dry.

ZbxF-2O4RZMiFPDr-kR4Sw.text: So many Carnegie haters!  Really?  I'm an East Coaster living in Northern California.  You want marginal deli food?  We've got it for you, in abundance!  But ah, when I get to Vegas, I know I'm going to have kosher dill pickles and  Carnegie Deli cheesecake.  I could care less about the gargantuan sanwiches or the lobby coffee shop atmosphere.  It doesn't even bother me that the nearest restroom is 10 billion miles away.  What matters is the cheesecake.  The touch decision?  Strawberry or rugalech?  Through my amazing power of persuasion (bullying, perhaps) I manage to convince my travel companion to order the other.  SO SO SO SO SO SO GOOD.  Cheesecake heaven.  Seriously.  This is the only time I *EVER* order milk, anywhere.  It's a simple equation, really.  Water and pickles, milk and cheesecake.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. cheesecake and pickles!

UuXDhFP-WcEFEc3UD4NXfw.text: I knew from the moment i walked by this place i had to eat there and it was going to be great. the smell just draws you to it. i love the smell of an old style deli.  so i got the foot long hot dog and it was awesome. my friend Tim got the woody Allen, oh my god that's the biggest sandwich i had ever seen. he was eating that thing for the rest of our weekend.  great place to eat when your in Vegas. not pricey at all, my hot dog was around 6 bucks, so i think next time i will just order two, lol.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. the foot long. wow.

wplJIxVy4ot1DrIsfm-TBg.text: I've been to this Carnegie Deli several times now.  I actually like it better than the one in New York!  My boyfriend discovered the very best thing on the menu to order... Jeff's Favorite (I think that's the name).  It is a potato knish topped with your choice of pastrami or corned beef, topped with melted swiss cheese.  OMG.  It is so amazing.  The potato knish is a hundred times better than having bread!  And it's huge.  Unless you have a HUGE appetite, split with someone... plus it's $24.99.

_ZoBB3cqRMmNz33HluZfwg.text: Became our go-to place within our hotel!   Here's why:  - Great prices (the cheapest in the Mirage) - Fast (like SUPER fast) service - Open 24 hours - Great people watching - Also a visual arts exhibition: all the photos of the celebrities who have eaten at Carnegie's over the years - it's worth eating here once just to look at these!  The two stars are lost because it's so small and loud, that TWICE the server we got could not speak English enough to provide adequate service, because I had to send a bagel & cream cheese back because it wasn't toasted, and because their breakfast eggs, bacon & home fries were absolutely disgusting. Bland, poorly prepared and extremely overpriced for what you get, especially compared to the other menu items.

CWuOknOsTO37e3jx2K0Smg.text: Order the pastrami. Pretty tasty with pickles and mustard. The cheesecake is a must try.

-5fDQi3EdxJIWylF5sQaMg.text: Update the sandwhiches are still rock solid here but they have had some service problems on my last two visits.  They aren't using a very good turket these days either.  Hands down the best Deli in Las Vegas, and one of the best in the Western United States.  The Reuben here is legendary. Understated on the menu, but good luck on finishing it'! Do yourself a favor--  don't delve into researching it too much, Carnegie's take on the Reuben is exaggerated, excessive, extra ordinary, over blown, and over executed, it's a masterpiece. Let it be a surprise.   My gripe would be the turkey they serve here. It's above average, but it pales in comparison to the outstanding corned beef and pastram, which is as superior as any in the country.   The diner style dishes are prepared fresh, things like Meat Loaf, fried chicken, open faced burgers are superb.   Breakfast is excellent, and reminiscent of what you'd find at any great Manhattan deli.  All the bread is fresh baked on the premises, and the service is quick.***brutally busy at times, sometimes it's smart to show a little green to the hostess.   At the Mirage near the Sports Book Free Parking Recommended  20$ a person is the average check. NOT A DISCOUNT SANDWICH DESTINATION  MASSIVE portions that are boxed easily, if you're a guest at the Mirage, take that sammy back and shove it in the fridge.  Kids will like dining so close to the slots and sports book. Their parents might not.

psyl_ePVLkz3yiP0KtAWhQ.text: Desserts at the Carnegie Deli are absolutely to die for!! We stay at the Mirage and pickup a slice of Pie or Cake to share while winding down in the room each night/morning. They have a take-out service on the side of the deli that showcases the desserts. The worst thing about this convenience? Picking which one to take with you.  The price seems a little high - $9 to $10 a piece, but the height of the pie or cake and the size of the slice make it we'll worth the price. Like the sandwiches, the deli prides themselves on the huge portion size.

k4kWCv5mFPXsHplvywiU6Q.text: Who would have thought New York's famous deli would be sitting inside the casino of the Mirage? It is True, smack in the center of the casino across from the Beatles Cirque  theatre sits this spacious spot looking pretty similar, with fast friendly service and an exact menu from the New York original. The selection ranges from all day greasy breakfast to a selection of gigantic open faced sandwiches and some entrees. I opted to order the Rueben which when it was delivered took up the entire plate and was huge! Loaded with cheese and about at least a pound and a half of Corned beef and sauerkraut laying on a large rye slab of bread, this was unreal. It was so large, I could only finish half and it was delicious! Wash it down with a beer and a pickle and it hit the spot with fast enough service and a nice price to hit the show within 45 minutes of being seated this place was a winner!

Slr7wFcRqKSXD2fgjppiAw.text: The one thing that stands out about Carnegie is the humongous, ungodly portions. Seriously, check out the photos others have posted here on Yelp. Everything is really at least two portions, sometimes three or four. If you're wise, when you're with another person, you'll order a single dish. You two can split it and probably still have leftovers (if you're in a room with a fridge). The prices are high, but when you realize that each dish is at least two full meals, it seems reasonable.  I had the tongue omelet. It was monstrous. Two omelets in one. Could not finish it even though it was delish. My gf had the BLT. This was probably four sandwiches in one. I honestly wouldn't be surprised if it contained an entire pound of bacon. She didn't even come close to finishing it although she liked it.  Our server was super friendly while also moving nonstop and multitasking her a-- off. A man who looked a little like Humphrey Bogart was also speeding around. They contributed to the authentic NYC deli atmosphere, which was broken only by the blinking, chirping gambling devices just beyond the railing.

dTt2T4Z-aozXEgoqcaOOeA.text: If you come here expecting deli food at the same level as the Carnegie Deli in NY (or most deli's in NY for that matter) you'll be severely disappointed. I went here twice during my last Vegas trip and the food was just okay. Tongue sandwich the first time and the Woody Allen the second time (which is a GINORMOUS sandwich consisting of pastrami and corn beef).   If you're drunk and hungry this will hit the spot, but overall it's nothing special.

BTxIZQGMyW386EiKLyMTZQ.text: Stop in for a Cheesecake...and then leave.  The awesome cheesecake is what turns this 2 star joint into a 3 star.  If you're a cheesecake lover, prepare yourself for cheesecake bliss.  If you're a deli sandwich lover, prepare yourself for a big pile of average, grocery store quality plainness.  I was expecting sandwiches on the level of Brent's Deli (Northridge, CA) but am sorry to say I was disappointed.  Service is slow, even for a busy place.  My party arrived close to midnight, plenty of servers running around, but plenty of disappearing acts as well.   Next time I'm in the Mirage, I'm stopping in for a cheesecake to go.

hvhdf5PGe57bgyQMm6dP5A.text: I always try to make it over here for some deli on a Vegas trip. The Mr. has never had Carnegie before so it was a must.   Yeah yeah, it is nothing like the real thing in NYC but for being in Vegas this place is pretty damn good and I just like it.   The black and whites are much better at Canter's in LA but damn who doesn't love a black and white.

90LzO6azJUJCc0dEkMyaCw.text: The pastrami and corned beef sandwiches were mehhhh, okay. Everything was kinda dry and even the pickles didn't seem fresh and crispy. Portions are big, the service was good, and it wasn't hard to get a table so it was okay.  Katz's Delicatessen in NYC is way better! The meat makes all the difference.

_gO5kIbYNnalnipPtAz0Gg.text: Not even worthy of 1 star. Went to Carnegie this morning because we were salivating for the Carnegie experience. Boy did we get a very unpleasant surprise. They have downsized their staff to create a order at the register and someone will bring you your food. NO pickles on the table anymore. Portions are half the size and the food quality has gone down hill. Carnegie is a legend. Why would any intelligent entity mess with a legend that has worked for decades. The only bright star of our breakfast was our server. He deserved 5 stars. We will not be back. Disappointed beyond words.

YOJEki5mR4zUZ4VSqfWgLA.text: It's supposed to be like the Carnegie deli in NYC.  Not close.  It's located conveniently by the sportsbook at the Mirage and open late, 24 hrs maybe?  Either way, the rye bread which came with Pastrami was dry and uneventful.  The pastrami was good and it made for 2 1/2 meals, when I took it home.  All in all, I would not make an effort to eat here.  Breaks my heart, because I want all of NYC restaurants to succeed here in Las Vegas (Rao's, Bobby Flay's etc..)  I cannot recommend.

Hy0BDcOEDWs4bpt2feQikw.text: The Carnegie Deli is a perfect fit in Las Vegas.....over the top and expensive. OK, I get the mile high piles of meat on a sandwich deli thing but my friends BLT was absolutely gross. The was a 1 and a half inch layer of greasy bacon that made my stomach ache by looking at it. My corned beef was good as expected but still overkill.  We stood in line at the hostess station waiting to be seated. There were several empty tables but we were made to wait so a line would form further behind us to make the place seem a little more special.  The place is crazy expensive, our 2 sandwiches, a single order of fries and 2 sodas was over $50.
